603 161441 41116 83016 2 402 405 rpld 603 rpld 906 907 rpld 911 added 911 part ii  code of ordinances general provisions citation of ordinances embraced in the following chapters and sections shall constitute and be designated the ordinances of the city of casselberry florida and may be so cited 01 definitions and rules of construction in the construction of this of all ordinances of the city the following definitions and rules of construction shall be observed unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city commission acts by agents when any provision of this an act to be done which may by law be done by an agent as well as by the principal the requirement shall be construed to include all such acts when done by an authorized agent charter the word charter shall mean the charter of the city of casselberry printed as of this volume city the term city means the city of casselberry florida word  shall mean the ordinances of casselberry florida as cited in of this city commission the terms commission and city commission mean the city commission of the city of casselberry computation of time whenever a notice is required to be given or an act to be done a certain length of time before any proceeding shall be had the day on which such notice is given or such act is done shall not be counted in computing the time but the day on which such proceeding is to be had shall be counted if the last day is a saturday sunday or legal holiday such period shall continue to the next following day which is not a saturday sunday or legal holiday state law reference computation of time fla r civ pro rule a county the term county means seminole county florida fs the abbreviation fs shall mean the latest edition or supplement of the florida statutes gender a word importing the masculine or feminine gender only shall extend and be applied to males and females and to firms partnerships and corporations associations joint ventures estates trusts business trusts syndicates fiduciaries and all other groups and combinations joint authority unless otherwise specifically provided all words giving a joint authority to three or more persons or officers shall be construed as giving such authority to a majority of such persons or officers keeper proprietor and owner the words keeper proprietor and owner except as regards ownership of land shall mean and include persons firms associations corporations clubs and copartnerships whether acting by themselves or as a servant agent or employee month the word month shall mean a calendar month number a word importing the singular number only may extend and be applied to several persons or things as well as to one person or thing and a word importing the plural number may extend and be applied to a single person or thing oath the word oath shall be construed to include an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed officer department board commission etc reference to any officer department board commission or similar body shall mean any officer department board commission or similar body of the city of casselberry unless otherwise specified or and or may be read and and and may be read or if the sense requires it owner the word owner applied to a building or land shall include any part owner joint owner tenant in common tenant in partnership joint tenant or tenant by the entirety of the whole or of a part of such building or land person the word person shall extend and be applied to associations firms partnerships joint adventures estates trusts syndicates fiduciaries and bodies politic and corporate as well as to individuals personal property the term personal property includes every type of property except real property as herein defined preceding following the words preceding and following mean next before and next after respectively property the word property shall include real and personal property public place the term public place includes any park public rightsofway public easements cemetery schoolyard or open space adjacent thereto and any lake or stream real property the words real property shall include lands tenements and hereditaments registered mail the term registered mail includes certified mail with return receipt requested shall may shall is mandatory and may is permissive sidewalk the word sidewalk shall mean any portion of a street between the curbline and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians excluding parkways signature or subscription the word signature or subscription includes a mark when the person cannot write state the word state shall be construed to mean the state of florida street the word street shall be construed to embrace streets avenues boulevards roads alleys lanes viaducts causeways and all other public highways in the city and it shall also be construed to include a sidewalk or footpath unless the contrary is expressed or unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city commission tenant or occupant the word tenant or occupant applied to a building or land shall include any person holding a written or oral lease of or who occupies the whole or a part of such building or land either alone or with others tense words used in the past or present tense include the future as well as the past and present written or in writing written or in writing shall be construed to include any representation of words letters or figures whether by printing or otherwise year the word year shall mean a calendar year except where otherwise provided 02 1003 1009 state law reference similar provisions fs  101 catchlines of sections the captions of the several sections of this at the head of each section are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and shall not be deemed or taken to be titles of the sections or any part of the section nor unless expressly so provided shall they be so deemed when any of the sections including the catchlines are amended or reenacted 04 effect of repeal of ordinances a the repeal of an ordinance shall not revive any ordinances in force before or at the time the ordinance repealed took effect b the repeal of an ordinance shall not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal took effect or any suit prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the repeal for an offense committed under the ordinance repealed 05 severability the sections paragraphs sentences clauses and phrases of this severable and if any phrase clause sentence paragraph or section of this be declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by the valid judgment or decree of any court of competent jurisdiction the unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect any of the remaining phrases clauses sentences paragraphs and sections of this since the provisions would have been enacted by the city commission without the incorporation in this any unconstitutional or invalid phrase clause sentence paragraph or section 06 amendments to a all ordinances passed subsequent to the adoption of this amend repeal or in any way affect any section or subsection of this be numbered consecutively and shall refer specifically to the section or subsection affected and shall be printed for inclusion in the subsequent ordinances repeal any chapter section or subsection or any portion thereof the repealed portions shall be excluded from this omission from reprinted pages the subsequent ordinances as numbered and printed or omitted in the case of repeal shall be prima facie evidence of the subsequent ordinances until the time that this subsequent ordinances numbered or omitted are readopted as a new ordinances by the city b amendments to any of the provisions of this be made by amending the provisions by specific reference to the section number of this the following manner of the ordinances of the city of casselberry florida is hereby amended to read as follows  the new provisions shall then be set out in full c if a new section not heretofore existing in this to be added the following language may be used the ordinances of the city of casselberry florida is hereby amended by adding a new section to be numbered which read as follows  the new section shall then be set out in full d all sections articles chapters or other provisions desired to be repealed may be specifically repealed by section article or chapter number in the following language  ____________ of the ordinances of the city of casselberry florida is hereby repealed 07 supplementation of a by contract or by city personnel supplements to this be prepared and printed whenever authorized or directed by the city commission a supplement to the include all substantive permanent and general parts of ordinances passed by the city commission or adopted by initiative and referendum during the period covered by the supplement and all changes made thereby in the shall also include all amendments to the charter during the period the pages of a supplement shall be so numbered that they will fit properly into the will where necessary replace pages that have become obsolete or partially obsolete and the new pages shall be so prepared that when they have been inserted the be current date of the adoption of the latest ordinance included in the supplement b in preparing a supplement to this all portions of the have been repealed shall be excluded from the the omission thereof from reprinted pages c when preparing a supplement to this codifier meaning the person authorized to prepare the supplement may make formal nonsubstantive changes in ordinances and parts of ordinances included in the supplement insofar as it is necessary to do so to embody them into a unified code for example the codifier may 1 organize the ordinance material into appropriate subdivisions 2 provide appropriate catchlines headings and titles for sections and other subdivisions of the in the supplement and make changes in catchlines headings and titles 3 assign appropriate numbers to sections and other subdivisions to be inserted in the where necessary to accommodate new material change existing section or other subdivision numbers 4 change the words this ordinance or words of the same meaning to this  this  this division etc as the case may be or to  the inserted section numbers will indicate the sections of the embody the substantive sections of the ordinance incorporated into the 5 make other nonsubstantive changes necessary to preserve the original meaning of ordinance sections inserted into the   but in no case shall the codifier make any change in the meaning or effect of ordinance material included in the supplement or already embodied in the   unauthorized alteration of person in the city without proper authority shall change or amend by additions or deletions any part or portion of this or insert or delete pages or portions of the or alter or tamper with this any manner whatsoever which will cause the law of the city to be misrepresented thereby 08 correction of errors and omissions in a manifest error is discovered in the of the misspelling of any word the omission of any word necessary to express the intention of the provisions affected the use of a word to which no meaning can be attached or the use of a word when another word was clearly intended to express such intent such spelling shall be corrected and such words supplied omitted or substituted as will conform with the manifest intention and the provision shall have the same effect as though the correct words were contained in the text as originally published no alteration shall be made or permitted if any question exists regarding the nature or extent of such error 10 repeal of prior ordinances this from and after its effective date shall contain all of the provisions of a general nature pertaining to the subjects enumerated and embraced in the prior ordinances pertaining to the subjects treated by this be deemed repealed from and after the effective date of this 11 certain ordinances not affected by in this the ordinance adopting this be construed to repeal or otherwise affect the validity of any of the following when not inconsistent with this 1 any offense or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred before the effective date of this 2 any ordinance or resolution promising or guaranteeing the payment of money for the city or authorizing the issue of any bonds of the city or any evidence of the citys indebtedness or any contract right agreement lease deed or other instrument or obligation assumed by the city 3 any administrative ordinances or resolutions of the city not in conflict or inconsistent with the provisions of this 4 any right or franchise granted by any ordinance 5 any ordinance or resolution dedicating naming establishing locating relocating opening paving widening repairing vacating etc any street or public way in the city 6 any appropriation ordinance 7 any ordinance levying or imposing taxes 8 any ordinance prescribing parking and traffic regulations speed limits oneway traffic limitations on load of vehicles or loading zones 9 any zoning or rezoning ordinance or amendment to the zoning map 10 any ordinance establishing and prescribing the street grades of any street in the city 11 any ordinance providing for local improvements and assessing taxes therefor 12 any ordinance dedicating or accepting any plat or subdivision in the city 13 any ordinance annexing territory or excluding territory or any ordinance extending the boundaries of the city 14 any ordinance establishing positions classifying positions setting salaries of city officers and employees or any personnel regulations 15 any temporary or special ordinances 16 any provision of laws of fla ch 651351 as amended or any special act provision which has been converted to ordinances by fs   which has not been superseded or repealed or is not inconsistent with this 17 any ordinance establishing land use regulations such ordinances are hereby recognized as continuing in full force and effect to the same extent as if set out at length herein 12 ordinances and regulations saved from repeal whenever an ordinance by its nature either authorizes or enables the legislative body or a certain municipal officer or employee to make additional ordinances or regulations for the purpose of carrying out the intent of the ordinance all ordinances and regulations of a similar nature serving such purpose effected prior to the effective date of this not inconsistent with this remain in effect and are saved from repeal 13 general penalty  continuing violations  violations declared nuisance  posting of bond  attorneys fees and costs a whenever in this in any other ordinance or resolution of the city or in any rule regulation or order promulgated by any officer or agency of the city under authority duly vested in him any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or an offense where no specific penalty is provided therefor the violation of such provision of this any other ordinance or resolution of the city or rule regulation or order shall be punished by a fine not exceeding $50000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 60 days or both a fine and imprisonment b except where otherwise provided every day that any violation of this any other ordinance or resolution of the city or rule regulation or order shall continue shall constitute a separate offense c in addition to the penalties provided in this any condition caused or permitted to exist in violation of any of the provisions of this any other ordinance resolution rule regulation or order shall be deemed a public nuisance and may be abated by the city as provided by law and each day that the condition continues shall be regarded as a new and separate offense d persons arrested for violations of the when appropriate may post a bond of not less than $10000 for each violation e in addition to and supplemental to any other provision of this the city shall be entitled as a prevailing party to recover reasonable attorneys fees and costs incurred in any legal proceeding brought by the city to enforce any provision of this all appellate proceedings 99   92203 charter reference power of city to enforce ordinances  8o administration footnotes  1  charter reference form of government city commission  922  elections art vii cross reference emergency management ch 30  reimbursement for extraordinary expenses  3051 et seq  emergency services ch 34  law enforcement ch 54  personnel ch 62  planning and development ch 66  taxation ch 78  utilities ch 86  unified land development regulations state law reference formation of local governments fs   article i  in general amendment of budget  exceeding budget a any amendments modifications or alterations of the annual city budget or of any rights and obligations of the city may be approved at any regular or special meeting of the city commission by a resolution duly adopted by the affirmative vote of a majority of the city commission so as to implement the appropriate expenditures of revenue b a record of all proceedings amending modifying or altering an approved budget shall be prepared by the city clerk at the regular or special meeting this record shall be attached to the original annual budget resolution and become an original counterpart of the budget subject to inspection by the public and any other persons that are duly authorized to make inspection of the financial records of the city c no warrants or obligations against the city shall be drawn in excess of the appropriations made in accordance with the annual city budget 02 fee for dishonored checks presented to city the city shall collect in addition to all other charges or penalties imposed by law the service fee authorized under fs  832085 or five percent of the face amount of any check draft or order whichever is greater for the collection of any dishonored check draft or order presented for payment of money to the city this service fee shall be in addition to all other penalties imposed by law 07  i 81699 state law reference similar provisions fs   planning the city commission shall cause to be developed and adopt a comprehensive master plan to provide for the mapped definition of zoning ordinances and for the projected orderly growth of the municipality in a series of steps to achieve determined community growth and goals laws of fla ch 651351  65   11182 cross reference planning and development ch 66  unified land development regulations zoning the city is vested with all powers set forth in the florida statutes with reference to municipal zoning the city commission shall cause to be prepared zoning ordinances regulations and maps together with amendments thereto if and when necessary zoning ordinances adopted shall so far as possible be related to the comprehensive master plan designed to provide for the orderly and desirable growth of the city laws of fla ch 651351  66   11182 cross reference planning and development ch 66  unified land development regulations community redevelopment trust fund a there is hereby established and created in accordance with the provisions of the act a community redevelopment trust fund the fund for the community redevelopment area which fund shall be utilized and expended for the purposes of and in accordance with the plan including any amendments or modifications thereto approved by the city commission including any community redevelopment as that term is defined in fs  9 under the plan b the monies to be allocated to and deposited into the fund shall be used to finance community redevelopment within the area according to tax increment revenues attributed to the area which shall be appropriated for the agency the agency shall utilize the funds and revenues paid into and earned by the fund for community redevelopment purposes as provided in the plan and as permitted by law the fund shall exist for the duration of the community redevelopment undertaken by the agency pursuant to the plan to the extent permitted by the act monies shall be held in the fund by the city for and on behalf of the agency and disbursed from the fund as provided by the agency c commencing in the tax year 200 there shall be paid into the fund each year by the city of casselberry as the taxing authority as that term is defined in fs  2 levying ad valorem taxes within the community redevelopment area a sum equal to 95 percent of the incremental increase in ad valorem taxes levied each year by the taxing authority as calculated in accordance with the act based on the base tax year established in such annual sum being hereinafter referred to as the tax increment d the most recent tax roll used in connection with the taxation of property prior to the effective date of this be the preliminary assessment roll of taxable real property in seminole county florida prepared by the property appraiser of seminole county florida and filed with the department of revenue pursuant to fs   199 reflecting valuation of real property for purposes of ad valorem taxation as of  the base year value and all deposits into the fund shall be in the amount of tax increment calculated as provided in e below based upon increases in valuation of taxable real property from the base year value e the tax increment shall be determined and appropriated annually by the taxing authority and commencing in the tax year 200 shall be an amount equal to 95 percent of the differences between 1 that amount of ad valorem taxes levied each year by all taxing authorities on taxable real property within the geographic boundaries in the community redevelopment area  and 2 that amount of ad valorem taxes which would have been produced by the rate upon which the tax is levied each year by or for all taxing authorities upon the total of the assessed value of the taxable real property in the community redevelopment area as shown upon the assessment roll used in connection with the taxation of such property by all taxing authorities prior to the effective date of this f the taxing authority shall annually appropriate to and cause to be deposited in the fund the tax increment determined pursuant to the act and e above at the beginning of each fiscal year thereof as provided in the act the obligation of the taxing authority to annually appropriate the tax increment for deposit in the fund shall commence immediately upon the effective date of this continue to the extent permitted by the act so long as any indebtedness pledging increment revenue has been paid g the fund shall be established and maintained as a separate trust fund by the agency so that the fund may be promptly and effectively administered and utilized by the agency expeditiously and without undue delay for its statutory purpose pursuant to the plan h the governing body of the agency shall be the trustees of the fund and shall be responsible for the receipt custody disbursement accountability management investments and proper application of all monies paid into the fund i the potential consolidation of the casselberry community redevelopment agency with other community redevelopment areas in a multijurisdictional community redevelopment agency shall be optional with regard to the city of casselberry all documents of creation and implementation of the community redevelopment agency shall provide for the contingent future transfer of any and all projects programs assets property funds obligations and liabilities to seminole county andor a multijurisdictional or countywide community redevelopment agency established by seminole county  provided however that any funds on account at the time of termination expiration or dissolution of the city of casselberry community redevelopment agency that are not encumbered or pledged as security for any indebtedness shall be transferred to the city of casselberry for use as the city of casselberry deems fit within the proposed city of casselberry central city district  provided further however that any real or personal property that has been purchased with community redevelopment agency funds shall become the property of the city of casselberry unless pledged or encumbered j as provided in seminole county resolution no 98r181 commencing in the tax year 199 70 percent of the increment revenues derived by seminole county for those properties located within the casselberry community redevelopment agencys redevelopment area shall be appropriated by seminole county and deposited in the casselberry community redevelopment agency trust fund in accordance with fs   1997 such increment revenues when deposited into the trust fund may be used by the casselberry community redevelopment agency in a manner consistent with its redevelopment plan and with general law any such funds may be pledged as collateral for the repayment of bond revenues consistent with fs ch 163 pt iii 1997 and general law this funding shall continue existing term of the casselberry redevelopment plan  121195  i ii 101998   2 4300 reimbursement of attorneys fees and costs a intent as used in the balance of this the words successfully defend or prevail shall apply to individual counts charges andor allegations and shall mean the dismissal the finding of not guilty or a verdict in favor of the person covered herein as set forth in c a failure to successfully defend or prevail against one or more counts charges or allegations shall not necessarily affect the application of this other counts charges andor allegations which were successfully defended or against which the officer or employee prevailed b definitions reasonable attorneys fees shall mean fees earned by an attorney andor attorneys licensed to practice law in the state of florida based on the customary per hour rate charged in seminole county florida for similar work performed by attorneys within the county c subject to g the city commission shall pursuant to the procedures set forth herein reimburse present and former city commissioners and city public officers and their present and former employees and agents including appointees of the commission or such officers for the reasonable attorneys fees and costs that such persons have incurred when they successfully defend or prevail in civil criminal andor ethical investigations andor actions that arise out of and in connection with their scope of city employment and city function while acting in their official capacity and while serving a public purpose the city commissioners shall determine if the attorneys fees and costs shall be reimbursed and if so in what amount d any person who believes that he or she is allowed or entitled to payment for reasonable attorneys fees and costs pursuant to the provisions of this file within 30 days of conclusion of the matter a written request for such fees and costs with the city attorney which request shall at the minimum state 1 the name and current address of the person making the request  2 a description of the entity conducting the investigation or proceeding  3 the case number or file number of the investigation or proceeding if known  4 a description of each count charge andor allegation made or being investigated  5 the dates of the occurrences  6 the persons office or position of employment with the city on the dates described in 5 above  7 a narration of the reasons why such person believes that the request meets the criteria set forth in this that his or her attorneys fees and costs should be reimbursed by the city  8 the names address and telephone number of the attorneys representing such person against the counts charges andor allegations described in 4 above  9 a description of the fee arrangement or agreement between the person and his or her attorneys  the amount of attorneys fees and costs paid to the date of the written request for attorneys fees and costs for defense against the counts charges andor allegations described in 4 above  and the total balance due if any of all attorneys fees and costs that have been incurred in defense against the counts charges andor allegations described in 4 above  and 10 such other information as the city commissioners andor the city attorneys office may reasonably require e within a reasonable time following receipt of the written request for payment of attorneys fees and costs the city attorney in conjunction with the mayor and city manager shall prepare and present an agenda item for consideration by the city commission in the agenda item for the commissions consideration the city attorney shall include a recommendation on the applicability of this the request for payment of attorneys fees and costs the commission may 1 request additional relevant information from the applicant  2 continue the request to a date and time certain  or 3 take action upon the written request and determine if the attorneys fees and costs shall be reimbursed and if so in what amount f upon receipt of the written request the city attorney shall also communicate with the citys insurance providers to determine and advise the commission whether such insurance providers will indemnify the city for any attorneys fees and costs incurred by the applicant in defense against such counts charges or allegations g notwithstanding anything to the contrary stated or implied herein this not address or pertain to recall proceedings or to employee discipline or termination proceedings in the event such recall discipline or termination proceedings occur concurrently with the issues andor proceedings described above such recall discipline or termination proceedings shall not affect the application of this the above described nonrecall nondiscipline or nontermination issues or proceedings  101303 cross reference general penalty attorneys fees and  113 secs 27234  reserved article ii  city commission footnotes  2  cross reference authority and duties of city commission regarding planning and zoning  6631 division 1  generally election procedures a generally pursuant to of the city charter the city commission hereby provides for election procedures to ensure the secrecy of the ballot and integrity of the poll for all city elections b conduct of elections the city clerk shall coordinate the conduct of all city elections with the seminole county supervisor of elections all city elections shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of state law c printing of ballots the city clerk shall coordinate the printing of ballots for any city election with the seminole county supervisor of elections in accordance with the provisions of state law d absentee procedures the city clerk shall coordinate absentee ballot procedures with the seminole county supervisor of elections in accordance with the provisions of state law e canvass of returns the seminole county canvassing board shall canvass the returns of all city elections in accordance with the provisions of state law f electronic filing of campaign finance reports required all candidates for elected office in the city of casselberry shall electronically file their campaign treasurers reports required by state law utilizing the seminole county supervisor of elections offices electronic filing system  72808   121409  i 12913 election of members of city commission a generally candidates for the office of city commission seats 1 inclusive shall file qualify and run at large for a specifically numbered seat and shall be elected to office by a majority of the votes cast for that seat in the election b runoff election  unopposed candidates 1 the candidate for any office receiving the majority of votes cast shall be elected if there should be more than two candidates for any office and no one candidate receives a majority of the votes cast in the municipal election held pursuant to of the city charter or in the event of a tie vote then the two candidates receiving the highest votes in the first election shall run again in a runoff election to be held on the tuesday after the first monday in november the runoff election shall be held in the same manner as the prior election the candidate receiving the majority of the votes cast at such runoff election shall be elected in the event of a tie vote at the runoff election the tie will be dissolved by a lottery pursuant to state statute 2 if not more than one person is qualified as a candidate for any particular office the unopposed candidate for that office shall not appear on the general election ballot and each unopposed candidate shall be deemed to have voted for himself if no eligible office draws opposed candidates in a particular election then no election shall be held the nonopposed candidate shall be certified elected and take office in accordance with the requirements of the charter and general law on the date candidates in a contested election would be certified and take office 05 3006   72808 state law reference election campaign and voting regulations fs   et seq vacancy in candidacy for city commission a special election  supplemental qualifying period 1 if the death withdrawal or removal from the ballot of a qualified city commission candidate following the end of the qualifying period results in only one candidate or no candidate remaining for that office a special election shall be scheduled by the city commission not less than 60 days and not more than 120 days after the vacancy in the candidacy has occurred 2 a supplemental qualifying period shall be established beginning on the day the vacancy in the candidacy has occurred and ending at noon on the 46th day prior to the date of the special election any candidate wishing to qualify during this supplemental qualifying period shall comply with the requirements of of the city charter prior to the end of the supplemental qualifying period 3 the one candidate remaining for the seat shall not be required to requalify for election the remaining candidate shall not be declared an unopposed candidate under fs ch 106 unless no additional candidate qualifies for election during the supplemental qualifying period the remaining candidate may continue to accept contributions until declared unopposed if the remaining candidate is declared unopposed pursuant to this the remaining candidate shall be declared elected and the special election shall be canceled b filing of campaign expense statements the filing of campaign expense statements pursuant to fs ch 106 by candidates in a special election called under a of this including the remaining candidate shall not be later than such dates as fixed by the city clerk in fixing such dates the city clerk shall take into consideration and be governed by the practical time limitations and the dates established for such statements in a regular city election c supplemental absentee ballots if a special election is called pursuant to a of this other candidates qualify for election during the supplemental qualifying period supplemental absentee ballots for the special election shall be mailed to any absentee voter who was mailed an absentee ballot for the regular election if an absentee voter returns the initial ballot that was mailed the vote for the seat for which the special election was called will be null and void but the votes on all other offices and issues shall be counted d removal of names from ballot the name of any qualified candidate who has died withdrawn or been removed from the ballot shall not be printed on the ballot if the ballot cannot be changed any votes for that candidate shall be null and void i 61791 restrictions on authority of city commission a appointment and removal of officers and employees neither the city commission nor any of its members shall in any manner control or demand the appointment or removal of any city administrative officer or employee whom the city manager or any subordinate of the city manager is empowered to appoint but the city commission may express its views and fully and freely discuss with the city manager anything pertaining to appointment and removal of such officers and employees b interference with administration except for the purpose of inquiries and investigations under 4 of the charter the city commission or its members shall deal with city officers and employees who are subject to the direction and supervision of the city manager solely city manager and neither the city commission nor its members shall give orders to any such officer or employee either publicly or privately i 121691 secs 239250  reserved division 2  legislation footnotes  3  state law reference minimum procedural requirements and prohibitions for adoption of ordinances and resolutions fs   passage of nonemergency and emergency ordinances by majority vote or by vote of four commissioners a the city commission may enact ordinances by majority vote at any regular meeting of the commission a proposed ordinance may be read by title or in full on at least two separate days and shall at least ten days prior to adoption be noticed once in a newspaper of general circulation in the city the notice of proposed enactment shall state the date time and place of the meeting  the title or titles of proposed ordinances  and be posted in at least three public places the notice shall also advise that interested parties may appear at the meeting and be heard with respect to the proposed ordinance b the city commission may enact emergency ordinances by an affirmative vote of not less than four members of the commission at any regular or special meeting of the commission without compliance with the requirements of a of this c an emergency ordinance is defined as an ordinance to provide for the immediate preservation of the public peace property health or safety or in the event of an emergency in the daily operation of city government ordinances appropriating money may be passed as emergency measures but no measure to make a grant renew or extend a franchise or special privilege or to regulate the rate to be charged for its services by any public utility shall ever be passed as an emergency measure laws of fla ch 651351  39 40  laws of fla ch 69927  7 state law reference similar provisions fs  3a b form of ordinances every proposed ordinance shall be introduced in typewritten form and shall not contain more than one subject this single subject shall be clearly stated in the title emergency ordinances shall be defined in the title by authority of the commission laws of fla ch 651351  41  laws of fla ch 69927  7 state law reference similar provisions fs  2 enacting clause the enacting clause of all ordinances shall be be it enacted by the commission of the city of casselberry laws of fla ch 651351  42  laws of fla ch 69927  7 effective date every ordinance unless otherwise specified shall become effective ten days after passage laws of fla ch 651351  43  laws of fla ch 69927  7 state law reference similar provisions fs  4 recording of ordinances every ordinance shall be numbered consecutively upon enactment the ordinance shall be recorded in a book kept for that purpose and shall be authenticated by the signatures of the mayor and the city clerk laws of fla ch 651351  44  laws of fla ch 69927  7 state law reference similar provisions fs  5 resolutions all proposed resolutions shall be introduced in typewritten written or printed forms at any regular or special meeting and shall embrace but one subject which shall be clearly stated in the title adoption of resolutions will require a majority vote of the city commission resolutions shall become effective immediately upon passage laws of fla ch 651351  45  laws of fla ch 69927  7 state law reference similar provisions fs  2 4 powers of initiative and referendum the registered voters of the city of casselberry shall have the right to initiate city ordinances in order to establish new ordinances and to amend or repeal in whole or in part existing ordinances by petition as follows 1 sponsors of petition  affidavit any five registered voters of the city may commence initiative proceedings by filing with the city clerk an affidavit stating they will constitute the sponsors of the petition and be responsible for circulating the petition and filing it in proper form stating their names and addresses and specifying the address to which all notices to the sponsors are to be sent all petitions shall be uniform in character and shall have printed or written thereon in the caption the name and address of the five registered voters of the city who shall constitute the sponsors of the petition 2 submission of petition the sponsors of the petition shall prior to obtaining any signatures on the petition file the text of the title summary and proposed ordinance with the city clerk with the petition on which signatures will be affixed and shall obtain the approval of the city clerk of the form of the petition the city clerk shall complete a review of the sufficiency of the form of the petition specifying if the form is insufficient the particulars wherein it is defective and notifying the sponsors of the approval or rejection of the form of the petition within ten days from the filing of the petition with the city clerk the title and summary of the substance of the proposed ordinance shall comply with fs  l or its successor provision the petition form which shall be used for proposing an ordinance is attached hereto as exhibit a 3 requirements for signing the initiative petition shall be signed by registered voters of the city equal in number to at least fifteen percent of the total number of registered voters registered to vote at the last regular city election the beginning date of any petition drive shall commence upon the date of approval by the city clerk of the form on which signatures will be affixed and said drive shall terminate six months after that date in the event sufficient signatures are not acquired during that six month period the petition shall be rendered null and void and none of the signatures may be carried over onto another identical or similar petition the sponsors shall submit signed and dated forms with the current residential address of each petitioner 4 affidavit of circulator each paper of a petition shall have attached to it when filed an affidavit executed by the person circulating it stating that he or she personally circulated the paper the number of signatures thereon that all the signatures were affixed in his or her presence that he or she believes them to be the genuine signatures of the persons whose names they purport to be and that each signer had an opportunity before signing to read the full text of the proposed ordinance 5 filing with the city clerk all papers comprising the petition shall be assembled and filed with the city clerk as one instrument within five days after receipt of the petition the city clerk shall request the seminole county supervisor of elections to verify the signatures thereon the sponsors shall pay all fees as required by law for the verification of signatures by the seminole county supervisor of elections the seminole county supervisor of elections shall verify the signatures on the petition within three weeks from receipt of the petition 6 city commission consideration upon verification by the seminole county supervisor of elections that the petition contains the required number of signatures the city clerk shall complete a certificate as to the petitions sufficiency specifying if it is insufficient the particulars wherein it is defective and shall present the certificate to the city commission at its next regular meeting if the petition is determined to be sufficient by the city commission the city commission shall consider the proposed ordinance pursuant to the requirements of fs  3a and take final action on the proposed ordinance within 60 days from receipt of the certification from the city clerk 7 certification by sponsors if the city commission rejects the proposed ordinance or passes it in a revised form the sponsors may require that the proposed ordinance be submitted to a vote of the electors in its original form when the proposed ordinance is to be submitted to a vote of the city the sponsors shall certify that fact to the city clerk within 20 days from the date of the final city commission vote on the proposed ordinance upon receipt of said certification by the sponsors the city clerk shall present the certification to the city commission at its next regular meeting 8 scheduling for election if the city clerk receives the certification by the sponsors see 7 above from january 1 the vote of the city on the proposed ordinance shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november of the same calendar year if the city clerk receives the certification by the sponsors see 7 above from may 2 the vote of the city on the proposed ordinance shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november of the next calendar year 9 proposed ordinance the power to enact amend or repeal an ordinance by initiative shall not include ordinances relating to administrative or judicial functions of city government including but not limited to budget debt obligations capital improvement programs salaries of officers and employees the levy and collection of taxes and the rezoning of an individual parcel of land or as otherwise prohibited by law each proposed ordinance shall embrace but one subject and matters properly connected therewith 10 authorization for amendment or repeal of existing ordinances proposed ordinances amending or repealing any existing ordinance or ordinances in whole or in part may be submitted to the city commission by initiative petition as provided in this 11 withdrawal of petition the petition may be withdrawn at any time prior to the fifteenth day preceding the day scheduled for a vote of the city by filing with the city clerk a request for withdrawal signed by at least three members of the petition sponsors upon the filing of such request the petition shall have no further force or effect and all proceedings thereon shall be terminated 12 effective date ordinances enacted under this become operative on the date specified therein or if not so specified on january 1 of the succeeding year 13 results of election if a majority of the registered voters voting on the proposed ordinance vote in its favor it shall be considered adopted upon certification of the election results and shall be treated in all respects in the same manner as ordinances adopted by the city commission if the provisions of two or more ordinances adopted or approved at the same election conflict the ordinance receiving the highest affirmative votes shall prevail  2 6198 editors note  and 2 adopted  repealed the former enacted a new set out herein the former pertained to 2812100  reserved division 2  city manager footnotes  5  charter reference city manager  2326 appointment  qualifications a appointment generally the city commission shall appoint a city manager of the city government pursuant to of the city charter who shall serve as the chief executive administrative and enforcement officer of the city in accordance with the city charter ordinances resolutions and rules and regulations established by the commission time to time b eligibility of city officials no elected city official shall be eligible for the position of city manager during his term of office or for a period of two years from the expiration of the elected officials last term of office art i 5691   102212 charter reference appointment of city manager  23 compensation the city manager shall receive such salary or compensation as the commission shall fix in the annual budget of the city and the sum shall be payable to the city manager at the same time as other employees of the city are paid art vi 5691 influence of manager by commission members a the commission shall not direct or request the city manager either individually or boards or committees to appoint or remove any person assistant to the city manager or other subordinate from city office or city employment the commission members shall not coerce or attempt to coerce or influence the city manager with respect to the award or rejection of contracts the purchase of supplies or the fair and reasonable application of required bid procedures b nothing contained in this be construed to prohibit the commission while in open session from fully and freely discussing with the city manager matters pertaining to appointment and removal of an officer of the city contracts purchases bidding procedures and any and all city affairs art ii 5691 political involvement of manager or designee neither the city manager nor his or her direct designee shall engage in any city county state or national political campaign or take any active part in securing or contributing funds toward the nomination or election of any candidate for election art iii 5691 reserved editors note  adopted oct 22 201 repealed  2105 which pertained to removal of the city manager from office and derived from art iv adopted  and i adopted dec 16 1991 powers and duties a powers the city manager shall be responsible to the city commission for the proper administration of all affairs of the city and to that end shall have the powers as provided in the charter the following additional powers and duties 1 to act as conservator of the peace under the direction of the city commission to see that all laws and ordinances of the city are duly enforced and to sue in the proper federal state and county courts to ensure enforcement of all laws and ordinances of the city 2 to appoint officers not provided for by election 3 to supervise and direct the affairs of the city directly under his or her supervision including all departments and divisions of city government all contractual obligations of the city and fulfillment of the performance of all city obligations under contract the charter ordinances and other applicable law the supervisory and investigative powers granted in this not extend to the legislative branch of the city government 4 to direct the maintenance and repair of all city property buildings furnishings and equipment b duties the city manager shall be responsible to the city commission for the proper direction supervision and administration of all duties connected with city government and to that end shall have the following specific duties 1 to investigate evaluate and supervise existing and proposed organizational and administrative procedures of all city departments 2 to direct supervise and implement new organizational and administrative procedures 3 to direct supervise and administer the implementation of new procedures 4 to direct supervise and administer all city departments in policy budgetary and administrative matters 5 to direct supervise and assist all departments in accomplishment of city functions 6 to prepare factual reports with specific recommendations based on statistical studies and surveys 7 to conduct special program studies and direct and supervise the establishment and implementation of all current policies adopted by the commission 8 to handle all incoming and outgoing correspondence as assigned by the commission 9 to supervise and direct agenda preparation and to provide the mayor the opportunity to review said agenda to ensure items previously requested publicly by the city commission are included 10 to direct supervise and administer all commission activities with other governmental agencies 11 to attend all commission meetings conferences and work sessions and provide recommendations and assistance on all subjects under discussion and consideration 12 to receive investigate and effect the timely resolution of all complaints concerning city functions 13 to administer and maintain the city human resources program 14 to direct and administer the city central purchasing procedure 15 to implement and administer all the city budgets 16 to direct supervise and implement all policies formulated by the commission 17 to prepare and submit to the commission the annual city budgets and the reports required by 5 of the city charter 18 to keep the commission advised at all times of the financial condition and needs of all departments of city government 19 to approve and submit for payment to the commission all claims allowances bills and expenditures incurred under his control direction or supervision 20 to devote his entire time to his duties as city manager and be engaged in no other venture or enterprise 21 to perform all other duties assigned by the commission 22 to perform such additional duties as shall be prescribed from time to time by the charter or by ordinance or resolution of the city 23 to supervise and direct the scheduling of commission meetings art v 5691   2 31306   102212 charter reference powers and duties of city manager  26 secs 21072115  reserved division 3  city clerk
