for extraordinary expenses  3051 et seq  planning and development ch 66  roadway and utility construction ch 68  solid waste ch 70  utilities ch 86  waterways ch 94  unified land development regulations article i  in general excessive emissions  unsanitary conditions a it shall be unlawful to cause or maintain a nuisance in the city because of the excessive emission of noise odor smoke gas or vibration from the premises or because of the unsightly or unsanitary condition of the premises b whenever in the opinion of the officer the owner or occupant of any property in the city has violated any of the provisions of a of this the city manager shall give ten days notice in writing to the owner if his address can be ascertained by reasonable diligence and if not by posting it in a conspicuous place on the property requiring the owner or occupant to remove immediately or prevent the offending condition described in the notice on failure of the owner or occupant to do so within the tenday notice period he shall be in violation of this subject to the penalties provided in this the city may correct the offending condition at the owners or occupants expense the owner or occupant shall have the right to appeal the decision of the city manager to the city commission during the tenday period the order shall be stayed during the appeal procedure 02 cross reference traffic and vehicles ch 82 state law reference nuisances injurious to health fs  38604 drinking water to be provided at public places in all places of employment public buildings places of amusement public parks and churches cool drinking water shall be furnished from sanitary drinking fountains or from iced containers of a type that the water does not come in contact with the ice where sanitary drinking fountains are not used individual paper drinking cups shall be furnished in adequate quantity drinking fountains or water receptacles shall be adequate in number and so placed that they will be conveniently accessible to all employees or patrons 46 cross reference water  86161 et seq secs 5035025  reserved article ii  mosquito control footnotes  2  state law reference mosquito control fs   et seq right of entry in the enforcement of the provisions of this upon probable cause the city manager or his designee may at all reasonable times enter in and on any premises within his jurisdiction 28b responsibility for condition of premises a the person responsible for the condition of any premises with regard to mosquito breeding sites is the person using or occupying the premises or in case no person is using or occupying the premises the person who by law is entitled to the immediate possession of the premises however if the premises are used or occupied by two or more tenants of a common landlord or contain grounds appurtenant to a house occupied by two or more tenants of a common landlord then the landlord is responsible though each tenant is responsible for that part of the premises which he occupies to the exclusion of the other tenants b where the premises are occupied by a tenant under a yearly or monthly tenancy or under a lease for not more than a year or under any lease whereby the lessor is expressly or impliedly obligated to keep the premises in repair and the collection of standing or flowing water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed is due to the disrepair of the buildings any natural quality of the premises any condition that existed at the time when the tenant entered into possession or anything done on the premises by the landlord during the existence of the tenancy or lease then the landlord is the person responsible for such condition c any person who has caused to exist on any premises of which he is not the owner landlord occupant or tenant any collection of water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed is responsible for such condition as well as the owner landlord tenant or occupant as the case may be 28a treatment of breeding places required  treatment methods a it shall be unlawful for any person to have keep maintain cause or permit any collection of standing or flowing water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed unless the collection of water is treated so as effectually to prevent such breeding collections of water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed are those contained in ditches ponds groundwater pools swimming pools pools excavations holes depressions open cesspools privy vaults fountains cisterns tanks shallow wells barrels troughs except horse troughs in frequent use urns cans boxes bottles tubs buckets defective house roof gutters tanks of flush closets or other similar water containers the natural presence of mosquito larvae in standing or running water shall be prima facie evidence that mosquitoes are breeding there b collections of water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed shall be treated by one or more of the following methods as approved by the city 1 screening with wire netting of at least 16 meshes to the inch each way or any other material which will effectually prevent the ingress or egress of mosquitoes 2 complete emptying every seven days of unscreened containers together with thorough drying or cleaning 3 using a larvicide approved and applied under the direction of the city 4 completely covering the surface of the water with kerosene petroleum or paraffin oil once every seven days 5 cleaning and keeping sufficiently free of vegetable growth and other obstructions and stocking with mosquitodestroying fish 6 filling or draining to the satisfaction of the city 7 proper disposal by removal or destruction of tin cans tin boxes broken or empty bottles and similar articles likely to hold water 26 failure to treat breeding places  treatment by city a in case the person responsible for the condition of the premises on which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed fails or refuses to take necessary measures to prevent their breeding within three days after written notice has been given him by the officer or within a longer time as specified in the notice but not to exceed five days the person responsible shall be deemed guilty of a violation of this each day after the expiration of three days from the day on which the notice is given him or for each day after the expiration of the time specified in the notice as the case may be that the person responsible fails or refuses to take measures the person responsible shall be deemed guilty of a separate violation of this b in case of the failure or refusal of the person responsible the city is authorized to take necessary measures to prevent the breeding of mosquitoes and all necessary costs incurred by the city for that purpose shall be a charge against the person responsible 27 secs 50305050  reserved article iii  food and food establishments sanitary practices generally  adoption of state regulations a food service establishments sanitary practices relating to restaurants and all other places serving food and drinks to the public with or without charge within the city shall comply with chapter 10d13 and all amendments to that document of the sanitary code of the state is hereby adopted and made a part of this reference as if fully set out in this all food service establishments shall regulate their sanitary practices in accordance with that document b grocery stores warehouses etc sanitary practices relating to any grocery store food market meat market fruit or vegetable market food warehouse refrigerated storage facility freezer locker or other place storing or offering food for sale shall comply with of the sanitary code of the state is adopted by reference as if fully set out in this all food outlets shall regulate their sanitary practices in accordance with that document 45 food storage and display all food and drink on premises subject to this be so stored and displayed as to be protected from dust flies vermin handling droplet infection overhead leakage and other contamination 48 animals in food establishments no animals or fowl except seeing eye dogs shall be kept or allowed on premises subject to this article in any room in which food or drink is prepared eaten or stored 48 cross reference animals ch 18  businesses ch 26 secs 50545075  reserved article iv  toilets and washrooms sanitary facilities required  outdoor toilets  septic tanks a any person who shall erect or construct any building or structure within the city shall comply with all rules and regulations of the state board of health and the standard plumbing code every building hereafter erected in the city shall be equipped with indoor toilets and sewage disposal facilities strictly complying with the regulations of the state board of health and the city no person shall erect use or maintain any outdoor toilet or toilet facilities on any property occupied or used for residential purposes or upon any property upon which a business building is constructed and occupied within the city b any person constructing or maintaining a septic tank on his premises shall comply strictly with all rules and regulations of the state board of health it shall be unlawful for any person to allow sewage or filth to flow from a septic tank on his premises into a lake pond or open ditch or to flow or drain upon open ground the officer of the city shall inspect for and report all violations of this the community development director 15 cross reference utilities ch 86 maintenance of facilities in public places restrooms in all public buildings and facilities shall be maintained in a clean safe and sanitary manner floors and all plumbing fixtures shall be washed daily and walls washed and floors scoured at least weekly fixtures and plumbing shall be kept in good repair in sanitary condition and free from odor the water supply shall be adequate in quantity and conveniently placed each toilet room shall be adequately supplied with soap and either individual paper towels towels on a rolling device or an electric hand dryer approved by the community development director or his designee 18 human resources article i  in general employee manual the city manager shall develop maintain and distribute an employee manual that includes policies rules and regulations as needed for effective city operations including but not limited to employee grievance procedures disciplinary procedures safety policies and drugfree workplace policies  61107 secs 5225220  reserved impact fees short title this be known and may be cited as impact fees iii 81213 findings of fact purpose and intent of ordinance it is hereby ascertained determined and declared that a both existing development and development necessitated by the growth contemplated in the comprehensive plan will require improvements and additions to the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities and fire and rescue facilities of the city to accommodate and maintain existing level of service standards b future growth represented by capital improvement impact projects should contribute its fair share of the cost of capacityadding improvements and additions to the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities and fire and rescue facilities required to accommodate capital improvement demands generated by such growth as adopted in the comprehensive plan c implementation of a reasonable impact fee structure to require future capital improvement impact projects to contribute their fair share of the cost of required new capital improvement capacity is an integral and vital element of the regulatory plan of growth management incorporated in the comprehensive plan d the projected capital improvements and additions to the capital improvement system of the city and the allocation of projected costs between those necessary to serve existing development and those required to accommodate new capital improvement impact projects as presented in the study entitled impact fee study were approved and adopted via resolution 132482 by the city commission on  and such projections are found to be in conformity with the comprehensive plan e capital improvement planning is an evolving process and the capital improvements and additions to the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities and fire and rescue facilities identified upon the date of adoption of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived constitute projections of growth patterns and improvements and additions based upon present knowledge and judgment therefore in recognition of changing growth patterns and the dynamic nature of population growth it is the intent of the city commission that the identified improvements and additions to the capital improvement system be reviewed and adjusted periodically to ensure that impact fees are imposed equitably and lawfully and are utilized effectively based upon actual and anticipated conditions at the time of their imposition f the purpose of this chapter is to require payment of citywide impact fees by new capital improvement impact projects and to provide for the cost of capital improvements to the citys capital improvement system which are required to accommodate the additional demand caused by such capital improvement impact projects this chapter shall not be construed to permit the collection of impact fees from capital improvement impact projects in excess of the amount reasonably anticipated to offset the demand new growth will have on the citys capital improvement systems iii 81213 definitions when used in this chapter the following words terms and phrases whether capitalized or not shall have the meanings set forth in this terms used in this chapter but which are not defined here shall have the meaning set forth in the glossary to the citys unified land development regulations access improvements improvements not included in the multimodal transportation system which are designed to provide safe and adequate ingress and egress from a capital improvement impact project which may include but are not limited to siterelated rightsofway easements turn lanes associated pedestrian and bike facilities deceleration and acceleration lanes traffic control devices signs and markings and drainage and utilities alternative impact fee an alternative fee calculated by an applicant and approved by the city engineerassistant public works director or city commission pursuant to applicant the person who applies for a building permit for a capital improvement impact project capital improvements facilities in the citys capital improvement system that include or add capacity to accommodate new capital improvement impact projects consistent with the impact fee study assumptions and methodology capital improvement impact project land development designed or intended to permit a use of the land which will contain more dwelling units buildings or floor space than the existing use of land or which will otherwise change the use of land in a manner that increases the demands upon the citys capital improvement system capital improvement system the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities and fire and rescue facilities provided by the city to accommodate additional capital improvement demands generated by new capital improvement construction city engineer the professional engineer responsible for the citys capital improvement systems or the designee of such person city park system the community and neighborhood park and recreation facilities and city trail facilities provided by the city in order to accommodate capital improvement impact project city trail facilities shared use paths usually on exclusive rightofway with minimal cross flow by motor vehicles users of city trail facilities are nonmotorized and may include but are not limited to bicyclists inline skaters roller skaters skateboarders pedestrians walkers runners people with baby strollers and people walking dogs collector road a road on the multimodal transportation system and classified by the state department of transportation utilizing the definition established in f s  334034 or its statutory successor in function or a road classified as a collector road under the procedures of and meeting the criteria specified by the city a collector road shall include those portions of an intersection with an arterial or local road that are a necessary and integral element of the design of the traffic flow on the collector road community park a city park with a service area and associated amenities consistent with the impact fee study and which is used as the basis for calculating the impact fees for the city park system encumbered monies committed by contract or purchase order in a manner that obligates the city to expend the encumbered amount upon delivery of goods or completion of services or conveyance of rightofway by a vendor supplier contractor or owner fire and rescue facilities capital improvements provided by the city to accommodate capital improvement impact project for the purpose of acquiring or expanding fire rescue services capital equipment andor facilities under the jurisdiction of the city impact fee rate an impact fee imposed for a particular capital improvement impact project under the applicable impact fee land use category established in the schedule incorporated in impact fee statement the document issued to an applicant prior to the issuance of a building permit containing the calculation of the impact fees imposed on capital improvement impact projects under or 537 impact fee study the impact fee study sets forth a reasonable methodology and analysis for the determination of the impact of new development on the need for and costs of additional capital improvements related to multimodal transportation city parks law enforcement and fire rescue services in the city the study sets forth the calculations and basis for the impact fees utilized and associated with the provision of city capital improvements needed to serve new development the city commission approved the study adoption of resolution 132482 on  and all subsequent schedules and analysis prepared by tindaleoliver & associates inc law enforcement facilities capital improvements provided by the city to accommodate capital improvement impact projects for the purpose of acquiring or expanding police services capital equipment or facilities under the jurisdiction of the city level of service standard the minimum acceptable conditions of the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities or fire and rescue facilities as set forth by the comprehensive plan mixed use capital improvement impact projects in which more than one impact fee land use category is contemplated with each category constituting a separate and identifiable enterprise not subordinate to or dependent on other enterprises within the capital improvement impact project multimodal transportation system the system of transportation bike pedestrian or transit improvements shown on map c1 of the impact fee study titled city of casselberry proposed collector multimodal network which mitigate capital improvement impact projects demand for road and multimodal capital improvements as calculated in the impact fee study the multimodal transportation system includes capacityadding construction of   turn lanes  bridges  drainage facilities in conjunction with new multimodal capital improvements  traffic control devices  relocating utilities to accommodate new multimodal construction  conservation area mitigation  compensating storage  transit amenities including bus stations and necessary reconfigurations  corridor studies  environmental assessments  capital facility fee studies and comprehensive plan element studies  or bicycle and pedestrian facilities which mitigate the impact of new development as calculated in the impact fee study neighborhood park a city park with a service area and associated amenities consistent with the impact fee study and which is used as the basis for calculating the impact fees for the city park system offsite improvements capital improvements located outside of the boundaries of a capital improvement impact project which are required by the city in order to mitigate the demands of capital improvement impact projects other than those of the proposed capital improvement impact project offsite improvements do not include access improvements owner the person holding legal title to the real property upon which the capital improvement impact project is to occur sfgla square feet of gross leasable area square footage or square feet the gross area measured in feet from the exterior faces of exterior walls or other exterior boundaries of the building iii 81213 rules of construction for the purposes of administration and enforcement of this chapter unless otherwise stated in this chapter the following rules of construction shall apply a in case of any difference of meaning or implication between the text of this chapter and any caption illustration summary table or illustrative table the text shall control b unless the context clearly indicates the contrary where a regulation involves two or more items conditions provisions or events connected by the conjunction and or or either  or the conjunction shall be interpreted as follows 1 the term and indicates that all the connected terms conditions provisions or events shall apply 2 the term or indicates that all the connected items conditions provisions or events may apply singly or in any combination 3 the term either  or indicates that the connected items conditions provisions or events shall apply singly but not in combination c the word includes shall not limit a term to the specific example but is intended to extend its meaning to all other instances or circumstances of like kind or character iii 81213 fees imposed a all capital improvement impact projects occurring within the city shall pay the impact fees established in this chapter the impact fees are imposed on all capital improvement impact projects located in the city at the rates established under the applicable impact fee land use category below the impact fees authorized by this chapter shall be as follows land use feet 7860 7287 na 25900 miniwarehouse storage unit 1965 1822 na 1100 b pursuant to the terms of this chapter multimodal transportation impact fee above shall be paid in addition to any transportation accordance with the city land development regulations or any valid ordinance or regulation applicable to the proposed capital improvement impact project iii 81213 calculation generally  impact fee statement an impact fee statement shall be calculated and issued as provided in iii 81213 alternative fee  calculation a if an applicant believes that the impact to the multimodal transportation system the city park system law enforcement facilities or fire and rescue facilities caused by the applicants proposed capital improvement impact project is less than the fee established in or the applicant may at his or her own expense prior to issuance of a building permit for such capital improvement impact project submit a calculation of an alternative impact fee to the city engineer pursuant to the provisions of this city engineer shall make a determination within ten business days of submittal as to whether that calculation complies with the requirements of this for purposes of any alternative impact fee calculation the capital improvement impact project shall be presumed to have the maximum impact on the capital improvement system for the land use category contemplated under the impact fee rate c if an applicant decides to perform an alternative impact fee study the methodology for said study shall be approved by the city engineer based on the methodology adopted by the city commission in the impact fee study before the applicant begins the study d an alternative impact fee shall be calculated by use of the formula and methodologies used in the impact fee study e the alternative impact fee calculations shall be based on data information or assumptions contained in this chapter or independent sources provided that 1 the independent source is a cityaccepted source of engineering or planning information  or 2 the independent source is a local study supported by a database adequate for the conclusions contained in that study performed by a professional engineer or planner pursuant to a generally accepted methodology of planning or engineering  or 3 if a previously approved capital improvement impact project submitted a traffic impact study during its approval process which is substantially consistent with the criteria required by this if that study is determined by the city engineer to be current the impact of that previously approved capital improvement impact project shall be presumed for the proposed capital improvement impact project to be as described in the prior study in such circumstances an alternative impact fee shall be established reflecting the capital improvement impacts described in the prior study there shall be a rebuttable presumption that an alternative impact fee study conducted more than two years earlier is invalid 4 it is acknowledged that the multimodal impact fee rates are based upon the applicable trip generation rates for the land use set forth in the multimodal transportation impact fee rate schedule in recognition of such acknowledgment the trip generation rate for the land use categories shall be considered an independent source for the purposes of the calculation of an alternative impact fee calculation without the necessity of a study as required by e2 of this if the city engineer determines that the data information and assumptions utilized by the applicant to calculate the alternative impact fee comply with the requirements of this the alternative impact fee shall be paid in lieu of the fee set forth in g if the city engineer determines that the data information and assumptions utilized by the applicant to calculate the alternative impact fee do not comply with the requirements of this then the city shall provide to the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested written notification of the rejection of the alternative citywide impact fee and the reason the applicant shall have 15 calendar days from the receipt of the written notification of rejection to request a review hearing pursuant to h the city engineer or designee may conduct a follow up review to confirm the approved assumptions in the alternative impact fee calculation study within five years of acceptance of the study by the city impact fees attributable to any impacts shown to exist in the follow up review but which were not previously accounted for in the alternative impact fee study shall be paid by the then current property owner within 30 days of a demand letter issued by the city to the then current property owner a fee may be collected by the city for this monitoring study at the time the alternative impact fee is paid based only on actual costs incurred by the city iii 81213 use of funds  refunds  audits a the city commission will establish and maintain a separate trust account for each of the following impact fee categories 1 multimodal transportation system 2 the city park system 3 law enforcement facilities and 4 fire and rescue facilities b the trust accounts shall be maintained separate and apart from each other and from other accounts of the city all impact fees shall be deposited into the corresponding trust account immediately upon receipt c the monies deposited into an impact fee trust account shall be used solely for the purpose of funding capital improvement capacity within the city including but not limited to 1 design and construction plan preparation  2 building construction  3 permitting  4 rightofway and land acquisition including all costs of acquisition or condemnation  5 construction management and inspection  6 surveying and soils and material testing  7 necessary capital equipment  8 repayment of monies transferred or borrowed from any budgetary fund of the city which were used to fund a capital improvement  and 9 payment of principal and interest necessary reserves and costs of issuance under any bonds or other indebtedness issued by the city to provide funds to construct or acquire capital improvements to the citys capital improvement system d funds on deposit in an impact fee trust account shall not be used for any expenditure that would be classified as a maintenance operation or repair expense or to cure an existing deficiency in the capital improvement system e the monies deposited into an impact fee trust account shall be used solely to provide additional capital improvement capacity to the citys capital improvement system required to accommodate new capital improvement impact projects as provided in the citys five year capital improvement plan or capital improvements element of the adopted comprehensive plan as applicable f any monies on deposit which are not immediately necessary for expenditure shall be invested in interest bearing accounts by the city all interest income derived from such investments shall remain or be deposited in the impact fee trust account on which the interest income was earned g the impact fees collected pursuant to this chapter shall be returned to the current owner of the property on behalf of which such fee was paid if such fees have not been expended or encumbered prior to the end of the fiscal year immediately following the seventh anniversary of the date upon which such fees were paid refunds shall be made only in accordance with the following procedure 1 the current owner shall petition the city commission for the refund within one year following the end of the fiscal year in which occurs the date of the seventh anniversary of the payment of the impact fee by the original capital improvement impact project 2 the petition for refund shall be submitted to the city engineer and shall contain a a notarized sworn statement that the petitioner is the then current owner of the property on behalf of which the impact fee was paid  b a copy of the dated receipt issued for payment of the fee or such other record as would indicate payment of the fee  c a certified copy of the latest recorded deed  and d a copy of the most recent ad valorem tax bill 3 within three months from the date of receipt of a petition for refund the city engineer will advise the petitioner and the city commission of the status of the impact fee refund request and whether the impact fee paid has been spent or encumbered within the applicable time period if it was not the fees shall be returned to the petitioner with interest at the average net interest rate earned by the city in the applicable impact fee trust account during the time such impact fee was on deposit for the purposes of this fees collected are deemed to be spent or encumbered on the following basis the first fee in shall be the first fee out h audits of the citys financial statements which are performed by a certified public accountant pursuant to fs  21839 and submitted to the auditor general must include an affidavit signed by the citys finance director stating that the city has complied with the requirements fs   iii 81213 exemptions the following shall be exempted from payment of impact fees 1 alteration expansion or replacement of an existing dwelling unit which does not increase the number of families which that dwelling unit is arranged designed or intended to accommodate for the purpose of providing living quarters 2 alteration or expansion of a building if the building use upon completion does not generate greater demand for the applicable category of capital improvement than was assumed in the impact fee study and reflected under the applicable impact fee rate 3 replacement of a building or the construction of an accessory building if the replacement building or accessory building does not result in a land use generating greater demand for the applicable category of capital improvement than was assumed in the impact fee study and reflected under the applicable impact fee rate 4 construction of publicly owned projects 5 temporary construction sheds or trailers erected to assist in construction and maintained during the term of a building permit iii 81213 changes in use impact fees shall be imposed and calculated on any or all of the applicable below listed conditions for the alteration expansion or replacement of a building or dwelling unit or the construction of an accessory building if the alteration expansion or replacement of the building or dwelling unit or the construction of an accessory building results in a land use determined to generate greater impacts on the citys capital improvement systems than the present use under the applicable impact fee rate the impact fee imposed under the applicable impact fee rate shall be calculated as follows a when there is a change in land use the impact fees imposed shall be the impact fees due under the applicable impact fee rate for the impact fee land use category resulting from the land use change less the impact fee that would be imposed under the applicable impact fee rate for the impact fee land use category prior to the land use change b unless exempt by when the square footage of a building is increased the impact fee rate shall be calculated based only on the increased square footage c unless exempt by the impact fee imposed for any accessory buildings shall be that applicable under the impact fee rate for the land use for the primary building iii 81213 vested rights a any owner which was the subject of a development order of the city prior to  may petition the city commission for a vested rights determination which if approved would exempt the owner from the provisions of this chapter the petition shall be evaluated by the city attorney and a determination thereon submitted to the city commission based on the following criteria 1 the existence of a valid unexpired governmental act of the city authorizing the specific development for which a determination is sought  2 expenditures or obligations made or incurred in reliance upon the authorizing governmental act that are reasonably equivalent to the fees required by this chapter  3 other factors that demonstrate that it is inequitable to deny the owner the opportunity to complete the previously approved development under the conditions of approval by requiring the owner to comply with the requirements of this chapter for the purposes of this subsection the following factors shall be considered in determining whether it is inequitable to deny the owner the opportunity to complete the previously approved development without having to comply with this chapter a whether the injury suffered by the owner outweighs the public cost of allowing the development to go forward without payment of the impact fees required by this chapter  and b whether the expenses or obligations for the development were made or incurred subsequent or prior to  the date of adoption of the original ordinance from which this chapter is derived b the city attorney shall make a written determination subject to the approval of the city commission as to whether the owner has a vested right and if so whether that vested right would exempt the owner from the provisions of this chapter c any written agreement entered into prior to the effective date of this chapter or any amendments thereto between the owner of any property and the city which expressly establishes restricts or prohibits the imposition of impact fees by the city shall be binding upon the city and not subject to the provisions of this chapter however if such written agreement is amended to increase the amount of capital improvement impact project construction permitted on the property then such additional capital improvement impact project construction shall be required to pay the impact fee as provided by this chapter iii 81213 payment a except as otherwise provided in this chapter no person shall carry out any capital improvement impact project unless the appropriate impact fee as set forth in or 537 was paid at the time of issuance of the building permit for the capital improvement impact project b each capital improvement impact project shall be categorized by the city engineer according to the land use categories set forth in section535 the city engineer will categorize a proposed capital improvement impact project based on the meanings assumed in the impact fee study the definitions in the unified land development regulations the landbased classification standards published by the apa or other generallyaccepted source if a proposed use is not specifically listed and is determined by the city engineer not to fit into any listed land use category in the provisions of of this chapter apply c all impact fees required by this chapter shall be paid directly to the city d if the impact fee rate for a particular capital improvement impact project is changed subsequent to the issuance of an impact fee statement the impact fee rate calculated in the issued impact fee statement shall be the impact fee imposed for that capital improvement impact project e the payment of impact fees shall be in addition to any other fees charges or assessments due for the issuance of a building permit except as expressly provided otherwise by the city ordinances f the obligation for payment of impact fee shall run with the land iii 81213 collection of unpaid fees  delinquency if the impact fee is not paid prior to the issuance of a building permit for the affected capital improvement impact project because of mistake or inadvertence on the part of the city the city shall proceed to collect the impact fees as follows a the city shall serve by certified mail return receipt requested an impact fee statement notice upon the applicant at the address set forth in the application for the building permit and on the owner at the address appearing on the most recent records maintained by the county property appraiser service of the impact fee statement notice shall be deemed notice of the impact fees due and service shall be deemed effective on the date the return receipt indicates the notice was received by either the applicant or the owner or the date the notice was attached to the building permit whichever occurs first the impact fee statement notice shall contain the legal description of the property and shall advise the applicant and the owner as follows 1 of the amount due and the general purpose for which the impact fee was imposed  2 that a hearing pursuant to may be requested within 20 calendar days from the date of receipt of the impact fee statement notice by making application to the department of community development  3 that the impact fee shall be delinquent if not paid and received by the city within 30 calendar days of the date the impact fee statement notice is received excluding the date of receipt  or if a hearing is not requested pursuant to upon becoming delinquent shall be subject to the imposition of a delinquent fee and interest on the unpaid amount until paid  4 that if the impact fee becomes delinquent a lien against the property for which the building permit was secured shall be recorded in the official record book of seminole county b the impact fee shall be delinquent if within 30 calendar days from the date of the receipt of the impact fee statement notice by either the applicant or the owner or the date the notice was attached to the building permit neither the impact fees have been paid and received by the city nor has a hearing been requested pursuant to if a hearing is requested pursuant to the impact fees shall become delinquent if not paid within 30 calendar days from the date the city commission determines the amount of impact fees due upon the conclusion of such hearing these time periods shall be calculated on a calendar day basis including sundays and legal holidays but excluding the date of the earliest receipt of the impact fee statement notice or the hearing date in the event of an appeal if the last day falls on a sunday or legal holiday the last due date prior to becoming delinquent shall be the next business day upon becoming delinquent a delinquency fee equal to ten percent of the total impact fees imposed shall be assessed such total impact fees plus a delinquency fee shall bear interest at the statutory rate for final judgments calculated on a calendar day basis until paid c should the impact fee become delinquent as set forth in of this the city shall serve by certified mail return receipt requested a notice of lien upon the delinquent applicant if the building is under construction at the address indicated in the application for the building permit and upon the delinquent owner at the address appearing on the most recent records maintained by the county property appraiser the notice of lien shall notify the delinquent applicant and owner that due to their failure to pay the impact fees the city shall file a claim of lien with the clerk of the circuit court d upon mailing of the notice of lien the city shall file a claim of lien with the clerk of the circuit court for recording in the official records of the county the claim of lien shall contain the legal description of the property and the amount of the delinquent impact fees and the date of their imposition once recorded the claim of lien shall constitute a lien against the property described therein the city attorney shall proceed expeditiously to collect or otherwise enforce the lien if authorized to proceed by the city commission e after the expiration of one year from the date of recording of the claim of lien as provided in this a suit may be filed to foreclose the lien the foreclosure proceedings shall be instituted conducted and enforced in conformity with the procedures for the foreclosure of municipal special assessment liens as set forth in fs  1730417312 inclusive which provisions are incorporated in this their entirety to the same extent as if those provisions were set forth in this f the collection and enforcement procedures set forth in this be cumulative with supplemental and in addition to any applicable procedures provided in any other ordinances or administrative regulations of the city or any applicable law or administrative regulation of the state failure of the city to follow the procedure set forth in this not constitute a waiver of its rights to proceed under any other ordinances or administrative regulations of the city or any applicable law or administrative regulation of the state iii 81213 developer contribution credits a the city shall grant a credit against the impact fee imposed pursuant to this chapter for the donation of land or for the construction of any offsite improvements other than access improvements to a category of the capital improvement system that the city requires pursuant to a development order as proportionate fair share mitigation under of this ordinances or that is made voluntarily in connection with a capital improvement impact project such land donation and construction of offsite improvement shall be subject to the following standards 1 the donated land shall be an integral part of and a necessary accommodation of the contemplated offsite improvements to the category of capital improvement system included in the citys five year capital improvement plan or capital improvements element of the adopted comprehensive plan as applicable 2 the offsite improvements to be constructed shall be an integral part of and a necessary accommodation of the contemplated offsite improvements to the category of capital improvement system included in the citys five year capital improvement plan or capital improvements element of the adopted comprehensive plan as applicable b the amount of developer contribution credit to be applied shall be determined according to the following standards of valuation 1 the value of donated land shall be based upon a written appraisal of fair market value by an mai appraiser selected and paid for by the applicant based upon comparable sales of similar property between unrelated parties utilizing accepted rightofway appraisal techniques if the appraisal does not conform to the requirements of this the appraisal shall be corrected and resubmitted if the city disagrees with the appraised value the city may engage another appraiser and the value of the land donation shall be an amount equal to the average of the two appraisals  and 2 the cost of anticipated construction of offsite improvements to a category of the capital improvement system shall be based upon cost estimates certified by a registered professional engineer and approved by the city  and 3 the land and construction contributions shall receive credits under this only for capacity adding capital improvements to the applicable category of the capital improvements system in order to accommodate capital improvement impact projects consistent with the impact fee study and the citys five year capital improvement plan or capital improvements element of the adopted comprehensive plan as applicable  and c prior to issuance of a building permit the applicant shall submit to the city engineer a proposed plan of construction of offsite improvements for the applicable category of the capital improvements system the proposed plan of construction shall include 1 a list of the contemplated offsite improvements  2 a legal description of any land proposed to be donated and a written appraisal prepared in conformity with subsection b1 of this   3 an estimate of proposed construction costs certified by a registered professional engineer 4 a proposed time schedule for completion of the proposed plan of construction d the city engineer shall determine 1 if a proposed plan of construction is in conformity with contemplated offsite improvements to the applicable category of the capital improvements system  2 if the proposed donation and construction by the applicant is consistent with the public interest  and 3 if the proposed construction time schedule is consistent with the city capital improvements work schedule upon receipt of a proposed plan of construction the city engineer shall determine the amount of construction credit based upon the standards of valuation set out in this shall approve a timetable for completion of construction e all construction cost estimates shall be based upon and all construction plans and specifications shall be in conformity with the construction standards of the city all plans and specifications shall be approved by the city engineer prior to commencement of construction f any applicant shall have a right of review pursuant to of the determinations and certifications of a proposed plan of construction and the determination and valuation of the developer contribution credit by the city engineer g if the amount of developer contribution credit for a category of capital improvement system impact fees as determined by the city engineer exceeds the total amount of impact fees due by the applicant the city shall execute with the applicant an agreement for future reimbursement of the excess of such construction credit from future receipts by the city of impact fees for that category of fee only such agreement for reimbursement shall not be for a period in excess of ten years from the date of completion of the approved plan of construction and shall provide for a forfeiture of any remaining reimbursement balance at the end of such tenyear period h a credit shall not be awarded for any contribution of land money or services not made directly by the applicant including a contribution or grant made by another entity i nothing contained in this be interpreted or construed to qualify any land required as rightofway under the citys land development regulations or required by the county or the state as donated land under this iii 81213 review hearing a an applicant or owner who is required to pay an impact fee pursuant to this chapter shall have the right to request a review hearing b the review hearing shall be limited to the review of the following 1 the application or calculation of the appropriate impact fee pursuant to  the rejection of the alternative impact fee calculation pursuant to  the failure to grant credits or granting insufficient credits for the donation of land or construction of improvements pursuant to  all matters germane to the determination and calculation of vested rights pursuant to  as expressly provided for in this chapter c if the applicant or owner disagrees with the written determination rendered by city staff they may appeal the determination to the city commission by filing a written request for a review hearing except as otherwise provided in this chapter the written request for a review hearing shall be filed by the applicant or owner with the city clerk within 15 calendar days including sundays and legal holidays after rendition of the written determination by staff failure to request a hearing within the time provided in this be deemed a waiver of the right to appeal the determination to the city commission d the written request for hearing shall be filed with the community development department and shall contain the following 1 the name and address of the applicant or owner  2 the legal description of the property in question  3 if issued the date the building permit was issued  4 a brief description of the nature of the construction being undertaken pursuant to the building permit  5 if paid the date the impact fee was paid  6 a statement of the reasons why the applicant or owner is requesting the hearing e upon receipt of such request the community development director shall schedule a hearing before the city commission at a regularly scheduled meeting and shall provide the applicant and owner written notice of the time and place of the hearing the hearing shall be held within 45 calendar days of the date the request for hearing was filed f the quasijudicial hearing shall be before the city commission formal rules of civil procedure and evidence shall not be applicable  however the fundamental rules of due process shall govern the hearing g in the event a party disagrees with the appellate decision of the city commission the party may challenge the city commission decision by filing the appropriate pleading in the seminole county circuit court within 30 days of rendition of the decision iii 81213 review of ordinance and impact fee study this chapter and the impact fee study upon which this chapter is based shall be reviewed by the city at least every five years iii 81213 individual calculation of fees for nonlisted uses and mixed uses a if a capital improvement impact project involves a land use not listed under the impact fee land use categories set forth in the city engineer shall determine the impact on the applicable category of capital improvement systems to be generated by the proposed capital improvement impact project and shall calculate appropriate impact fees utilizing the alternative impact fee formula in the city engineer shall utilize as a standard in his determination for multimodal impact fees the trip generation rates in the most similar trip generation land use category or any other generally accepted standard source of transportation engineering or planning consistent with the impact fee study methodology for all other categories of impact fees the city engineer will rely on other planning and engineering indicators of development impacts on the city park system law enforcement facilities and fire and rescue facilities including the impact fee study the definitions in of the unified land development regulations the landbased classification standards published by the apa or other generallyaccepted source b if a capital improvement impact project involves a mixeduse capital improvement impact project the city engineer shall calculate the impact fees based upon the demand by category of capital improvement system to be generated by each separate land use category included in the proposed mixeduse capital improvement impact project outparcels within larger developments shall be calculated individually and not included in the overall square footage of the development c the city commission may adopt administrative regulations by resolution to ensure that any affordable housing unit that has received a certificate of affordability from the federal state or county government remains affordable iii 81213 other fees an application fee and attorneys fees will be charged to the applicant by the city if an applicant utilizes the alternate fee calculation vested rights determination developers contribution credit or review hearing options the application fee will be established by resolution the applicant will pay the city attorneys fees invoiced to the city for the matter iii 81213 penalty violations of this chapter shall be punished as provided in of the city of casselberry the city may obtain an injunction or other legal or equitable relief in circuit court against any person or party violating this chapter iii 81213 law enforcement footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  emergency management ch 30  police emergencies  3011  emergency services all unclaimed or abandoned articles coming into the possession of the police chief any police officer or any other employee of the city the disposition of which is not otherwise provided for by law shall be held by the police chief for a period of 90 days after receipt 01 sale a setting of time and place  publication of notice after a period of 90 days after receipt and from time to time as possession of the police department prior to any sale the city manager shall cause to be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city once a week for two consecutive weeks a notice that unclaimed articles will be offered for sale by the city stating the time and place and the method of making the sale b conduct of sale  title to goods at the sale all articles shall be sold for cash to the highest bidder the method of making the sale shall be determined by the city manager nothing in this in the advertisement of sale or in the sale itself shall be taken by any person to guarantee no notice of sale shall be required if personal property is of a perishable nature so that it would probably spoil or materially depreciate in value by the delay allowed by or is of such a character that the cost of storage or preservation in the judgment of the police chief would consume a substantial portion of its value this property shall immediately be deemed unclaimed property the police chief upon taking possession shall report the perishable property to the city manager who shall dispose of the property and report the disposition procedure to the city commission 04 secs 54295450  reserved article iii  confiscated property applicability of articles confiscated by the city pursuant to its ordinances and the laws of the state and in the possession of any of the departments of the city the disposition of which is not provided for by any other ordinance of the city or law of the state shall be disposed of according to the provisions of this 10a disposition generally all articles which may be determined by the city manager to be suitable for use by any of the departments of the city shall remain the property of the city and be delivered to those departments for their use all articles which are useless or worthless shall be destroyed or otherwise disposed of under the direction of the city manager all beer and liquor in open containers shall be destroyed 10b sale a generally all confiscated articles not required by the city or disposed of pursuant to shall be accumulated in sufficient amounts to make a sale advantageous all other articles shall be sold by the city manager at a date time and place provided for in a notice to be published once a week for two consecutive weeks prior to the sale in a newspaper of general circulation in the city the method of making the sale shall be determined by the city manager b title to goods nothing in this in the advertisement of the sale or in the sale itself shall be taken by any person to guarantee or warrant the unlawful to make or cause to be made any connection with any wire main service pipe or other pipe appliance or appurtenance used for or in connection with an electric gas or water plant owned or controlled by any person engaged in the business of furnishing electricity gas or water to users of its service in a manner so as to cause to be supplied electricity gas or water from the plant to any lamp burner orifice faucet or other outlet without electricity gas or water passing meter provided by the owner or operator of the plant and used for measuring and registering the quantity of electricity gas or water passing is also unlawful to make or cause to be made without the consent of the owner or operator of any plant any connection with the plant or any wire main pipe service pipe or other instrument or appliance connected with the plant in a manner so as to take or use without the consent of the owner or operator any electricity gas or water b the existence of any connection wire conductor meter alteration or any device which effects the diversion of electricity gas or water without its being measured or registered by or on a meter installed by any person engaged in the business of furnishing the electricity gas or water to users of its service or which effects the use of electricity gas or water furnished by the person without its being measured or registered on a meter provided by the person shall be prima facie evidence of intent to violate and of the violation of this section by the person using or receiving the direct benefits from the use of electrical gas or water passing connection wire conductor device or altered meter or being used without being measured or registered on a meter 04 injuring utility equipment a no person shall wilfully or fraudulently injure or knowingly suffer to be injured any meter wire pipe or fittings connected with or belonging to an electric gas or water plant owned or controlled by a person engaged in the business of furnishing electricity gas or water to users of its service  wilfully or fraudulently tamper or meddle with any meter or other appliance or plant in a manner so as to cause loss or damage to the owner or operator of the plant  wilfully or fraudulently prevent any meter from registering the quantity passing   alter the index or break the seal of any meter or in any way hinder or interfere with its proper action of just registration  or fraudulently use or wilfully waste or suffer the water electricity or gas passing meter wire pipe fitting or other appliance or appurtenance connected with or belonging to any plant after the meter wire pipe fitting appliance or appurtenance has been tampered with injured or altered b the existence of any connection wire conductor meter alteration or any device which effects the diversion of electricity gas or water without it being measured or registered by or on a meter installed for that purpose by any person engaged in the business of furnishing electricity gas or water to users of its service or the use or waste of electricity gas or water furnished by any person without its being measured or registered on a meter provided by that person shall be prima facie evidence of the intent to violate and of the violation of this the person using or receiving the direct benefits from the use of electricity gas or water cross reference damaging or tampering with boat of another  9439 injuring or destroying property a no person shall either negligently or wilfully and maliciously injure deface or destroy within the city any property of another either real personal or mixed or public or private nothing in this apply to any case where the defacing or destroying is taken under claim of right or with the presumed or actual consent of the owner or other person having the legal control care or custody of the property b the city manager or the police chief or director of public works with written approval of the city manager may offer a reward of up to $50000 to anyone providing material information leading to the arrest and conviction of any person for the wilful and malicious destruction of any cityowned property 02 taking or using property without authority whoever wilfully mischievously and without right takes or uses any property of another without the consent of the other person having the legal custody care of or control of the property shall if proved guilty be punished as provided by law nothing in this apply to any case where the taking of the property of another is with the intent to steal it or when it is taken under a claim or right or with the presumed consent of the owner or other person having the legal control care or custody of the property 03 injuring shade or other trees it shall be unlawful for any person to cut down cut bruise or otherwise injure any municipally owned shade or other trees within the city 07 cross reference tree protection state law reference similar provisions fs  59133 cutting trees or shrubs it shall be unlawful for any person without a city permit issued in accordance with the terms of this cut destroy or injure any of the trees or shrubs growing in or upon any of the public squares or streets of the city  however nothing contained in this prevent the city from trimming or removing trees or shrubs at its discretion 04 cross reference tree protection secs 58355855  reserved article iii  offenses against public peace unnecessary or disturbing noise a generally it shall be unlawful for any person to make continue or cause to be made or continued any loud unnecessary or disturbing noise which either annoys disturbs injures or endangers the comfort repose health peace or safety of others within the city b enumeration except as otherwise provided in this the following acts among others are declared to be loud disturbing and unnecessary noises in violation of a of this but this enumeration shall not be deemed to be exclusive 1 horns and signaling devices the sounding of any horn or signaling device on any automobile motorcycle or other vehicle on any street or public place of the city except as a danger warning the creation of any unreasonably loud or harsh sound by means of such a signaling device and the sounding of such a device for an unnecessary and unreasonable period of time  and the use of any signaling device except one operated by hand or electricity the use of any horn whistle or other device operated by engine exhaust and the use of such a signaling device when traffic is for any reason held up 2 radios phonographs boom boxes etc the using or operating of or permitting to be played used or operated any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound in such a manner as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of the neighboring inhabitants or at any time with louder volume than is necessary for convenient hearing for the person who is in the room vehicle or chamber in which the machine or device is operated and who is a voluntary listener thereto the operation of any set instrument phonograph machine or other device between the hours of  pm and  am in such a manner as to be plainly audible at a distance of 50 feet from the building structure or vehicle in which it is located shall be prima facie evidence of a violation of this 3 sound trucks the operation or permitting the operation of any sound truck or other device or medium for amplifying sound within the city for advertising purposes or to attract the attention of the public where the sound therefrom is transmitted from to in or over any public thoroughfare park or other public place this not prohibit the use of sound amplification for disseminating religious or political messages or information concerning civic recreational and other matters of general public interest permission for such broadcasting shall be obtained from the police chief who shall be authorized directed and empowered to make and enforce reasonable rules as to such use with reference to time place and volume the decision shall be appealable to the city commission within five days 4 yelling shouting etc yelling shouting hooting whistling or singing on the public streets at any time or place so as to annoy or disturb the quiet comfort or repose of persons in any office dwelling hotel or other type of residence or of any persons in the vicinity 5 noisy animals and birds the keeping of any animal or bird which by causing frequent or longcontinued noise shall disturb the comfort or repose of any persons in the vicinity 6 steam whistles the blowing of any train whistle or steam whistle attached to any stationary boiler except to give notice of the time to begin or stop work as a warning of fire or danger or upon request of proper city authorities 7 defect in vehicle or load the use of any automobile motorcycle or vehicle so out of repair so loaded or in such a manner as to create loud and unnecessary grating grinding rattling or other noise 8 loading or unloading  opening boxes the creation of loud and excessive noise in connection with loading or unloading any vehicle or the opening and destruction of boxes crates and containers 9 construction and demolition of buildings the erection demolition alteration or repair of any building other than between the hours of  am and  pm on mondays a if the city manager or hisher designee finds there is a reason to allow erection demolition alteration or repair outside those hours then the city manager or hisher designee may grant a permit for such work the valid reasons for granting such a permit are 1 an emergency exists  or 2 the public health and safety will not be impaired and loss or inconvenience would result to a party in interest if the permit was not granted b an application for the permit for work outside the hours in subsection 9a shall be submitted and approved prior to initiating work within the revised timeframe c the decision by the city manager or hisher designee shall be appealable to the city commission within five days of the rendition of the decision 10 creation of noise near schools courts churches and hospitals the creation of any excessive noise on any street adjacent to any school institution of learning church or court while these buildings are in use or adjacent to any hospital which unreasonably interferes with the working of the institution or which disturbs or unduly annoys patients in the hospital  however conspicuous signs must be displayed in these streets indicating that they are school hospital or court streets 11 hawkers and peddlers the shouting or crying of peddlers hawkers and vendors which disturbs the peace and quiet of the neighborhood 12 noises to attract attention the use of any drum or other instrument or device for the purpose of attracting attention by creation of noise to any performance show or sale 13 transport of metal rails the transportation of rails pillars or columns of iron steel or other material over and along streets and other public places upon carts drays cars or trucks or in any other manner so loaded as to cause loud noises or to disturb the peace and quiet of the streets or other public places 14 piledrivers hammers etc the operation between the hours of  pm and  am of any piledriver steamshovel pneumatic hammer derrick steam or electric hoist dredge or other appliance the use of which is attended by loud or unusual noise 15 blowers and other engines the operation of any noisecreating blower or power fan or any internal combustion engine the operation of which causes noise due to the explosion of operating gases or fluids unless the noise from the blower or fan is muffled and the engine is equipped with a muffler device sufficient to deaden the noise c complaint required for enforcement the provisions of this not be enforced unless a complaint is submitted by a citizen to the police department construction related offenses shall be handled to conclusion by the community development department d exceptions this not be construed to prohibit the following 1 music being made upon the streets or sidewalks of the city by brass bands or other bands 2 religious organizations from conducting reasonable services with the proper permit 3 operation of a motor vehicle from which ice cream and related products are sold in residential districts with a proper permit 4 loading and unloading of trucks in the normal course of business between the hours of  am to  pm on monday 02   11116 secs 58575875  reserved article iv  offenses against public safety discharge of weapons a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 bow means any weapon which action or kinetic energy propels an arrow bolt dart or other projectile 2 crossbow means any weapon consisting of a bow set transversely on a stock which action or kinetic energy propels an arrow bolt dart or other projectile 3 bb gun air gun and gasoperated gun mean any weapon which release of compressed air or gases propels a bb dart pellet or other projectile 4 destructive device means any explosive incendiary poisonous gas bomb grenade mine rocket missile or similar device or apparatus which is designed to or may readily be converted to explode and effect of blast flash heat fragments or projectiles cause damage or injury to person or property 5 weapon includes any of those devices defined in fs ch 790 as weapons b prohibited acts any person who knowingly discharges a weapon bow crossbow bb gun air gun gasoperated gun or destructive device within the city limits except as set forth in c of this shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree punishable as provided in fs   or  c exceptions 1 this not apply to any person lawfully defending life or property or to any law enforcement officer when acting in the course and scope of his official duty 2 this not apply to the discharge of weapons at a duly licensed and approved firing range or other appropriate training facility 10   91211 throwing stones or other missiles it shall be unlawful for any person to throw any stone or other missile on any of the streets or other public places within the city 06 slingshots it shall be unlawful for any person under the age of 18 years to use or shoot any slingshot or slungshot within the city unless done under the direct supervision of a responsible adult 09 secs 587958100  reserved article v  offenses against morals gambling the provisions of fs ch 849 are adopted as the gambling control code of the city 01 obscene literature profanity and pornography a the provisions of fs ch 847 are adopted as the obscene literature profanity and pornographic control code of the city an original copy of that chapter is placed on permanent file with the city clerk and the contents thereof made a part of this fully and completely as if set forth in this copy is to be always available for use inspection or reproduction by any citizen of the city b any person violating or permitting to be violated any of the provisions of this upon conviction be punished in accordance with the applicable provisions of fs ch 847 03 public decency a title this be known as the casselberry public decency  b intent 1 it is the intent of this protect and preserve the good order health safety welfare and morals of the citizens of the city by prohibiting a person from intentionally or recklessly appearing or being nude or causing another person to appear or be nude in a public place and in other places which may reasonably be expected to be observed by the public within the city 2 it is the further intention of this accomplish those findings declarations intents and purposes expressed in the recitals whereas clauses of this each of which are incorporated by reference into this c definitions  when used in this the following terms shall have the following meanings breast means a portion of the human female mammary gland commonly referred to as the female breast including the nipple and the areola the darker colored area of the breast surrounding the nipple and an outside area of such gland wherein such outside area is i reasonably compact and contiguous to the areola and ii contains at least the nipple and the areola and 14 of the outside surface of such gland buttocks means for a short general description see the last sentence of this  the area at the rear of the human body sometimes referred to as the gluteus maximus which lies between two imaginary straight lines running parallel to the ground when a person is standing the first or top such line being 12 inch below the top of the vertical cleavage of the nates ie the prominence formed by the muscles running from the back of the hip to the back of the leg and the second or bottom such line being 12 inch above the lowest point of the curvature of the fleshy protuberance sometimes referred to as the gluteal fold and between two imaginary straight lines one on each side of the body the outside lines which outside lines are perpendicular to the ground and to the horizontal lines described above and which perpendicular outside lines pass outermost points at which each nate meets the other side of each leg notwithstanding the above buttocks shall not include the leg the hamstring muscle below the gluteal fold the tensor fasciae latea muscle or any of the abovedescribed portion of the human body that is between either i the left inside perpendicular line and the left outside perpendicular line or ii the right inside perpendicular line and the right outside perpendicular line for the purpose of the previous sentence the left inside perpendicular line shall be an imaginary straight line on the left side of the anus i that is perpendicular to the ground and to the horizontal lines described above ii that is 13 of the distance from the anus to the left outside line and the right inside perpendicular line shall be an imaginary straight line on the right side of the anus i that is perpendicular to the ground and to the horizontal lines described above and iii that is 13 of the distance from the anus to the right outside line the above description can generally be described as covering 13 of the buttocks centered over the cleavage for the length of the cleavage entity means any proprietorship partnership corporation association business trust joint venture jointstock company or other for profit andor not for profit organization nude means any person insufficiently clothed in any manner so that any of the following body parts are not entirely covered with a fully opaque covering 1 the male or female genitals  2 the public area  3 the vulva  4 the penis  5 the female breast each female person may determine which 14 of her breast surface area see definition of breast contiguous to and containing the nipple and the areola is to be covered  6 the anus  7 the anal cleft  8 the anal cleavage  or 9 the buttocks attire which is insufficient to comply with this requirement includes but is not limited to gstrings tbacks dental floss and thongs 10 for the purposes of this body paint body dyes tattoos liquid latex whether wet or dried string and dental floss and similar substances shall not be considered opaque covering person means any live human being aged ten years of age or older places provided or set apart for nudity means enclosed single sex public restrooms enclosed single sex functional shower single sex locker andor dressing room facilities enclosed motel rooms and hotel rooms designed and intended for sleeping accommodation doctors offices portions of hospitals the yard area of residences and similar places in which nudity or exposure is necessarily and customarily expected outside of the home and the sphere of privacy constitutionally protected therein this term shall not be deemed to include places where a persons conduct of being nude is used for his or her profit or where being nude is used for the promotion of business or is otherwise for commercial gain public place means any location frequented by the public or where the public is present or likely to be present or where a person may reasonably be expected to be observed by members of the public public places include but are not limited to streets sidewalks parks beaches business and commercial establishments whether for profit or not for profit and whether open to the public at large or where entrance is limited by a cover charge or membership requirement or membership fee bottle clubs hotels motels restaurants night clubs country clubs cabarets and meeting facilities utilized by any religious social fraternal or similar organization premises or portions thereof such as hotel rooms used solely as a private residence whether permanent or temporary in nature shall not be deemed to be a public place d findings  in addition and supplemental to the findings and determinations contained in the recitals whereas clauses of this are incorporated by reference into this it is the intent of the city to regulate the conduct of appearing nude in public places for the purpose of regulating nudity and other conduct that considering what has happened in other communities the acts prohibited in e hereinbelow encourage or create the potential for the conduct of adverse secondary effects such as but not limited to prostitution attempted rape rape and assault  that actual and simulated nudity and sexual conduct in public places begets and has the potential for begetting undesirable and unlawful behavior  that sexual lewd lascivious and salacious conduct results in violation of law and creates dangers to the health safety morals and welfare of the public and those who engage in such conduct  and it is the intent of e of this specifically prohibit nudity gross sexuality and the simulation thereof e nudity sexual conduct prohibited  1 no person shall knowingly intentionally or recklessly appear or cause another person to appear nude as defined in c above or expose to public view his or her genitals vulva penis public area or buttocks or any simulation thereof  2 no person shall knowingly intentionally or recklessly expose or cause a female person to expose her breasts or any simulation thereof to public view  3 no person or entity maintaining owning or operating a public place shall encourage allow or permit any person to appear nude or to expose to public view his or her genitals public area vulva penis anus or any portion of the buttocks or simulation thereof this be violated if any portion of the buttocks is visible from any vantage point  4 no person shall engage in and no person or entity maintaining owning or operating a public place shall encourage allow or permit any sexual intercourse masturbation sodomy bestiality oral copulation flagellation lap dancing straddle dancing any sexual act which is prohibited by law touching caressing or fondling of the breasts buttocks anus or genitals or the simulation thereof  5 the prohibitions of this not apply when a person appears nude in a place provided or set apart for nudity provided i such person is nude for the sole purpose of performing the legal functions that is customarily intended to be performed within such place provided or set apart for nudity and ii such person
