portion of such abandoned facility at the communications services providers sole expense if the city determines that the abandoned facilitys presence interferes with the public health safety or welfare which shall include but shall not be limited to a determination that such facility 1 compromises safety at any time for any public rightsofway user  2 compromises the safety of other persons performing placement or maintenance of communications facilities in the public rightsofway  3 prevents another person from locating facilities in the area of public rightsofway where the abandoned facility is located when other alternative locations are not reasonably available  or 4 creates a maintenance condition that is disruptive to the use of the public rightsofways use in the event of 2 the city may require the third person to coordinate with the communications services provider that owns the existing facility for joint removal and placement where agreed to by the registrant c in the event that the city does not direct the removal of the abandoned facility the communications services provider by its notice of abandonment to the city shall be deemed to consent to the alteration or removal of all or any portion of the facility by the city or another person at such third partys cost d if the communications services provider fails to remove all or any portion of an abandoned facility as directed by the city within the timer period specified in the written notice which time period must be reasonable under the circumstances the city may perform such removal and charge the cost of the removal against the communications services provider  72318 force majeure in the event a communications services providers performance of or compliance with any of the provisions of this article is prevented by a cause or event not within the communications services providers control such inability to perform or comply shall be deemed excused and no penalties or sanctions shall be imposed as a result  provided however that such communications services provider uses all practicable means to expeditiously cure or correct any such inability to perform or comply for purposes of this article causes or events not within a communications services providers control shall include without limitation acts of god floods earthquakes landslides hurricanes fires and other natural disasters acts of public enemies riots or civil disturbances sabotage strikes and restraints imposed by order of a governmental agency or court causes or events within communications services providers control and thus not falling within this shall include without limitation communications services providers financial inability to perform or comply economic hardship and misfeasance malfeasance or nonfeasance by any of communications services providers directors officers employees contractors or agents  72318 fees applicable to those not subject to communications services tax while the florida legislature has prohibited municipalities from requiring providers of communications services who have registered with the florida department of revenue from having to enter into franchise agreements or license arrangements as a condition to placing or maintaining communications facilities in the public rightsofway the city expressly reserves the right to require the payment of consideration or regulatory fees by persons using or occupying the public rightsofway in other capacities the city reserves the right to require such payments based on the type of user and to the extent as follows 1 dealer except as provided elsewhere a communications services provider who meets the definition of dealer as set forth in this article and who has registered in accordance with is not required to enter into a franchise agreement or license arrangement with the city as a condition to placing or maintaining communications facilities in the public rightsofway nor is a dealer required to make payment of any franchise fees license fees or other user fees to the city as consideration for the use or occupancy of the public rightsofway for the provision of communication services 2 passthrough provider and passthrough facilities a communications services provider who meets the definition of passas set forth in this article and who is not subject to the city of casselberrys local communications services tax imposed pursuant to fs  20219 and 20220 shall pay the city the maximum annual amount allowed under fs  6b as amended for purposes of calculating payments hereunder each separate pole or tower installed or maintained by a passfor purposes of supporting antennas for other overtheair radio transmission or reception equipment in the public rightsofway shall comprise a separate communications facility subject to assessment of a separate permit fee in the amount of $50000 per linear mile or portion thereof up to the maximum amount allowed under fs  6b whichever is higher the annual amount referred to above shall be due and payable on october 1 of every year beginning on  fees not paid within ten days after the due date shall bear interest at the rate of one percent per month from the date due until paid the acceptance of any payment required hereunder by the city shall not be construed as an acknowledgment that the amount paid is the correct amount due nor shall such acceptance of payment be construed as a release of any claim which the city may have for additional sums due and payable or authorization to install any facilities in the public rightsofway 3 other persons all other persons except government are required to pay the city as consideration for the use or occupancy of the public rightsofway for the placement or maintenance of communications facilities an amount based on and in accordance with the city 4 government a government is not required to pay the city consideration for the use or occupancy of the public rightsofway for the placement or maintenance of communications facilities unless such facilities are being used by such government or a communications services provider including resellers to offer or provide communication services other than for such governments internal noncommercial use in which event the government where not subject to the city of casselberrys local communications services tax imposed pursuant to fs  20219 and 20220 is required to pay the city as consideration for the use or occupancy of the public rightsofway by or facilities an amount based on and in accordance with the city such other amount or rate of compensation as mutually agreed to in writing by the government and the city  72318 reservation of rights and remedies a the city hereby expressly reserves all of the following rights 1 to exercise its municipal home rule powers now or hereafter to the fullest extent allowed by law with regard to the access use and regulation of the public rightsofway 2 to amend this article as it shall find necessary in the lawful exercise of its municipal authority and police powers 3 to adopt or enact by resolution or ordinance in addition to the provisions contained herein and in any existing applicable ordinances such additional reasonable regulations as the city commission finds necessary in the exercise of the citys police powers 4 to exercise the power of eminent domain consistent with applicable federal and state law to acquire property that may include that property owned or leased by a communications services provider 5 as and when deemed necessary by the city commission to be in the interest of the city or its residents to abandon portions of the public rightsofway within the proper exercise of its municipal authority and without notice to or the consent of any communications services provider the city shall not be responsible for any costs damages loss or other expense to the communications services provider as a result of the citys abandonment of any public rightsofway 6 to place and maintain and permit to be placed or maintained sewer gas water electric storm drainage communications and other types of facilities cables or conduit and to do and to permit to be done any underground and overhead installation or improvement that may be deemed necessary or proper by the city in the public rightsofway occupied by any communications services provider 7 without limitation to alter change or cause to be changed the grading installation relocation or width of any public rightsofway within the limits of the city and within said limits as same may from time to time be altered 8 to require a reseller to register in accordance with to the extent such reseller wants the right to place or maintain facilities in the public rightsofway any person using or leasing facilities owned by a registered communications services provider is not therefore entitled to any rights to place or maintain communications facilities in the public rightsofway unless such person themselves registers with the city b this article shall be applicable to all communications facilities placed in the public rightsofway on or after the effective date of this article and shall apply to all existing communications facilities in the public rightsofway prior to the effective date of this article to the full extent permitted by state and federal law c the adoption of this article is not intended to affect any rights or defenses of the city or a communications service provider under any existing franchise license or other agreements with a communications services provider d nothing in this article shall affect the remedies the city or the communications services provider has available under applicable law e any person who uses the communications facilities of a communications services provider other than the communications services provider that owns the facilities shall not be entitled to any rights to place or maintain such facilities in excess of the rights of the registrant that places or maintains the facilities f if provisions of this article conflict with any other provision of the city ordinances or the unified land development regulations the more restrictive provisions shall govern  72318 special provisions for certain eligible facilities modifications notwithstanding any other provisions of this the city shall not deny any eligible facilities request for a modification to an existing tower or base station which does not substantially change the physical dimensions of such tower or base station provided the procedure and requirements set forth in d of the unified land development regulations are satisfied except as may otherwise be provided in this article and not withstanding any other provisions in the city the provisions of d of the unified land development regulations shall be the sole and exclusive procedure for review and approval of an eligible facilities request which the applicant asserts is subject to review under a of the middle class tax relief and job creation act of 2012 spectrum act as interpreted by the fcc acceleration of broadband deployment report and order dated  to the extent that other provisions of the city a parallel process for review and approval of a project application for a proposed eligible facilities request the provisions of d shall control in the event that an application for a project includes a proposal to modify an eligible support structure and the applicant does not assert in the application that the proposal is subject to review under the spectrum act such proposal shall not be subject to review under d and may be subject to review under other applicable provisions of the city  72318 compliance with state and federal regulations  preemption in implementing this the provisions set forth herein the city shall comply with applicable state and federal regulations and the provisions of this be given force to the maximum amount and greatest extent permissible under state and federal law except as authorized pursuant to state and federal law in the event of any conflict between the terms of this article and state or federal law state and federal law shall control in the event any provision of this specifically preempted or judicially determined to be preempted by state or federal law then the preempted provision shall automatically be deemed null and void and the superseding provision of state or federal law shall prevail  72318 solid waste footnotes  1  charter reference power of city to provide read as herein set out see the table for full derivation dumping refuse or rubbish along streets it shall be unlawful for any person to dump cause to be dumped place or cause to be placed any refuse or rubbish of any kind along the streets of the city  32612 spilling rock sand etc on street it shall be unlawful for any person hauling any fill rock sand concrete or other materials to spill these materials onto the streets of the city any person who shall violate the provisions of this upon conviction be punished as provided in this subsequent continued violations may be so punished from time to time in spite of previous convictions or acquittals of the original violation or charge no conviction or acquittal shall be deemed to bar any civil remedy to enforce compliance with the regulations of this to abate any nuisance arising from a violation  32612 secs 7037030  reserved article ii  collection division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning dwelling unit means each unit in any singlefamily duplex triplex or multifamily residential living unit with kitchen facilities multifamily dwelling unit means the individual unit in any building or structure with kitchen facilities capable of being utilized for residential living other than a hotel or motel unit and containing four or more units under one roof recyclable materials means those components of solid waste capable of being recycled including newspaper  glass  food and beverage containers  aluminum tinplated steel and bimetal cans  polyethylene terephthalate pet and highdensity polyethylene hdpe  and any other solid waste materials which are from time to time so designated by the city residential collection unit means all dwelling units mobile homes in mobile home parks each multifamily dwelling unit receiving individual collection for each unit and mobile homes with rp license tags but excludes residential units receiving dumpster service as of the date of adoption of the ordinance from which this derived d f 32591 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 penalties  enforcement of a any person engaged in the business of collecting waste or rendering solid waste services who is not authorized by the city shall be guilty of a violation punishable in accordance with b the violation of  shall be punishable as follows 1 for the first conviction by a fine of not less than $1000 and not more than $2500 2 for a second conviction within one year by a fine of not less than $2500 and not more than $5000 3 for a third conviction within one year by a fine of not less than $5000 and not more than $10000 4 for a fourth and each subsequent conviction within one year by a fine of not less than $10000 and not more than $25000 c the city at its option may utilize its board for enforcement of this  32591 collection required  collection franchise a the city shall collect or cause to be collected of a negotiated franchise all solid waste and recyclable materials at regular intervals to be determined by the city all solid waste in the business section of the city shall be collected and disposed of daily and the owner or operator of each business establishment shall be required to pay the expenses of collecting and disposing of that solid waste all residents occupants or owners of residential premises in the city shall be required to have accumulations of solid waste and recyclable materials removed and disposed of by the city or its franchised agent and for such service or the availability of such service of solid waste and recyclable materials removal and disposal shall pay the city the fees set by resolution b all solid waste or recyclable materials from residential property in the city shall be collected conveyed and disposed of or delivered by a franchised agent of the city under the supervision of the governing agent of the city no person shall collect convey over any of the streets or alleys of the city or dispose of any refuse accumulated in the city without a written contract license franchise or permit from the city this not prohibit the actual producers of refuse or the owners of premises upon which refuse has accumulated from personally collecting conveying and disposing of the refuse provided the provisions of this complied with this not prohibit collectors of refuse from outside the city from hauling the refuse over city streets  however such collectors must comply with this with all other laws and ordinances governing such transport c the franchised agent of the city shall have authority to suggest regulations concerning the days for collection conveyance and disposal as he shall find necessary and to change and modify the regulations after approval by the city commission as required by law provided that such changes and modifications in the regulations are not contrary to this are in compliance with the franchise agreement 05  a c 32591 frequency of collection a frequency of collection under this be as follows 1 domestic garbage shall be collected not less than two times per week there shall be at least a twoday interval between collections 2 domestic trash shall be collected at least once each week there shall be at least a twoday interval between collections 3 waste from commercial establishments using commercial containers and domestictype containers shall be collected in accordance with a as it relates to the collection of garbage in the business section 4 commercial trash shall be collected not less than one time per week and no more than six times per week b the collector of refuse shall have the right to divide large accumulations of trash for successive collections 06 points of collection a residential service generally except as otherwise provided all residential solid waste and recyclable materials to be collected shall be placed within three feet of the curb paved surface of the roadway or closest accessible rightofway or at such other location agreed to by the city or its franchised agent that will provide safe and efficient accessibility for the collection crew and vehicle b special residential service where the resident of a residential collection unit is handicapped or physically unable to deliver solid waste or recyclable materials to the curbside and there is no one else living at the residential collection unit who is physically able to deliver solid waste or recyclable materials to the curbside and these conditions are certified by the city an alternative location within 50 feet of the street visible from the street with collection limited to two containers of garbage plus recyclable materials in the appropriate bin may be arranged at no extra cost to the resident other residents desiring side door service shall pay the additional fee set forth in the solid waste rate resolution c commercial service all commercial garbage and trash must be placed in containers on the property and not within the rightofway of any alley or street the containers shall be accessible without entering a building or shelter of any type 07ac   32591 containers a compaction of refuse prior to depositing refuse for collection in garbage containers or commercial containers the owner or other person depositing such refuse shall collapse all cardboard boxes and crates and other items which can reasonably be reduced in size b specifications refuse containers are required as follows 1 residential containers each resident is required to furnish garbage containers which are adequate to hold all solid waste solid waste containers shall be any commonly available lightgauge steel plastic or galvanized receptacle of a nonabsorbent material closed at one end and open at the other furnished with a closely fitted lid or top and handles or waterproof plastic bags of heavy mil construction which can be safely and securely closed a receptacle including waste materials shall not exceed 32 gallons in capacity or 50 pounds in weight no oil drums shall be used the owner of rental property shall be responsible for furnishing adequate containers for the property 2 commercial containers all commercial garbage deposited in containers must be placed in plastic bags garbage container liners or other containers that may be approved by the governing agent any commercial establishment not using containers owned by the city or a franchised agent must furnish containers which are adequate to hold all garbage these containers shall have a capacity of not more than 30 gallons and shall have tightfitting lids c use of cityowned containers the city reserves the right to furnish containers owned by the city to all commercial establishments it shall be the duty of the governing agent to regulate the placement of all cityowned containers when cityowned containers are furnished to commercial establishments the commercial establishments shall use the furnished containers exclusively d prohibited commercial receptacles no commercial refuse shall be deposited in or collected from an open bin trash room oil drum box or any other receptacle not authorized in this e disposal of ashes ashes shall be cooled for 24 hours before depositing the ashes in any commercial container any establishment depositing hot ashes in any container within the city which cause damage to the container shall be responsible for the costs of replacing that container f maintenance all refuse containers shall be maintained and kept in a sanitary condition by the owners any containers which fail to meet these sanitary standards are declared to be a nuisance and shall be condemned and disposed of upon order of the governing agent g recycling containers the city or its franchisee shall provide recycling containers for holding recyclable materials at the curbside only recyclable materials shall be stored in these recycling containers until collected in accordance with this be eligible for pickup recyclable materials must be put in the recycling container newspapers shall be put in a kraft paper bag or be securely tied in a bundle and placed on top of or next to the recycling container 08   5 32591 removal of dead animals no dead animals shall be placed for collection by the city or its franchised agent should it become necessary for the city to collect and remove dead animals from the property of any citizen the city shall assess all costs of the collection and removal against the citizen violating the requirements of this 07d cross reference removal of dead animals  189 prohibited acts except as provided in this it shall be unlawful and a violation of this do any of the following 1 for any person other than the city or its franchisee to collect or transport solid waste or recyclable materials for hire or remuneration of any kind 2 for any person other than the city or its franchisee to remove solid waste or recyclable materials from any refuse bin container collection location or the curbside 3 for any person other than the city to place solid waste or recyclable materials out for collection in any location not serviced by the franchisee or the city 4 for any person other than the city to place or cause to be placed any solid waste upon the property of another 5 for any person other than the city to offer or authorize solid waste or recyclable materials for collection by any person other than the franchisee or the city however voluntary and nonprofit organizations may collect recyclable materials provided that such materials are not removed from containers after placement for collection by the franchisee or the city 6 for any person other than the city to do any act prohibited or fail to do any act required by this by regulations adopted pursuant to this 7 for any person other than the city to withhold payment as required by this not conform to the solid waste rate resolution  32591 secs 70397050  reserved division 2  rates and charges establishment of rates and deposit the city shall by resolution set collection rates and may establish security deposits for all customers served under the terms and conditions of the franchise agreement for collection of solid waste these rates shall be reviewed periodically and shall be adjusted based on available data such as current cost paid to the contractor for services administrative cost incurred by the city and any cost associated with compliance with state county or federal environmental regulations this resolution will be known as the solid waste rate resolution b 32591 responsibility for payment of charges the owner and occupant of each residential collection unit whether or not it is occupied shall be responsible for payment of the fees and deposits prescribed in this the solid waste rate resolution e 32591 billing  delinquency a billing  due date for payment solid waste and recyclable materials collection bills shall be rendered monthly and shall be included with the water sewer and utility tax bill but each charge shall be shown as a separate item on the bill the charges shall be governed by the same due date and delinquent date and shall be payable within 20 days from the billing date any payment not received by the city within 20 calendar days from the billing date shall be delinquent b separate payment of charges prohibited no customer charged for water sewer solid waste and recyclable materials collection or the city utility tax may pay such charges without simultaneously paying all such charges late payment or nonpayment of either the water sewer solid waste and recyclable materials collection fee whether billed by the city or its authorized agent or city utility tax shall constitute a delinquency under this authorize abatement of all such services by the city after notice of the delinquency c delinquency charge  disconnection of utility services the director of public works is authorized to impose a delinquency charge of $1500 on all solid waste and recyclable materials collection accounts delinquent for over 20 calendar days and is hereby authorized to discontinue service to such delinquent accounts after the required second notice where service has been discontinued service will not resume until the amount of the delinquent account and the sum of $1500 representing disconnect and reconnect charges has been paid to the city if the account is delinquent two times in a 12month period the reconnection fee shall be $2500 for each subsequent reconnection thereafter total arrearages plus the delinquency charge must be paid by the customer before reconnection or resumption of water sewer and solid waste and recyclable materials collection services by the city d payment of delinquent account by persons vacating property when an owner or occupant vacates or sells his property leaving a delinquent utility bill the city may at its option refuse the delinquent customer any and all utility services until the original account is paid in full i 121691 article iii  grant of commercial solid waste franchise there is hereby granted to ____________ herein called the franchisee its successors and assigns a nonexclusive right privilege or franchise to collect garbage refuse trash and other solid waste materials from commercial establishments within the city of casselberry seminole county florida during the term and subject to the following limitations and conditions as hereinafter set forth definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning city shall mean the city of casselberry florida a municipal corporation commercial establishment or business or generator or customer shall mean any public or private place building andor enterprise devoted in whole or in part to a business enterprise whether nonprofit or profit making in nature  except where such place building andor enterprise constitutes a single family residence or multiple dwelling of four units or less condominiums patio houses and other such facilities where the individual units are privately owned and used for residential purposes are not commercial establishments within the context of the definition of commercial establishments unless bulk collection for such facilities is used rather than individual residential unit collection commercial rubbish and trash shall mean such combustibles as paper wood yard trimmings etc and noncombustibles such as metal glass stone dirt etc commercial solid waste shall mean garbage rubbish trash etc resulting from the normal activities of establishments that are required to obtain an occupational license from the city container shall mean any portable nonabsorbent enclosed container with a close fitting cover or doors approved by the health department and the city which is used to store large volumes of refuse it must be capable of being serviced by mechanical equipment franchisee shall mean the individual partnership or corporation whowhich agrees as hereinafter provided to perform the work or service or to furnish materials or equipment or both as set forth in this franchise garbage shall mean every waste accumulation and animal and vegetable matter which attend the preparation use cooking processing handling or storage of meats fish fowl fruits vegetables or other matter which is subject to decomposition decay putrefaction and the generation of offensive and noxious gasses or odors or which during or after decay may serve as breeding or feeding materials for flies insects or animals recyclable materials shall mean those materials which are capable of being recycled and which would otherwise be processed or disposed of as solid waste included but not limited to newspapers glass bottles metal cans aluminum and delabeled tin plastic containers and such other recyclable materials as the parties may designate in writing special material shall mean bulky materials or other special wastes that are not stored in standard storage containers and cannot be picked up by a normally used collection vehicle wastes not to be collected are major appliances furniture building materials tree limbs noncontainerized trash piles or any abnormal amount of refuse not suitable for containerization which will be picked up by calling office of the franchisee and arranging by special service to be billed on basis of labor truck costs and dumping charges  42406 term a this franchise shall terminate on september 30 following the effective date hereof  provided however the city reserves the right to terminate the same prior thereto if the franchisee defaults in any one of the terms and conditions herein specified b on october 1 this franchise shall be automatically extended for an additional term expiring the following september 30 provided the franchisee shall make application for said extension prior to its termination and upon approval of the city commission  42406 service a minimum service the franchisee shall make at least two weekly collections at all commercial establishments subject to the terms of this franchise and at sufficient additional intervals necessary to protect the environment unless otherwise approved in advance by the city provided however where the refuse is exclusively nonputrescible in nature once weekly collections are permitted commercial establishments may be required to have more than two weekly collections if needed and when notified by the city such collections shall be the responsibility of the commercial establishment to schedule and pay for such collections b service during disaster in the event of a major storm the franchisee shall make available to its customers adequate equipment and personnel to clear any and all debris placed in the containers within 12 hours of notification from the citys representative of an approaching hurricane tornado or similar act of god  42406   112006 collection schedules a the city shall maintain records of the solid waste management services that are to be provided to the customers at the start of the franchise the franchisee shall provide the city with a written list including customer name service address container size and number pickup frequency and special instructions b the city reserves the right to deny the franchisees vehicles access to certain streets alleys and public rightsofway inside the city where it is in the best interest of the general public to do so due to conditions of streets or bridges the franchisee shall not interrupt the regular schedule or quality of services because of such street closures  42406   112006 hours a collections shall be made between  am and  pm unless different times are approved by the city b in the event the franchisee fails to comply with permitted hours of operation or with any term or provision of this franchise the city may impose a fine of $10000 per such noncompliance additional violations of the same nature within a sixmonth period will cause the fine to be increased by $10000 for each individual instance failure to pay such fines may result in a hearing to consider revocation of contract c on those days when the disposal site generally used by the franchisee is closed in commemoration of a holiday the franchisee shall reschedule the collection of that days routes within that week when possible the franchisee shall provide to the commercial establishment in advance a list of approved holidays and the alternate pickup days in the event of an unforeseen event the franchisee shall notify the commercial establishment of the change in service as soon as possible  42406 litter the franchisee shall not litter premises roads streets or rightsofway in the process of making collections and shall promptly pick up all papers material or debris that may come out of the container during pickup the franchisee shall collect all material that has been placed in the containers unless otherwise directed by the city the franchisee will promptly notify the city if a customer routinely leaves material around the container rather than inside the container for code enforcement action  42406   112006 approved containers a amounts and types of solid waste placed in containers for collection shall be stored in standard manufacturedtype mechanically served containers only unless otherwise approved by the city and unless consistent with all other governmental regulation and whose volume is listed in cubic yards franchisee shall provide adequate containers for the services rendered hereunder containers must be in good condition cleaned repaired and painted as needed by the franchisee if requested by the city the franchisee shall replace old or damaged containers with newer ones such container shall be provided at franchisees cost and shall remain the property of franchisee unless the container is owned by the customer b collection containers shall have plastic versus metal lids in order to control noise nuisance  42406 special materials a hazardous materials franchisee may provide haul service for special and hazardous materials not routinely generated in business or commercial areas said materials shall be stored and placed in a manner approved by the city and the franchisee no hazardous wastes will be collected by the franchisee unless specifically required by the generator approved by the city and agreed to by the franchisee there shall be an additional fee for special or hazardous materials pickups b large debris franchise may provide haul service for large debris and volume determination and rate will be negotiated between the franchisee and the business  42406 franchisees equipment a the franchisee shall provide an adequate number of vehicles for regular collection services they shall be kept in good repair appearance and in a sanitary condition at all times each vehicle shall have clearly visible on each side the name and phone number of the franchisee and the vehicle number b the franchisee shall install and maintain in good working condition a method of communication that would allow the driver andor other collection personnel the means to contact either city emergency personnel directly or other city staff that may summon assistance in the case of an emergency c franchisee shall certify to the city upon the commencement of each franchise year the nature and quantity of vehicles and equipment on hand and available for regular collection services and backup in the event of the breakdown of any primary collection vehicles d each dumpster shall be systematically marked with the franchisees name and account type solid waste or recycling in a manner approved by the city to identify its capacity in cubic yardage scheduled date of pickup or on call and its dumpster number  ie 6 mwf 452 would be a sixyard dumpster to be picked up monday wednesday and friday and it would be dumpster number 452 such markings shall be amended to provide such other information as the city may require promptly upon receipt of a notice from the city requiring a change of container markings e all vehicles must have operable washout systems for disinfecting commercial service containers f all front loading vehicles must be equipped with hopper doors to prevent material from blowing out of the area where material is placed into the vehicle g all trucks or other vehicles used on the public streets and roads within the city of casselberry should be required to conform to all current state motor vehicle requirements h all vehicles shall be subject to and shall immediately submit to spot or on the road inspections and if found to be in noncompliance said vehicle shall be immediately removed from service until it can be repaired and is successfully reinspected i the use of vehicles failing to conform to all current state motor vehicle requirements may be grounds for the removal of the franchise after notice to the franchisee and an opportunity to be heard  42406   112006 office the franchisee shall establish and maintain a local office or such other facilities it can be contacted where service may be applied for and complaints can be made it shall be equipped with sufficient telephones shall have one qualified and responsible person in charge during collection hours and shall be open during collection hours a method to receive afterhour calls shall be utilized a business office should be located within 25 miles of corporate limits of the city and that office should keep regular business hours to allow customers to contact the franchisee  42406 hauling all solid waste hauled by the franchisee shall be contained or enclosed so that leaking spilling or blowing are prevented in the event of any spillage the franchisee shall immediately clean up the litter  42406 disposal a all solid waste for disposal shall be hauled to sites or facilities legally empowered to accept it for treatment or disposal the city reserves the right to approve or disapprove solid waste disposal sites taking into account the costs routes within the city and rules and regulations of the governmental body having jurisdiction over said sites or facilities the city shall always have the right to require disposal at city owned or operated facilities b the city will not be responsible for disposal charges or any recycling fees charged to the franchisee the franchisee is responsible for disposing of all collected waste and recyclables collected in the city in accordance with all state and federal statutes andor regulations and agrees to accept all liability for any remedial activities or fines which may arise from the unlawful disposal of same  42406 charges and rates a all charges and rates for the commercial collection of garbage shall be set by the franchisee in negotiation with the commercial establishment requiring the service b the franchisee shall provide adequate containers as determined by the director of public works or designee and solid waste collection disposal and recycling services for up to 12 special events sponsored or conducted by the city in each calendar year at no cost to the city the 12 events will be reasonably apportioned on a rotational basis among all franchisees based on the franchisees number of containers within the city and anticipated volumes and tonnages of waste from the special event for any additional special events the parties shall negotiate in advance the cost of solid waste collection and disposal which shall not exceed the cost to other commercial establishments within the city  42406   112006 labor and costs the franchisee shall at its sole cost and expense except as otherwise provided herein furnish all labor and equipment required to perform the services required pursuant to this franchise  42406 location all solid waste shall be placed in approved containers at locations that are readily accessible to the franchisees personnel and in locations consistent with city c containers shall be located on private property the use of city property for the siting of containers may be approved by the city after an appropriate application is filed an investigation occurs and a permit is issued  42406 compensation and payment a compensation shall be paid by the franchisee to the city on a monthly basis based upon a sum equal to 20 percent of the gross revenue received from all sources related to franchisees operations in the city including fees charges rental of equipment and funds paid outside of the city from materials hauled from the city rolloff fee compensation shall also be based on a sum equal to 20 percent of the gross revenue from rolloff charges where collection is provided on the basis of not more than three 32gallon containers two times per week the fee shall be $350 per month such fees shall not include fees generated directly from recycling b all payments shall be due on the 25th of the month following the month of service any and all payments not paid by the 25th of the month following the month of service shall bear interest at the rate of 20 percent per annum from the first of the month following the month of service or the highest interest rate allowed by state law whichever is less  42406   112006 discontinued service on delinquent accounts a the franchisee may discontinue service as set forth in this who have not remitted required payments within 20 days after the date of billing shall be notified by the franchisee said notification shall contain a statement that service may be discontinued 20 days from the date of notice if payment is not made before that time in the event the franchisee intends to discontinue a delinquent account it shall so notify the city at least 20 days prior to the last day of collection upon payment of delinquent fees the franchisee shall resume collection on the next regularly scheduled collection day b the city shall have the authority to direct the franchisee to continue service notwithstanding the fact that an account may be delinquent upon written assumption by the city of fees accruing by virtue of franchisees continued service if the city elects to instruct the franchisee to continue service the city shall be entitled to reimbursement from the commercial establishment served plus all costs of collection to include attorneys fees c the city shall require a late fee for commercial establishments who are delinquent in paying amounts owed twenty days past the due date shall be considered delinquent such delinquent sums may be recovered by the city and collection services may be discontinued until delinquent charges have been paid after two notices to the customer as required by a delinquent charge of $1500 shall apply to all accounts delinquent 20 days or more service may not be resumed until such time as the city instructs the franchisee to begin or until charges are paid in full whichever occurs first  42406 reports a on the 25th day of the month following the month of service hereunder the franchisee shall provide the city public works director with a report said report shall be in a form either hard copy computer disk compatible with the citys computers or otherwise satisfactory to the city the report shall include such information as the city may reasonably require so as to ensure proper garbage service by all commercial establishments within the city and so as to ensure franchisees compliance with the terms and conditions of this franchise unless otherwise directed by the citys public works director each report shall contain as a minimum 1 customers utility number assigned by the city 2 customers business name 3 customers business address 4 customers telephone number 5 containers numbers 6 container type front end rollout cart rolloff etc 7 containers capacity 8 compactors 9 pickup schedule for containers and compactors 10 number of pickups for all containers and compactors 11 franchisee fee 12 account type solid waste or recycling b failure to submit the report required by this result in a $5000 fine per day that the report is late  42406 complaints a all complaints shall be addressed within 24 working hours from the receipt of the complaint by the franchisee b the franchisee shall supply the city director of public works with copies of all complaints on a form approved by the city and indicate the disposition of each complaint such records shall be available for city inspection at all times during business hours the form shall indicate the day and hour on which the complaint was received and the day and hour in which it was addressed the name of the complainant the nature of the complaint and the manner of resolution when a complaint is received on the day preceding a holiday or on a saturday it shall be serviced on the next normal working day each customer complaint shall be considered legitimate unless satisfactory evidence to the contrary is furnished to the director of public works or designee  42406 penalties in the event the franchisee fails to comply with any term or provision of this franchise the city may impose a fine of $10000 per such noncompliance additional violations of the same nature within a sixmonth period will cause the fine to be increased by $10000 for each individual instance failure to pay such fines may result in a hearing to consider revocation of contract the decision of the director of public works or designee shall be final  42406 notification the franchisee shall notify all customers about complaint procedures regulation and days of collection  42406 franchise personnel a the franchisee shall assign a qualified person or persons to be in charge of hisher operations in the city and shall give the name or names to the city together with information regarding experience b franchisees collection employees shall wear a clean uniform bearing the franchisees name and maintain a disciplined manner while in uniform c each employee shall at all times carry a valid operators license for the type of vehicle heshe is driving vehicle drivers shall not unduly interfere with vehicular or pedestrian traffic and vehicles shall not be left standing on streets except as made necessary by loading operations and shall move with the traffic flow d the city may request the dismissal or appropriate discipline of any employee of the franchisee who violates any provision hereof or who is wanton negligent or discourteous in the performance of hisher duties e the franchisee shall provide operating and safety training for all personnel and shall certify same to the city annually upon renewal of this franchise such certification shall include a roster identifying all employees employed in the city their job descriptions and nature and type of training given said employees f the franchisee shall comply with the equal employment opportunity program the fair labor standards act and all other applicable federal and state statutes pertaining to fair employment practices  42406 employment and compliance with laws a compliance within laws the right is hereby reserved for the city to adopt in addition to the provisions herein contained and existing applicable ordinances such additional regulations as it shall find necessary in the exercise of the police power provided that such regulations by ordinance or otherwise shall be reasonable and not in conflict with the intended purpose of this franchise the franchisee shall conduct operations under this franchise in compliance with all applicable laws and its failure to comply shall constitute a default hereunder this franchise shall not be construed to repeal or revise any existing ordinance and to the extent that any provision of this franchise is inconsistent with any existing ordinance then such existing ordinance shall prevail and control b employeesin general no person convicted of a crime crimes andor repeated noncriminal violations of traffic laws which demonstrate a propensity to unfaithfully fulfill the duties of his employment  such as but not limited to larcenous activity aggravated battery or other violence those relating to the operation of motor vehicles and any crime for which civil rights have been removed within the past two years  shall be employed by the franchisee to perform collection services under this franchise  42406 performance bond the franchisee shall furnish to the city a performance bond executed by a surety authorized to do business in the state of florida in the amount of $5000000 or a letter of credit acceptable to the city insuring the faithful performance of the terms of this franchise including but not limited to the payment of franchise fees to the city  42406   112006 liability franchisee agrees to purchase comprehensive public liability and property damage insurance in the amount of $500000000 per accident event or occurrence naming the city as an additional insured to the extent of its rights against franchisee arising by virtue of this insurance policy will provide that the city shall be given 15 days written notice prior to cancellation or modification a copy of said policy of insurance shall be filed with the city clerk on or before the effective date of the franchise nothing set forth in this franchise shall be deemed to waive the citys sovereign immunity the franchisee shall indemnify hold harmless and defend the city its agents and employees from and against any and all liabilities losses claims damages demands expenses or actions either at law or in equity including court costs and attorneys fees that may hereafter at any time be made or brought by anyone on account of personal injury property damage loss of monies or other loss allegedly caused or incurred in whole or in part as a result of any negligent wrongful or intentional act or omission or based on any act of fraud or defalcation by the franchisee its agents subcontractors assigns heirs and employees during performance under this franchise the extent of this indemnification shall not be limited in any way as to the amount or types of damages or compensation payable to the city on account of any insurance limits contained in any insurance policy procured or provided in connection with this franchise in any and all claims against the city or any of its agents or employees by an employee of the franchisee any subcontractor heir assign anyone directly or indirectly employed by any of them or anyone for whose acts any of them may be liable the indemnification obligation under this paragraph shall not be limited in any way as to the amount or type of damages compensation or benefits payable by or for franchisee or any subcontractor under workers compensation acts disability benefit acts or other employee benefit acts  42406   112006 licenses the franchisee shall at its sole expense procure from all governmental authorities having jurisdiction over the operations of the franchisee including the city all licenses certificates permits or other authorizations which may be necessary for the conduct of its operations the franchisee shall pay all taxes licenses certifications permits and examination fees and excises which may be assessed levied exacted or imposed on its property on its operations on its gross receipts and upon this franchise and the rights and privileges granted herein and shall make all applications reports and returns required in connection therewith  42406 workers compensation the franchisee shall carry with an insurance company authorized to transact business in the state of florida a policy that fulfills all the requirements of the workers compensation act of said state including all legal requirements for occupational diseases  42406 assignment no assignment of this franchise or any right occurring under this franchise shall be made in whole or in part by the franchisee without the expressed written consent of the city in the event of any assignment the assignee shall assume the liability of the franchisee  42406 franchisee as independent contractor it is hereby understood and agreed to by the parties that the franchisee shall be deemed to be an independent contractor and neither the franchisee nor any of its officers agents or employees shall attain any rights or benefits under the civil service or pension ordinances of the city of casselberry or any rights generally afforded to classified or unclassified employees of the city  42406 director to be arbitrator to prevent misunderstanding and litigation the director of public works shall decide any and all minor questions not involving a material default under this franchise which may arise concerning the quality and acceptability of the work and services performed the sufficiency of performance the interpretation of the provisions of the franchise and the acceptable fulfillment of the franchise on the part of the franchisee regarding those minor defaults the director of public works will determine based on a reasonable interpretation of the facts whether or not the amount quantity character and quality of the work performed is satisfactory which determination shall be final conclusive and binding upon both the city and the franchisee the director of public works shall make such explanation as may be necessary to complete explain or make definite the provisions of the franchise and his findings and conclusions shall be final and binding upon both parties  42406   112006 inspection of work the franchisee shall provide the director of public works or designee with every reasonable opportunity to ascertain whether or not the work as performed is in accordance with the requirements of the franchise the franchisee shall designate in writing a person to serve as liaison between the franchisee and the city the director of public works or designee may appoint qualified persons to inspect the franchisees operation and equipment at any reasonable time and the franchisee shall admit such persons to make such inspections at any reasonable time and place  42406 books records and audit a the franchisee shall keep records of wastes collected and charges therefore and the city shall have the right to review those records which in any way pertain to the payments due it as well as the billing of all customers by the franchisee the franchisee will be responsible for the monthly billing of the customer b franchisee shall furnish the city with an annual audit due november 15 of each calendar year for the service year or portion thereof ending the previous september 30 said audit shall be prepared by an independent certified public accountant complete with the auditors opinion which opinion shall be acceptable to the city the audit shall reflect the accuracy and completeness of the information provided the city by the franchisee with special attention to the franchise fee the city reserves the right to perform its own independent audit of franchisees books and records at all times upon reasonable notice c the city may impose a fine in the amount of $5000 a day payable to the city by the franchisee for each day that the annual audit is late  42406   112006 bankruptcy or insolvency if the franchisee becomes insolvent and in any event if the franchisee files a petition of voluntary or involuntary bankruptcy then this franchise shall terminate in no event later than the date of the filing of the bankruptcy petition  42406 default a the failure on the part of the franchisee to comply in any substantial respect with any of the provisions of this franchise shall be grounds for a forfeiture of this franchise but no such forfeiture shall take effect until the city has served upon the franchisee written notice of default which notice shall set forth the nature and extent thereof the franchisee shall have 30 days following the notice of default to correct the same if the franchisee protests the reasonableness or propriety of the citys declaration said protest shall be served upon the city in writing within ten days following receipt by the franchisee of the citys notice of default b if the city or the franchisee cannot agree as to the reasonableness or propriety of the citys declaration of default then the issue shall be promptly submitted to arbitration three arbitrators shall constitute a board of arbitration one arbitrator to be selected by the city one by the franchisee and one by the arbitrators so selected the board of arbitration shall notify the city and the franchisee of their determination of the reasonableness and propriety of the citys declaration of default not later than 30 days following submission of the issue to the board c the purpose of this to enable the city and the franchisee to resolve by arbitration such differences as they may be unable to resolve by mutual agreement nothing contained herein shall be construed to limit or restrict the legal rights and powers of the city and the franchisee  42406 right to require performance the failure of the city at any time to require performance by the franchisee of any provisions hereof shall in no way affect the right of the city thereafter to enforce same nor shall waiver by the city of any breach of any provisions hereof be taken or held to be a waiver of any succeeding breach of such provisions or as a waiver of any provision itself  42406 modification this franchise constitutes the entire agreement and understanding between the parties hereto and it shall not be considered modified altered changed or amended in any respect unless in writing and signed by the parties hereto and adopted as an amending franchise ordinance  42406 notice as required for any purpose in this franchise notice shall be addressed and sent by certified u s mail to the city and the franchisee as follows franchisee city city manager city of casselberry 95 triplet lake drive casselberry florida 32707  42406 remedies attorneys fees and costs all remedies provided in this franchise shall be deemed cumulative and additional and not in lieu of or exclusive of each other or of any other remedy available to the city at law or in equity in the event the city shall prevail in any action arising hereunder franchisee shall pay to the city all of its costs including attorneys fees  42406 law to govern this franchise is entered into and is to be performed in the state of florida city and franchisee agree that the laws of the state of florida shall govern the rights obligations duties and liabilities of the parties to this franchise and shall govern the interpretation of the franchise  42406 entirety this franchise and any exhibits attached hereto contain the entire agreement between the parties as to matters contained herein  42406 warranty of franchisee the franchisee represents and warrants unto the city that no officer employee or agent of the city has any interest either directly or indirectly in the business of franchisee to be conducted hereunder  42406 amendment the city reserves the right to amend this franchise in any manner necessary for the health safety or welfare of the public  42406 recycling all franchisees are required to offer a recycling program which shall be approved by the director of public works in accordance with city  42406 city not liable for delays it is expressly agreed that in no event shall the city be liable or responsible to the franchisee or to any other person on account of any stoppage or delay in the work provided for herein as a result of an injunction or any other legal or equitable proceeding brought against the franchisee or from or by or on account of any delay from any cause over which the city has no control  42406 title to waste title to all waste shall be vested in the franchisee upon placement in its vehicle  42406 permit fee a franchisee shall pay an annual sum of $25000 for a nonexclusive permit which fee shall be paid on or before october 1 for each year of renewal or fraction thereof  42406 headings the headings of the section of this franchise are for purposes and convenience only and shall not be deemed to expand or limit the provisions contained purchase of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured  water service  and all other legally taxable utility purchases within the city in the amount of ten percent of each payment received by the seller for the utility service or commodity b there shall be imposed and levied by the city a tax upon purchases within the municipality of local telephone service as defined in fs  9 at a rate not to exceed seven percent of the monthly recurring customer service charges excluding public telephone charges collected on site access charges and any customer access line charges paid to a local telephone company c there shall be imposed and levied by the city a tax upon purchase within the municipality of telecommunications service which originates and terminates in this state at a rate not to exceed seven percent of the total amount charged for any telecommunications service provided within the municipality or if the location of the telecommunications service cannot be determined the total amount billed for such telecommunications service to a telephone or telephone number a telecommunications number or device or a customers billing address located within a municipality excluding public telephone charges collected on site charges for any foreign exchange service or any private line service except when such services are used or sold as a substitute for any telephone company switched service or dedicated facility by which a telephone company provides a communication path access charges and any customer access lien charges paid to a local telephone company however telecommunications service as defined in fs  5b shall be taxed only on the monthly recurring customer service charges excluding variable usage charges d the tax shall be paid by the purchaser to the seller for the use of the city at the time of paying the charge for the service but not less often than monthly the seven percent or ten percent tax levied in this be computed on the aggregate amount of sales during the monthly period  however the amount of tax collection shall be calculated to the nearest whole cent 01  i 51898 exemptions the united states and the state and all political subdivisions agencies boards commissions and lawful authorities thereof and entities of the board of public instruction are hereby exempt from the payment of the tax levied under 02 collection by seller  remittance to city a it shall be the duty of every seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured water service telephone service and telegraph service within the city to collect from the purchaser for the use of the city the tax levied by this the time of collecting the selling price charged for each transaction and to report and pay over on or before the 15th day of each calendar month to the city all taxes levied and collected during the preceding month b it shall be unlawful for any seller to collect for any service without at the same time collecting the tax levied by this unless the seller elects to assume and pay the tax without collecting it from the purchaser any seller failing to collect the tax at the time of collecting for any service where the seller has not elected to assume and pay the tax shall be liable to the city for the amount of the tax  however the seller shall not be liable for the payment of the tax on uncollected bills if the purchaser shall fail neglect or refuse to pay for the service including the tax imposed the seller shall immediately discontinue further service to the purchaser until the service is paid for in full 03 records of sales each and every seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured water service telephone service and telegraph service shall keep complete records showing all sales in the city of these commodities or services these records shall show the price charged upon each sale the date of the sale and the date of payment and shall be kept open for inspection by the duly authorized agents of the city during business hours on all business days the duly authorized agents of the city shall have the right power and authority to make transcripts of these records during such times as they may desire 04 secs 78307850  reserved article iii  fuel oil tax applicability of term fuel oil as used in this shall include fuel oil grade numbers 1 2 3 4 5 and 6 and kerosene and coal oil the city commission has investigated all utility services and all utility commodities sold within the territorial limits of the city and concludes that fuel oil grade numbers 1 2 3 4 5 and 6 and kerosene and coal oil are furnished within the city as a competitive utility commodity and as a competitive utility service to all of the citizens of the city 10 levy  amount there is imposed and levied by the city a tax upon each and every purchase of fuel oil in the city in the amount of $004 per gallon 11a exemptions purchases of special fuels as defined in fs ch 206 and purchases by those entities described in are excluded from the tax levied and imposed under this 11b collection by seller  remittance to city a it shall be the duty of every seller of fuel oil in acting as a taxcollecting medium or agency for the city to collect from the purchaser for the use of the city the tax levied and imposed by this the time of collecting the purchase price charged for the sale and to report and pay over on or before the 15th day of each calendar month to the city clerk all the taxes imposed levied and collected during the preceding calendar month it shall be unlawful for any seller of fuel oil to collect the price of any sale of fuel oil without at the same time collecting the tax imposed and levied by this respect of each purchase thereof unless the seller elects to assume and pay the tax without collecting it from the purchaser 1 any seller of fuel oil failing to collect the tax at the time of collecting the price of the sale where the seller has not elected to assume and pay the tax shall be liable to the city for the amount of the tax in like manner as if it had been actually paid by the purchaser to the seller 2 the city manager shall cause to be brought all suits and actions and shall take any proceedings in the name of the city necessary for the collection or recovery of the tax  however the seller of the fuel oil shall not be liable for payment of the tax upon uncollected charges 3 if any purchaser shall fail neglect or refuse to pay to the seller the sellers charge for the sale and the tax imposed levied and required by this account of the purchase for which the charge is made or either the seller shall have the right power and authority to immediately discontinue further service to the purchaser until the tax and the sellers bill have been paid in full b in all cases where the seller of fuel oil collects the price thereof at monthly periods and intervals the tax imposed and levied by this be computed upon the aggregate amount of purchases during that monthly period  however the amount of tax to be collected shall be the nearest whole cent to the amount computed 12 records of sales each and every seller of fuel oil shall keep complete records showing all purchases within the city of fuel oil the price charged upon each purchase the period of time covered thereby the amount of tax levied and imposed under this the date of payment the records shall be kept open for inspection by the duly authorized officers or agents of the city during business hours on all business days and the duly authorized officers or agents of the city shall have the right power and authority to make transcripts or photocopies during such times as they may desire 13 exclusion of fuel adjustment charge a for purposes of this the term fuel adjustment charge means all increases in the cost of utility services to the ultimate consumer resulting from an increase in the cost of fuel to the utility subsequent to  b the tax imposed by this not be applied against any fuel adjustment charge and such charge shall be separately stated on each bill 14 secs 78577875  reserved article iv  parimutuel track facility tax footnotes  2  state law reference tax imposed on dog and horse racing facilities by cities fs  55011 levy  amount a tax levied by this it becomes due shall give rise to a lien in favor of the city on all property real or personal owned by the delinquent dog or horse track facility in the amount of the taxes due as well have priority over all other liens claims or encumbrances on the property of the delinquent dog or horse track facility 03 secs 78797881  reserved article v  additional homestead exemption for senior i 112999 definitions the following words terms and phrases as used in this shall have the meanings unless clearly indicated otherwise city means the city of casselberry florida department of revenue means the same as department of revenue for the state of florida household means a person or group of persons living together in a room or group of rooms as a housing unit but the term does not include persons boarding in or renting a portion of the dwelling house income means the adjusted gross income as defined in of the united states internal revenue of all members of a household may is permissive when used herein property appraiser means the seminole county property appraiser shall is mandatory when used herein sixtyfive 65 years of age means a person who has attained the age of 65 prior to january 1st of the tax year for which the additional homestead exemption is sought i 112999 entitlement to additional homestead exemption a any person 65 years of age or older and who has legal or equitable title to real estate located within the city and who maintains thereon his or her permanent residence which residence qualifies for and receives homestead exemption pursuant to a of the florida constitution and whose household income does not exceed $20000 shall be entitled to an additional homestead exemption of $5000 as provided in this additional homestead exemption provided herein applies only to ad valorem levied by the city not more than one additional homestead exemption shall be allowed on individual or family unit or with respect to any residential unit b the additional homestead exemption provided herein shall be applicable to all tax levies of the city  and if applicable shall be subject to the provisions of fs   and   if title to the property is held jointly with right of survivorship the person residing on the property and otherwise qualifying for the additional homestead exemption may receive the entire amount of the additional homestead exemption provided herein c the additional homestead exemption provided herein shall be available to qualified persons beginning with the year 2000 tax roll i 112999 annual adjustment of income beginning  and continuing every january 1st thereafter the $2000000 income limitation shall be automatically adjusted by the percentage of change in the average costofliving index in the period of january 1st st of the prior year as compared to the same period for the year prior to that year as used herein the term index shall be the average of the monthly consumer price index figures for the stated 12month period for the united states as a whole issued by the united states department of labor i 112999 requirements for claiming additional homestead exemptions a every person claiming the additional homestead exemption pursuant to this article shall file an application with the seminole county property appraiser no later than march 1st of each year for which such exemption is claimed the application shall be on a form prescribed by the department of revenue and shall include a sworn statement of household income for all members of the household on or before june 1st of each year each applicant shall file supporting documentation with the property appraiser including copies of all federal income tax returns wage and earning statements w2 forms and such other documentation the department of revenues requires for each member of the household the applicants statement shall attest to the accuracy of all documentation provided and the property appraiser shall not grant the additional homestead exemption without the required documentation b failure to file the application and sworn statement by march 1st or failure to file the required supporting documentation by june 1st of any given year shall constitute a waiver of the additional homestead exemption for that tax year i 112999 notice requirements a the city clerk shall prior to  provide a copy of the ordinance approving this the property appraiser and in the event this subsequently repealed or modified notification of such repeal or modification shall be provided to the property appraiser not later than december 1st of the year prior to the year in which the homestead exemption provided herein expires or is modified b the city manager shall annually report to the city commission the economic impact associated with this i 112999 secs 7888 7889  reserved article vi  tax abatement program authority and purpose this article is adopted pursuant to the specific authority of florida statutes and referendum approved by the citizens of casselberry on   61013 legislative findings of the constitution of the state of florida and florida statutes enables municipalities to grant economic development ad valorem tax exemptions to certain new businesses and expansions of existing businesses expected to create new jobs after the electors of the municipality voting on the question in a referendum authorize such exemptions in a referendum held on  the electors of the city of casselberry authorized the city commission to grant economic development ad valorem tax exemptions  61013 definitions the following words phrases and terms shall have the meanings set forth below except where indicated otherwise such words phrases and terms shall have the same meanings attributed to them in the florida
