seminole county property appraiser from time to time as may be reasonably necessary or useful for the determinations contemplated by this  average wage in the city the city of casselberry average annual wage which may be adjusted from time to time brownfield area an area designated as a brownfield area pursuant to florida statutes business any activity engaged in by any person firm partnership corporation or other business organization or entity with the object of private or public gain benefit or advantage either direct or in direct city the city of casselberry florida city commission the elected commissioners for the city of casselberry florida community redevelopment area the agency with jurisdiction over an area designated as a community redevelopment area pursuant to florida statutes county seminole county florida enterprise zone an area designated as an enterprise zone pursuant to florida statutes exemption or economic development ad valorem tax exemption an ad valorem tax exemption granted by the city commission in its sole and absolute discretion to a qualified business pursuant to this article as authorized by of the constitution of the state of florida and florida statutes exemption criteria the criteria to be applied by the city commission in making its determination as to whether to grant an exemption expansion of an existing business as defined in 16 florida statutes specifically a a business or organization establishing ten or more new jobs to employ ten or more fulltime employees in the city paying an average wage for such new jobs that is above the average wage in the city which 1 principally manufactures processes compounds fabricates or produces for sale items of tangible personal property at a fixed location and which comprises an industrial or manufacturing plant or 2 is a target industry business b a business or organization establishing 25 or more jobs to employ 25 or more fulltime employees in the city the sales factor of which for the facility with respect to which it requests an exemption is less than 050 for each year the exemption is claimed  provided that such business increases operations on a site collocated with a commercial or industrial operation owned by the same business or organization under common control with the same business or organization resulting in a net increase in employment of not less than ten percent or an increase in productive output of not less than ten percent c any business or organization located in an enterprise zone or brownfield area that increases operations on a site located within the same zone or area collocated with a commercial or industrial operation owned by the same business or organization implementing ordinance enacted pursuant to hereof for the purpose of granting an exemption improvements physical changes made to raw land and structures placed on or under the land surface including all tangible personal property acquired to facilitate an expansion of an existing business provided that the tangible personal property is added or increased on or after the day an ordinance specifically granting a business an exemption is adopted tangible personal property acquired to replace existing property shall not be considered to facilitate a business expansion new business a new business as defined in 15 florida statutes specifically a a business or organization establishing ten or more new jobs to employ ten or more fulltime employees in the city paying an average wage for such new jobs that is above the average wage in the city which principally engages in any one or more of the following operations 1 manufactures processes compounds fabricates or produces for sale items of tangible personal property at a fixed location and which comprises an industrial or manufacturing plant  or 2 is a target industry business b a business or organization establishing 25 or more new jobs to employ 25 or more fulltime employees in the city the sales factor of which for the facility with respect to which it requests an exemption is less than 050 for each year the exemption is claimed or c an office space in the city owned and used by a business or organization newly domiciled in the city  provided that such office space houses 50 or more fulltime employees of such business or corporation  provided that such business or organization office first begins operation on a site clearly separate from any other commercial or industrial operation owned by the same business or organization d any business located in an enterprise zone or brownfield area that first begins operation on a site clearly separate from any other commercial or industrial operation owned by the same business or organization e a business that is situated on property that is annexed into the city and that at the time of annexation is receiving an exemption from the county qualified business either a new business or an expansion of an existing business as defined herein that meets the criteria to be considered for an exemption sales factor as defined in florida statutes 5 a fraction the numerator of which is the total sales of the taxpayer in this state during the taxable year or period and the denominator of which is the total sales of the taxpayer everywhere during the taxable year or period tangible personal property the meaning set forth in 11d florida statutes target industry business an expansion of an existing business or a new business that is engaged in a business designated at the time of consideration of an application for exemption as a target industry business pursuant to florida statutes  61013 establishment of economic development ad valorem tax exemption a the improvements to the expansion of real or tangible personal property may be granted or refused at the sole discretion of the city commission b the exemption shall not accrue to improvements to real property made on or after the effective date of this code as provided in hereof c any exemption granted may apply up to 100 percent of the assessed value of all improvements to real and tangible personal property made by or for the use of a new business or up to 100 percent of the assessed value of all added improvements to real and tangible personal property made to facilitate the expansion of an existing business provided that the improvements to real property are made or the tangible personal property is added or increased on or after the effective date of an implementing a specific business as provided in hereof property acquired to replace existing property shall not be considered to facilitate the expansion of an existing business d each exemption may be for a period up to ten years from the date the city commission grants the exemption to a specific business e no exemption shall be granted for the land upon which a new business or the expansion of an existing business is to be located f the exemption applies only to taxes levied by the city the exemption does not apply to taxes levied by a county school district or water management district or to taxes levied for the payment of bonds or taxes authorized by a vote of the electors pursuant to of the state constitution g each exemption shall be subject to each of the following conditions 1 each business granted an exemption shall maintain the new business or the expansion of an existing business throughout the entire period of the exemption  2 each business granted an exemption shall be required to submit an annual report and employee roster to the city manager or their designee evidencing satisfaction of the foregoing condition the report and employee roster shall be submitted on or before january 1 of each year the exemption is in effect 3 each business granted an exemption shall furnish to the city commission or its designee such informationreport as the city manager or community development director may reasonably deem necessary for the purpose of determining continued performance by the business of the conditions stated and the representations made in the application process the city manager or community development director shall provide a copy of each annual report to the property appraiser by april 1 4 failure to adhere to these conditions may result in forfeiture of an exemption  61013 application a any eligible person firm partnership or corporation which desires an exemption shall file with the city manager or community development director a written application in the form prescribed by the city commission the application must be filed with the city manager or community development director no later than january 1 of the year the exemption is desired to take effect b the application shall request the city commission to adopt an implementing the applicant the exemption and shall include at a minimum each of the following components 1 the name and location of the new business or the expansion of an existing business  2 the name of the owner or owners of the new business or the expansion of an existing business  3 a description of the improvement to the real property for which an exemption is requested and the date of commencement of construction of such improvement  4 a description of the tangible personal property for which an exemption is requested and the dates when such property was or is to be purchased  5 proof to the satisfaction of the city commission that the applicant meets the criteria for a new business or for an expansion of an existing business as defined in hereof  6 the following information a the current number of fulltimeequivalent fte and seasonal employees of the expanding business  the total number of fte and seasonal jobs to be created and maintained by the new or expanding business and the period total number of years needed to fill all of the new jobs  b the expected number of employees who will reside in the city of casselberry and seminole county  c the number and average annual wage of the new jobs identifying the average annual salary  d the expected time schedule for job creation  e the type of industry or business  f the environmental impact of the business  g the current and anticipated volume in dollars of business or production and the percentage of total product sales outside the city of casselberry  h whether relocation or expansion would occur without the exemption  i the source of supplies local or otherwise  j whether the business will beis located in a brownfield  k the total length number of years of the exemption period being requested  and 7 such other information as may be deemed necessary by the city commission c a business shall be required to enter into an agreement with the city commission to ensure that the business will satisfy its job creation and maintenance obligations d a business will be required to commence the creation of fulltime jobs within the period of the exemption and to maintain any newly filled jobs for its facility in the city at a minimum the expiration of the exemption granted by the city commission if a business requires additional time beyond the date of the expiration of the exemption to satisfy all new job creation maintenance and salary commitments identified in the application it will be necessary for the business and the city to enter into a separate agreement which will obligate the business to comply fully with those commitments e if a new business is locating to or an expansion of an existing business is occurring in a community redevelopment area the city manager or community development director shall promptly so notify the community redevelopment agency board overseeing such area and the board shall be provided a copy of the application for review and comment input from the community redevelopment agency will be considered by the city commission in deciding whether an exemption is to be granted f an application for an exemption shall be submitted in advance of any necessary permit application changing the future land use or changing zoning for proposed sites in the case of existing sites or facilities where adequate zoning and future land use is in place an application shall be submitted prior to application for building permits g upon submittal of the application the city manager or their designee shall review same and within a reasonable time of submission notify the applicant of any deficiencies h the application shall be filed on or before january 1 for the year in which an exemption is requested  61013 consideration of applications a the city commission shall take action on each application including the enactment of the implementing should the city commission decide to grant the application b the threshold for eligibility is whether the business meets the definition of a new business or of an expansion of an existing business as set forth in of this authorizing one which is not an ineligible business or industry as set forth in d of this the next level to determine eligibility is the city commissions consideration of the information in the application to determine whether the exemption if granted would result in an economic benefit to the city d any existing business in violation of any federal state or local law or regulation governing environmental matters is not eligible for an exemption e before the city commission takes action on an application the city manager or community development director shall deliver a copy of the same to the property appraiser for review after careful consideration the property appraiser shall report to the city manager or community development director the fiscal impact of granting the exemption f the property appraisers report shall include the following 1 the total revenue available to the city for the current fiscal year from ad valorem tax sources or an estimate of such revenue if the actual total available revenue cannot be determined  2 the amount of revenue lost to the city for the current fiscal year by virtue of exemptions previously granted or an estimate of such revenue if the actual revenue lost cannot be determined  3 an estimate of the amount of revenue which would be lost to the city for the current fiscal year if the exemption applied for was granted had the property for which the exemption is requested otherwise been subject to taxation  and 4 a determination as to whether the property for which an exemption is requested is to be incorporated into a new business or the expansion of an existing business or into neither which determination the property appraiser shall also affix to the face of the application upon request the department of revenue will provide appraiser such information as it may have available to assist in making this determination g after consideration of the application and the report of the property appraiser on the application the city commission may choose to adopt an implementing the exemption to a new business or the expansion of an existing business if an exemption is granted the implementing include the following information 1 the names and address of the new business or the expansion of an existing business  2 the names of the owner or owners of the new business or the expansion of an existing business  3 the total amount of revenue available to the city from ad valorem tax sources for the current fiscal year the total amount of the revenue lost to the city for the current fiscal year by virtue of exemption currently in effect and the estimated revenue loss attributable to the exemption granted to the new business or the expansion of an existing business  4 the period of time for which the exemption will remain in effect and the expiration date of the exemption  and 5 a finding that the business meets the definition of a new business or an expansion of an existing business as set forth in hereof h the business granted an exemption shall be required to inform the city manager or community development director in writing within ten days as to any changes in ownership of the business granted an exemption failure of the business granted an exemption to notify the city manager or community development director in writing of any such changes in ownership is cause for revocation of the exemption i no precedent shall be implied or inferred by the granting of an exemption to any new business or expansion of an existing business application for exemptions shall be considered by the city commission on a casebycase basis for each application after consideration of the application and the property appraisers report on the application  61013 revocation a should any new business or expansion of an existing business 1 fail to file the annual report and employee roster with the city manager or community development director on or before january 1 of each year the exemption has been granted as required in hereof 2 fail to continue to meet the definition of a new business or an expansion of an existing business 3 fail to fulfill any other representation made to the city commission during the application process including but not limited to the creation and maintenance of the total number of new jobs identified in the application or 4 fail to comply with any other statutory requirement for continuation or renewal of the exemption the city manager or the community development director shall advise the city manager who will then in turn advise the city commission who may enact an ordinance revoking the exemption b the exemption may be revoked after expiration of this authorizing  for a business that fails to fulfill its obligations as provided for under the implementing effective date for revocation of the exemption will be identified in the implementing upon revocation of an exemption the city manager or community development director shall immediately notify the property appraiser d for any year that taxes may have been exempted and the city commission finds that the business was not entitled to the exemption such taxes may be recovered the property appraiser will assist the city commission to recover any taxes exempted e nothing herein shall prohibit a business from reapplying for an exemption  61013 sunset date pursuant to florida statutes and the referendum approved by the citizens on  the city commissions authority to grant exemptions shall expire on   61013 traffic and vehicles footnotes  1  cross reference fire lanes and fire zones  426  excessive emissions  501 them in fs ch 316 as it may be from time to time amended except where the context otherwise requires  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 penalty for violation of a generally 1 except as otherwise provided whenever in this in any other traffic ordinance or resolution of the city or in any rule regulation or order promulgated by any officer or agency of the city under authority duly vested in him or it any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or a misdemeanor or the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or an offense or misdemeanor where no specific penalty is provided therefor the violation of such a provision of this other ordinance or resolution of the city or rule regulation or order shall be punished by a fine not exceeding $30000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 90 days or both such fine and imprisonment 2 except where otherwise provided every day any violation of this other ordinance or resolution of the city or rule regulation or order shall continue shall constitute a separate offense 3 in addition to the penalties provided in this any condition caused or permitted to exist in violation of any of the provisions of this any other ordinance resolution rule regulation or order shall be deemed a public nuisance and may be abated by the city as provided by law and each day that the condition continues shall be regarded as a new and separate offense b parking fines where no other penalty is provided any person violating of this fs chs 316 and 318 by unlawfully parking a motor vehicle or vehicle as those terms are defined in this fs ch 316 shall be fined as follows 1 for the following violations the fine shall be $3000 a obstructing traffic  b blocking a driveway  c parking within 30 feet of a traffic control device  d parking on a crosswalk  e parking on the sidewalk  f parking where prohibited by official marking or sign  g parking where prohibited in residential districts  h parking large vehicles where prohibited in nonresidential districts  i any other parking violation of this chapter  or j parking which otherwise violates fs ch 316 2 for the following violations the fine shall be $3000 a parking within 15 feet of a fire hydrant  or b parking in a designated fire lane 3 for unauthorized parking in a designated handicapped parking zone the fine shall be $25000 for purposes of this unauthorized parking in a designated handicapped parking zone shall mean any vehicle so parked which does not bear a license plate or taglet as provided in fs    or  c violation of truck route regulations a violation of any of the provisions of of this be deemed an infraction as defined in fs  318133 and shall be punished accordance with the requirements of laws of fla ch 71135  6 the matters and contents in these chapters are made a part of this reference as fully and completely as if set forth in this of the law shall remain on file in the office of the city clerk and shall be available for public inspection and use 01 applicability of state uniform traffic control law fs ch 316 known as the florida uniform traffic control law is applicable in the city and supersedes this the event of any irreconcilable conflict  powers of local authorities a except as otherwise provided by the provisions of this other ordinances of the city the city engineer the police chief and the city manager shall have the power to designate install and regulate and enforce the operation and parking of vehicles within the corporate limits of the city by the erection or placing of proper signs or markers as follows 1 prohibit or limit parking 2 restrict speed 3 establish oneway streets arterial streets stop streets uturns play streets school zones hospital zones loading and unloading zones and quiet zones subject to city commission approval 4 designate bus stops and taxicab stands and erect signs to prohibit the parking of vehicles other than buses and taxicabs in such stands 5 designate truck routes subject to city commission approval 6 regulate parking of vehicles of various sizes and weights 7 mark traffic lanes on streets indicating and directing the flow of traffic 8 establish parking meter zones including the size and number of spaces therein the erection of parking meters and the parking time allowed after public hearing and subject to city commission approval b the existence of these signs or markers at any place within the corporate limits of the city shall be prima facie evidence that the signs or markers were erected or placed by and at the direction of the police chief the city engineer or the city manager in accordance with the provisions of this 02 state law reference powers of local authorities fs   speed limits the state traffic laws fs ch 316 shall regulate the speed of vehicles and shall be applicable upon all streets within the city  operation of golf carts on road way the city  operation of pushcarts on road way every person propelling any pushcart upon a roadway shall be granted all of the rights and shall be subject to all of the responsibilities applicable to the driver of a vehicle by this by the rules of the road portion of the state uniform traffic control law except those provisions which by their very nature can have no application a use of skateboards roller skates and similar devices on roadway a no person upon roller skates or roller blades or riding in or by means of any coaster skateboard scooter toy vehicle or similar device shall go upon any roadway except while crossing a street on a crosswalk when so crossing that person shall be granted all of the rights and shall be subject to all of the responsibilities applicable to pedestrians b this not apply upon any street while set aside as a play street as authorized in this  driving on bicycle trails and footpaths no person shall operate any motor vehicle atv allterrain vehicle or moped within the city except in conformity with state traffic laws regulating the operation of such vehicles upon any private or public bicycle trail or footpath except upon a permanent or dulyauthorized temporary driveway  parades processions and special events a permit required  conduct generally it shall be unlawful for any procession except funerals or special event such as a block party road or foot race or the like or parade to occupy march or proceed along any street except in accordance with a permit issued by the city commission and such other regulations as are set forth in this may apply applications shall be made to the office of the city engineer b permit fee the city commission may from time to time establish by resolution such permit fees as the commission shall deem equitable and necessary applications for a permit shall be accompanied by any fee established under this c revocation of permit the city engineer may revoke a permit or approval issued under the provisions of this there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to a material fact in the application or plans on which the permit or approval was based    oversize or overweight vehicle or load a permit required  removal of traffic control devices pursuant to fs   any person wishing to move any overheight overweight or overwidth vehicle or load upon a road shall obtain a permit from the office of the city engineer if the vehicle shall require the removal of any official traffic control devices that removal and reinstallation shall be accomplished by the public works department the cost of labor and equipment will be billed to the applicant for the permit if the move necessitates the removal of traffic signals such as for moving a house a bond may be required b permit fee the city commission may from time to time establish by resolution such permit fees as the commission shall deem equitable and necessary applications for a permit shall be accompanied by any fee established under this c revocation of permit the city engineer may revoke a permit or approval issued under the provisions of this there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to a material fact in the application or plans on which the permit or approval was based  abandoned or derelict vehicles a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 property means any real property in the city other than a road street alley highway or other public easement 2 road street alley highway and other public easement mean the entire width between the boundary lines of every public rightofway 3 vehicle means a machine propelled by power other than human power designed to travel along the ground by the use of wheels treads runners or slides and to transport persons or property or pull machinery and shall include without limitation automobiles trucks trailers motorcycles and tractors b abandonment prohibited no person who is the owner or in control of the vehicle shall abandon any dismantled partially dismantled wrecked junked or nonoperating vehicle on any road street alley highway or other public easement or on private property except on private property as provided for in this a vehicle shall be deemed to have been abandoned if it remains parked on a city rightofway for more than 48 consecutive hours c storage of unlicensed andor inoperable vehicles on private property no person in charge or in control of any property within the city whether an owner tenant occupant lessee or otherwise shall allow any unlicensed andor inoperable vehicle to be placed or remain on such property unless such vehicle is within a completely enclosed building or is on the premises of an automotive repair or storage business for which the owner of the business has a current city occupational business tax receipt and zoning approval however an inoperable vehicle may not remain on the premises of an auto repair business or storage business in excess of 60 days d evidence a vehicle will be in violation of this it is in a state of evident disuse neglect or abandonment evidence may include but is not limited to factors such as vehicle being wrecked inoperative as evidenced by vegetation underneath as high as the vehicle body or frame refuse or debris collected underneath or the vehicle being used solely for storage purposes if it is partially dismantled having no engine transmission or other major and visible sections having major and visible parts which are dismantled having no valid license tag or being in any physical state rendering it inoperable or unsightly to the neighborhood if the primary apparent evidence of neglect or abandonment is the lack of a valid tag or vegetation growing under vehicle then the inspector shall use his training and experience to determine whether under the totality of the circumstances the vehicle is in a state of evident disuse neglect or abandonment a vehicle will be considered abandoned or derelict if it is an evident state of extended disuse or neglect e interpretation of this requirement nothing in this be construed as permitting the disassembling tearing down or scrapping of a vehicle or to permit one vehicle to be scavenged or stripped for sections for use on another vehicle additionally nothing in this be construed as permitting the violation of other including but not limited to outside storage requirements junkyard provisions and lot cleaning standards f responsibility for compliance the owner agent andor tenant of the property on which the violation occurs and the owner of the disabled vehicle shall be jointly and individually responsible for compliance with the requirements of this g enforcement when a disabled or abandoned vehicle is found to be in violation of this 1 the officer shall place a written notice on the vehicle indicating that it is in violation of this that it must be removed within ten calendar days or it will be subject to removal by the city the shall make every reasonable attempt to ascertain the owner of the vehicle and the owner of the property and shall notify such owners with a written notice delivered by mail or personal service at their current address last known address or the address appearing on the certificate of title for the vehicle 2 within the ten calendarday period specified in the notice the owner of the vehicle or the owner of the property or an authorized agent may appeal in writing to the administrative official selected or appointed by the city manager to administer code enforcement in the city 3 the property or vehicle owners may appeal in writing the administrative officials final decision to the board for determination as to whether the abandoned or derelict vehicle is subject to removal 4 if no written appeal is made and the disabled vehicle remains in violation after the ten calendarday period the administrative official shall call such vehicle to be removed immediately to a storage facility approved by the city and thereafter disposed of in compliance with applicable state law or city ordinance 5 the authorization in this the towing of abandoned and disabled vehicles shall not be construed so as to negate the authority of the board to hear and adjudicate appropriate cases h vehicles on public property notwithstanding any of the foregoing all vehicles which are located on public property shall be towed and disposed of in accordance with the notice and sale requirements of fs ch 705 as revised in the 1987 legislative session to the extent that this with any portion of fs ch 705 the latter shall control as to any vehicles located on public property   iii 11193   92412 cross reference unclaimed property  5426 et seq  solid waste ch 70 secs 82148235  reserved article ii  administration and enforcement division 1  generally duties of police department it shall be the duty of the police chief with such aid as may be rendered by other members of the police department to enforce the provisions of this the state vehicle laws applicable to parking in the city to make arrests for parking violations to assist in the prosecution of persons charged with such violations to investigate accidents to cooperate with other officials of the city in the administration of this to develop ways and means to improve parking conditions and to carry out those duties specially imposed by this 03 cross reference law enforcement ch 54 liability of city officers and employees any officer or employee charged with the enforcement of this acting for the city commission in the discharge of his duties shall not thereby render himself liable personally and he is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his duties any suit brought against any officer or employee because of an act performed by him or her in the enforcement of any provision of this be defended by the city or its representatives until the final termination of the proceedings  funding the city commission is authorized to appropriate and expend such funds as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this contained in this require the city commission to appropriate or expend any funds to carry out the purpose of this authority granted in this permissive and shall not be construed to impose an obligation on the city engineer or the city to take any specific action relative to traffic control or to remove any hazards or obstructions under of this  powers of city engineer and police chief regarding traffic control and engineering a the city engineer shall be in charge of traffic engineering and shall exercise specific powers and duties delegated to him with respect to traffic engineering as provided in this b it shall be the general function of the city engineer to determine the installation and proper timing and maintenance of traffic control devices and to devise remedial measures to conduct engineering investigations of traffic conditions to plan the most efficient operation of traffic on the streets and highways of the city to cooperate with state county and municipal officials in the development of ways and means to improve traffic conditions and to carry out the additional powers and functions imposed by ordinances of the city c the city engineer and police chief are hereby empowered to make regulations necessary to make effective the provisions of the traffic ordinances of the city subject to the approval of the city manager and city commission and to make temporary or experimental regulations to cover emergencies or special conditions no such temporary or experimental regulations shall remain in effect for more than 90 days repeat temporary or experimental regulation projects shall not be implemented within 90 days of initial temporary or experimental use except following a public hearing before the city commission d the city engineer and police chief may test traffic control devices under actual conditions of traffic e the city engineer and police chief subject to the approval of the city manager and city commission are hereby authorized on the basis of an engineering and traffic investigation to prohibit regulate or limit stopping standing or parking of vehicles at all times or during specified hours   i 71690 cross reference officers and employees  281 et seq  law enforcement ch 54 appeal of decisions of city engineer a appeals to the city commission may be taken by any person aggrieved or by any officer board or department of the city affected by any decision of the city engineer under this b all appeals except those taken under of this shall be taken within 30 days after the decision is made by filing a notice of appeal in the office of the city engineer specifying the grounds thereof c appeals filed from decisions made by the city engineer under of this be taken within ten days of receipt of the notice required thereunder by filing a notice of appeal in the office of the city engineer d it is the intent of this questions of interpretation and enforcement shall first be presented to the city engineer and that questions shall be presented to the city commission only on appeal from the decision of the city engineer  official forms the city commission shall adopt by resolution such forms as may be necessary for administration of this  secs 82428250  reserved division 2  citations and other notices  payment of fines traffic citations generally citations for violations of this with the exception of parking citations shall be issued in accordance with the requirements of fs ch 316 or its successor  state law reference traffic citations fs   purpose of division the purpose of this division is to assist the county court and the county traffic and ordinance violations bureau and to empower authorized city employees to issue summons for violations of this to parking  citation forms serially numbered forms as provided by the police chief shall be used for notifying violators to appear in answer to charges of violating any ordinance of the city all forms shall be receipted and accounted for by the police chief or other person acting for him or her the police chief or other person acting for him or her shall each month report to the city manager the number of arrests made and the number of citations issued by the police department and its inspecting officers during that month  use of sworn complaints as evidence whenever any complaint charging a violation of any city law is sworn to by a police officer or other competent person the complaint shall be accepted as conclusive evidence of the facts alleged therein in the absence of evidence to the contrary in all cases where the defendant fails to appear at the time and place required by the warrant issued thereunder or as may be ordered by the county court  citation procedure except when authorized or required to immediately take a person arrested for a violation of a city law or city traffic ordinance or the traffic offense exempted in fs  31817 into custody a police officer upon charging a person for violation of the state traffic law or of a city law or city traffic ordinance shall take the violators name address and license number and issue to him in writing a citation provided by the police chief requiring him to answer the charge at a time and place fixed in cases of traffic infractions the violator shall be required to respond as required by fs ch 318 the officer shall issue a copy of the citation to the person charged and shall submit the original and all copies of the citation to the records unit of the police department   iii 21317 payment of fine a any person charged with a traffic offense or infraction for which payment of a fine and civil penalty may be made to the county traffic and ordinance violations bureau shall have the option of paying the fine and civil penalty within the time specified in the citation or notice of arrest at the bureau upon entering a plea of guilty or nolo contendere and upon waiving appearance in court b the payment of a fine and civil penalty to the bureau shall be deemed an acknowledgement of violation of the designated ordinance and the bureau upon accepting the prescribed fine shall issue a receipt to the violator acknowledging payment should payment of the fine be made by mail and by check the canceled check may serve as a receipt provided a receipt is not specifically requested by the payee  issuance of summons inspecting officers specifically empowered by the city manager shall have the power to serve a summons upon the person charged with an alleged violation under this or to post the notice at a place of violation this power shall be confined to the violations designated by the county judge and the laws of the state the inspecting officers shall not be authorized to arrest or otherwise take a violator into custody except when done by a police officer with a warrant of arrest duly executed  failure to obey notice or summons it is a violation of this division for any person to violate his written promise to appear given to an officer upon an arrest for any traffic violation regardless of the disposition of the charge on which he was originally arrested a driver of a motor vehicle who wilfully neglects to answer to the charges set forth in a written notice affixed to the motor vehicle by a police officer shall be held to have violated this division  alteration or destruction of notices a the notices referred to in this division shall remain the property of the city before and after the serving delivery or affixing thereof and shall be considered an integral part of the police department and of the county court all persons receiving any notice in writing whether by personal service or by affixing it to a motor vehicle are required to preserve the notice and to bring and present it to the county traffic and ordinance violations bureau when answering the charge set forth in the notice b no recipient of a notice or other person shall wilfully throw away alter mar mutilate destroy or discard the written notice of the city described in c no person finding affixed to any vehicle the written notice of the city described in whether he be the owner operator driver or passenger of the vehicle to which the notice is affixed shall wilfully throw away alter mar mutilate destroy or discard such notice d no person not being the owner having charge of operating or driving a vehicle to which may be found affixed the written notice described in shall wilfully remove take away throw away mar alter mutilate destroy or discard the written notice so affixed nor shall any person receive any notice from another for the purpose of so mutilating or destroying it or for the purpose of constituting himself the agent of the recipient for any purpose other than the proper and lawful adjustment at the traffic and ordinance violations bureau of the charge contained in the notice  issuance of arrest warrant a if any person summoned by a notice of arrest affixed on a motor vehicle does not respond within the period specified in the notice the county traffic and ordinance violations bureau shall send to the owner of the motor vehicle to which the notice was affixed a letter informing him of the violation and warning him that he will be held responsible for the appearance of the offender if the letter is disregarded within the period specified in the letter a complaint will be filed and a warrant of arrest issued b if any person fails to comply with a notice as provided in a of this or fails to make an appearance pursuant to a summons directing an appearance in the traffic and ordinance violations bureau the bureau shall forthwith file a complaint against that person and secure a warrant for his arrest the provisions of fs  31815 shall be followed where appropriate  secs 82618270  reserved division 3  enforcement of parking regulations issuance of citations a whenever any motor vehicle without a driver is found parked stopped or standing in violation of any of the restrictions imposed by state law or regulation of the city in the incorporated areas of the city the police department finding the vehicle shall take its registration number and may take any other information displayed on the vehicle which may identify its user and shall conspicuously affix to the vehicle a parking citation or summons in writing for the driver to answer the charge against him within 14 business days during the hours and at a place specified in the citation or summons b each day that a parking violation occurs or continues will constitute a separate offense for which a parking citation may be issued c citations issued in a form approved by the chief of police pursuant to for parking violations may be issued by police officers or any other person successfully completing the applicable state requirements as designated by the city manager and approved by the chief of police   iv 21317 payment of fines  failure to respond to citation a the operator or registered owner of a vehicle receiving a parking citation for a parking violation shall within 14 business days pay the fines as prescribed in this chapter or request a hearing before a judge of the county court any person electing to appear before the designated judge shall be deemed to have waived his right to pay the civil penalty the judge after a hearing shall make a determination as to whether a violation has been committed if the commission of violation has been proven the judge may impose a fine not to exceed $10000 plus court costs b failure of the owner or operator of the vehicle to make payment of the fine within 14 business days from the date the parking citation was issued shall render such owner or operator subject to maximum prosecution under state law at the discretion of the court and a late charge of $1000 initial late charge unless such person timely requests a hearing failure to make payment of the fine within 30 days shall subject such owner or operator to an additional late charge of $1000 additional late charge in addition a notice of summons may be sent by certified mail to the owner or operator of the vehicle which was cited informing such owner of the parking citation the failure to comply therewith the applicable late charges or require a mandatory court appearance c any person who fails to respond to the original parking citation within the time specified on such notice shall be deemed to have waived the right to contest the merits of such parking violation d the city is hereby authorized in its discretion to provide the department of highway safety and motor vehicles with a listing of persons who have three or more outstanding parking citations such provision may be made in accordance with the provisions of fs  6 if a persons name appears on the list described herein a license plate or revalidation sticker may not be issued until that persons name no longer appears on the list or until the person presents a receipt from the city or the clerk of court showing that the outstanding fines have been paid   v 21317 presumptions regarding violations a in any prosecution charging a violation of any statute or ordinance governing the parking stopping or standing of a vehicle proof that the particular vehicle described in the complaint was parked stopped or standing in violation of the statute or ordinance together with proof that the defendant named in the complaint was at the time of that parking stopping or standing the registered owner of the vehicle shall constitute in evidence a prima facie presumption that the registered owner of the vehicle was the person who parked stopped or stood the vehicle at the point where and for the time during which the violation occurred and shall be sufficient to invoke the penalties set out in this b at the trial of any case involving an alleged violation of any statute or ordinance governing the parking stopping or standing of a vehicle in which the owner of the vehicle is being tried under this it shall be sufficient evidence to establish the name of the registered owner of the vehicle if a police officer shall state on oath that he has made inquiry of the state department of highway safety and motor vehicles law enforcement channels and has been advised by it of the identity of the registered owner at the time of the alleged offense c notwithstanding the rebuttability of the presumption provided for in subsections a and b of this the registered owner of a vehicle when the vehicle is parked stopped or standing in violation of any state statute or city ordinance is hereby declared to be directly responsible to the city for payment of the fine for the vehicle being so parked or left stopped or standing for purposes of this the term registered owner means the person who is lawfully registered with the state department of highway safety and motor vehicles as provided by state law on the day the violation occurs d the presumption stated in c of this apply only when the procedures prescribed in have been followed  issuance of arrest warrant if any person fails to comply with a summons given to the person or attached to a vehicle pursuant to this division or fails to make appearance pursuant to the summons from the county court directing an appearance as the court determines or if any person fails or refuses to deposit bail that is required within the time permitted by statute or ordinance the police department of the city shall forthwith apply for a warrant for his arrest  impoundment a when any vehicle is left parked stopped or standing in violation of any statute of the state or ordinance of the city on any publicly owned property including streets highways roads alleys parking lots or any other premises of the city county or state the police department or any police officer is authorized to have the vehicle impounded in accordance with the tow car franchise agreement b removal of vehicles parked on private property will be the responsibility of the property owner the city police department will assist in determining whether the vehicle has been reported stolen c members of the police department shall be vested with the authority and it shall be their duty to impound any unoccupied vehicle parked in violation of any of the parking regulations of the city where the vehicle impedes traffic creates a traffic hazard or appears to be abandoned and to release the vehicle to the duly identified owner thereof subject to the payment of a fine if any and the storage towing and other impounding charges the police department shall exercise due diligence to identify and notify the owner  violations presided over by a hearing officer a all violations of this be referred to a hearing officer designated to preside over civil traffic infractions in the county b each violation will be adjudicated in accordance with the provisions of the charter or the city of casselberry florida c upon a written request of defendant filed prior to the scheduled hearing on the civil traffic infraction the parking infraction case shall be assigned to a county judge regularly assigned to hear traffic matters iiii 11596 secs 82778295  reserved article iii  traffic control devices specifications all traffic control signs signals and devices shall conform to the manual on uniform traffic control devices as approved by the state department of transportation all signs and signals required under this a particular purpose shall so far as practicable be uniform as to type and location throughout the city all traffic control devices so erected and not inconsistent with the provisions of state law or this be official traffic control devices  installation of multiway stop signs a arterial and collector roads 1 multiway stop signs on arterial and collector roads shall be installed in accordance with the state department of transportation publication titled manual on uniform traffic control devices 2 the multiway stop installation is useful as a safety measure at some locations it should ordinarily be used only where the volume of traffic on the intersection roads is approximately equal a traffic control signal is more satisfactory for an intersection with a heavy volume of traffic 3 multiway stop signs shall not be installed unless one or more of the following conditions are met a where traffic signals are warranted and urgently needed the multiway stop is an interim measure that can be installed quickly to control traffic while arrangements are being made for the signal installation b multiway stop signs may be installed where an accident problem exists as indicated by the occurrence of five or more reported accidents of a type susceptible of correction by a multiway stop installation in a 12month period such accidents include right and left turn collisions as well as rightangle collisions 4 minimum traffic volumes are as follows a the total vehicular volume entering the intersection from all approaches must average at least 500 vehicles per hour for any eight hours of an average day  and b the combined vehicular and pedestrian volume from the minor street or highway must average at least 200 units per hour for the same eight hours with an average delay to minorstreet vehicular traffic of at least 30 seconds per vehicle during the maximum hour when the 85percentile approach speed of the majorstreet traffic exceeds 40 miles per hour the minimum vehicular volume warrant is 70 percent of the requirements set out in subsections a and b of this b local feeder roads signs may be installed for local feeder roads as follows 1 at an intersection that is primary to the area 2 where there is a 6040 percent volume split for a fourway intersection 3 where there is a 7525 percent volume split for a threeway intersection 4 where there are three or more correctable accidents in one year other parameters such as pedestrians site visibility etc should also be considered prior to arriving at a final decision pertaining to the installation of a multiway stop c use generally engineering judgment should be carefully exercised in applying these guidelines to avoid the excessive use of this highly restrictive control in addition all existing multiway stop controlled intersections should be periodically reviewed to determine if another type of control would be more appropriate   iv 71690 public hearing permanent alterations in traffic flows which impede or impair free pedestrian or vehicular movements or access within the city shall only be implemented following a public hearing before the city commission   v 71690 secs 829982120  reserved article iv  stopping standing and parking footnotes  2  cross reference stopping standing and parking of buses and taxicabs  82207 state law reference stopping standing or parking prohibited in specified places fs   responsibility of vehicle owner no person shall allow permit or suffer any vehicle registered in his name to stand or be parked in any street avenue or alley in the city in violation of any of the provisions of this the standing or parking of a vehicle  obstruction of traffic no person shall park any vehicle upon a street other than an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than 12 feet of the width of the roadway for free movement of vehicular traffic  parking in alleys a no person shall park a vehicle within an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than 12 feet of the width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic b no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle within an alley in such a position as to block the driveway entrance to any abutting property  parking for certain purposes prohibited no person shall park a vehicle upon any rightofway for the principal purpose of 1 displaying the vehicle for sale 2 maintenance or repair of the vehicle except repairs necessitated by an emergency 3 selling merchandise or services  standing or parking on oneway roadway if a highway includes two or more separate roadways and traffic is restricted to one direction upon any roadway no person shall stand or park a vehicle upon the lefthand side of the oneway roadway unless signs are erected to permit standing or parking  parking near mailbox no person shall park a vehicle in such a manner as to interfere with or obstruct a mailbox all state and federal regulations regarding mailbox placement and mail delivery shall apply  prohibited parking in residential districts prohibited vehicles as defined in of the unified land development regulations a prohibited vehicles may not be parked or stored in any residentially zoned area unless in the process of making deliveries or unless actively engaged in work that day at the address where the vehicle is parked prohibited vehicles must not be parked on any portion of the rightofway in the residential zone  including the paved roadway the sidewalk and the greenopen space between the sidewalk and the paved roadway    61107  vi 21317 manner of parking a no person shall stand or park a vehicle in a roadway other than parallel with the edge of the roadway headed in the direction of traffic and with the curbside wheels of the vehicle within 12 inches of the edge of the roadway except as provided in this b upon those streets which have been marked or signed for angle parking vehicles shall be parked at the angle to the curb indicated by the marks or signs c in places where and at hours when stopping for the loading or unloading of merchandise or materials is permitted any vehicle used for the transportation of merchandise or materials may back onto the curb to take on or discharge loads when the driver of the vehicle obtains a permit from the police chief granting him that privilege it shall be unlawful for any driver to violate any of the special terms or conditions of the special permit except when on a oneway street or when permission has been granted to so park by the police chief or city manager d no automobile or other vehicle of any kind shall stop on any of the streets or alleys of the city with its left side nearest to the curb e wherever parking spaces are designated by painted lines or markings a vehicle must be parked wholly within the designated area it is unlawful to park outside along or adjacent to the lines or markings  maximum parking time no person shall allow any vehicle registered in his name to be parked on any street roadway or city rightofway in the city for a period of time exceeding 48 consecutive hours  unlawful parking except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with law or the directions of a police officer or official traffic control device no person shall engage in the following 1 stop stand or park a vehicle in any of the following ways a on the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge or curb of a street b on a sidewalk c within an intersection d on a crosswalk e between a safety zone and the adjacent curb or within 30 feet of points on the curb immediately opposite the ends of a safety zone unless the division of road operations of the department of transportation indicates a different length by signs or markings f alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when stopping standing or parking would obstruct traffic 2 stand or park a vehicle whether occupied or not except momentarily to pick up or discharge a passenger or passengers in any of the following ways a in front of a public or private driveway b within 15 feet of a fire hydrant c within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection d within 30 feet upon the approach to any flashing signal stop sign or traffic control signal located at the side of a roadway e within 20 feet of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of a street opposite the entrance to any fire station within 75 feet of such an entrance when properly sign posted f at any place where official signs prohibit standing or parking 3 park a vehicle whether occupied or not except temporarily for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading merchandise or passengers in any of the following ways a within 50 feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing b at any place where official signs prohibit parking c within a fire lane i at those businesses which do not have rear access the owners or operators may apply to the police chief for a special parking permit and decal authorizing parking in abutting fire lanes of sufficient width for the purpose of delivery of goods merchandise supplies or wares ii permitted vehicles shall display the decal and shall be attended at all times while parked in a fire lane and shall be promptly moved by the attendant upon notification by a member of the fire department or police department that an emergency exists requiring access to the fire lane 4 no person shall move a vehicle not lawfully under that persons control into any prohibited area or an unlawful distance away from a curb i 111593 no parking signs a when authorized signs are erected as provided in indicating no parking on any street or part thereof no person shall park a vehicle on that street or part thereof on those streets where parking spaces are officially indicated by signs or markings as provided by parking shall be allowed only within the spaces and then only for the times officially indicated by the authorized signs b when signs are erected upon approaches to hazardous or congested places no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle in the designated place 1 when signs are erected indicating no parking upon that side of a street adjacent to any school property no person shall park a vehicle in the designated places 2 when signs prohibiting parking are erected on narrow streets no person shall park a vehicle in the designated places c it is unlawful for any person to stop stand or park a vehicle within any parking space prominently outlined with paint and posted with a permanent abovegrade sign of a color and design approved by the department of transportation and bearing the international symbol of accessibility and the caption parking by disabled permit only unless the vehicle displays a parking permit issued pursuant to fs   or fs   and the vehicle is transporting a person eligible for the parking permit ii 111593 all night parking the city commission may when conditions warrant restrict or prohibit all night parking wherever required such action shall only take effect following a public hearing for which notice has been posted at least 15 days prior to the holding of the hearing iii 111593 freight zones no persons shall stop stand or park a vehicle for any purpose or period of time other than for the expeditious unloading and delivery or pickup and loading of materials in any place marked as a freight zone as provided in during hours when the provisions applicable to freight zones are in effect in no case shall the stop for loading or unloading of materials exceed the time indicated by signs iv 111593 parking of large vehicles in nonresidential districts motor vehicles measuring 22 feet or more shall not be parked on any city rightofway  including the paved roadway the sidewalk and the greenopen space between the sidewalk and the paved roadway in a residential zone or where posted as provided in the word motor vehicle as used herein shall be construed to include any motor vehicle with or without a trailer attached where the combined length measures 22 feet or more motor vehicles of this length wherever parking is permissible in the nonresidential area shall be parked parallel with the street curb v 111593   61107  vi 21317 secs 8213582150  reserved article v  truck routes definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning deviating truck means a truck which leaves and departs from a truck route while traveling inside the city truck means any vehicle or combination of vehicles designed and operated for the transportation of goods products waste matter or other property of whatever type truck route means a way over certain streets as designated in this over and along which trucks coming into and going out of the city must operate  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 official maps  posting of signs a official maps the city engineer shall keep and maintain accurate maps setting out truck routes and streets upon which truck traffic is permitted the maps shall be kept on file in the office of the city engineer and shall be available to the public b location of signs all street intersections with truck routes and other designated streets shall be clearly signposted to give notice that the regulations of this in effect c failure to post signs no person shall be charged with violating the provisions of this reason of operating a truck upon a street wherein truck travel is prohibited unless appropriate signs are posted  annual review the city commission shall annually review the truck routes designated in this may by resolution amend add or delete truck routes as deemed necessary  routes established there are established within the city the following truck routes for trucks with an outside origin with an outside destination all trucks entering the city for destination points outside the city shall operate only over the following designated routes 1 state road 436 2 state road 434 3 us highway 1792 state road 15600 4 seminola boulevard between us highway 1792 and lake drive 5 lake drive 6 red bug lake road 7 lake howell road 8 plumosa avenue between anchor road and lyman avenue 9 lyman road 10 howell branch road 11 button road  use of designated streets required  exceptions a all trucks within the city shall be operated only over and along the truck routes established in this on the other designated streets over which truck travel is permitted b this not prohibit 1 the operation of trucks upon any street where necessary to the conduct of business at a destination point provided streets upon which such traffic is permitted are used until reaching the intersection nearest the destination point 2 the operation of emergency vehicles upon any street in the city 3 the operation of trucks owned franchised or operated by the city public utilities or any contractor or materialman while engaged in the repair maintenance or construction of streets street improvements or utilities within the city 4 the operation of trucks upon any officially established detour in any case where trucks could lawfully be operated upon the street for which the detour is established 5 pickup trucks and vans used for personal use  deviating truck traffic a outside origin 1 single inside destination point all trucks entering the city for a destination point in the city shall proceed only over an established truck route and shall deviate only at the intersection with the street upon which truck traffic is permitted nearest to the destination point upon leaving the destination point a deviating truck shall return to the truck route by the shortest permissible route 2 multiple inside destination points all trucks entering the city for multiple destination points shall proceed only over established truck routes and shall deviate only at the intersection with the street upon which such traffic is permitted nearest to the first destination point upon leaving the first destination point a deviating truck shall proceed to other destination points by the shortest direction and only over streets upon which such traffic is permitted upon leaving the last destination point a deviating truck shall return to the truck route by the shortest permissible route b inside origin 1 outside destination point all trucks on a trip originating in the city and traveling in the city for a destination point outside the city shall proceed by the shortest direction over streets on which such traffic is permitted to a truck route as established in this 2 inside destination point all trucks on a trip originating in the city and traveling in the city for destination points in the city shall proceed only over streets upon which such traffic is permitted  secs 8215782180  reserved article vi  sight distance and roadside hazards trees and other vegetation in or near rightofway a it shall be unlawful for any person to plant or maintain any tree shrub or plant within any rightofway of the city or on private property immediately abutting a city rightofway located in such a manner as to constitute a hazard to traffic safety b it shall be unlawful for any person to plant or maintain any tree shrub or plant within any rightofway of the city or on private property immediately abutting a city rightofway in such a manner as to damage or constitute a hazard to any street sidewalk curb driveway water line sewer line or other public utility c when after an engineering and traffic investigation any planting shall be determined to be unlawful as constituting the hazards described in subsections a and b of this the owner of the property immediately abutting the rightofway where the planting is located shall within ten days of written notice from the city engineer remove the planting or cause it to be removed at no cost to the city  obstructions to sight distance at intersections a no fence wall hedge shrub planting or other obstruction which obstructs sight lines at elevations between two and six feet above the roadway shall be placed or permitted to remain on any corner lot within the triangular area formed by the street property lines and a line connecting them at points 25 feet from the intersection of the street property lines extended no tree shall be permitted to remain within those distances of those intersections unless the foliage line is maintained at sufficient height to prevent obstruction of sight lines b when after an engineering and traffic investigation any fence wall hedge planting or other obstruction shall be determined to be unlawful as obstructing sight lines described in a of this the owner of the corner lot wherein the obstruction to sight lines is located shall within ten days of written notice by the city engineer remove the obstruction or cause it to be removed at no cost to the city  roadside hazards when after an engineering and traffic investigation any fence wall post pole rock tree or other temporary or permanent structure shall be determined to be illegally placed on a city rightofway so as to constitute a roadside hazard the owner shall within ten days of written notice from the city engineer remove the hazard or cause it to be removed at no cost to the city  service of notices a the notice to the owner required in this be made by certified mail return receipt requested stating the findings of the city engineer and the reasons therefor b this notice shall advise the owner of his right to appeal the order to the city commission by filing a notice of appeal in the office of the city engineer within ten days of receipt a form for a notice of appeal shall be provided with the notice c if notice cannot be provided by certified mail to the owner due to the fact that the owner is unknown or cannot be located it shall be sufficient to deliver a copy of the notice to any person in charge of the premises or in the case no person is found upon the premises by affixing a copy thereof in a conspicuous place on the property  extension of time for removal the period for completing removal as required by this be extended by the city engineer for good cause shown  failure to comply with notice if the corrective action required by this not been completed within the time set forth in the official notice the city engineer director of public works police chief or other affected departments shall request that the administrative officer of the board institute the proper action to ensure that the violator is ordered to appear before the board for the resolution of the matter in accordance with the powers given to this board  emergency removal nothing in this the exercise of emergency powers otherwise available to the city in the face of an imminent threat to public safety  secs 8218882205  reserved article vii  vehicles for hire footnotes  3  cross reference businesses
