reuse water permit service may also be suspended when the city finds these facilities have been connected to its sewer system without prior approval from the city for the connection b any person notified of a suspension of the wastewater treatment service or the wastewater contribution permit shall immediately stop or eliminate the contribution in the event of a failure of the person to comply voluntarily with the suspension order the city shall take such steps as deemed necessary including immediate severance of the sewer connection to prevent or minimize damage to the potw system or endangerment to any individuals andor the environment c the city shall reinstate the wastewater contribution permit or the wastewater treatment service upon proof of the elimination of the noncomplying discharge a detailed written statement submitted by the user describing the causes of the harmful contribution and the measures taken to prevent any future occurrence shall be submitted to the city within 15 days of the date of occurrence d any industrial user who violates the following conditions of this or other applicable local regional state or federal laws regulations and case decisions is subject to having his permit revoked by the director 1 failure of a user to factually report the wastewater constituents and characteristics of his discharge  2 failure of the user to report significant changes in operations or wastewater constituents and characteristics  3 refusal of reasonable access to the users premises for the purpose of inspection or monitoring  4 obtaining of a permit by misrepresentation or failure to disclose fully all relevant facts  5 a change in any condition that requires either a temporary or permanent reduction or elimination of the permitted discharge  or 6 violation of conditions of the permit 66be   81390   112601 cease and desist order a when the director finds that a user has violated or continues to violate any provision of this an industrial discharge permit or order issued hereunder or any pretreatment standard or requirements or that the users past violations are likely to recur the director may issue an order to the user directing it to cease or desist all such violations and directing the user to 1 immediately comply with all requirements and  2 take such appropriate remedial or preventive action as may be needed to properly address a continuing or threatened violation including halting operations andor terminating the discharge b issuance of a cease and desist order shall not be a bar against or a prerequisite for taking any other action against the user  112601 failure to pay penalties or fees the city reserves the right to revoke a discharge permit of any user or disconnect wastewater service to any user orders the director may enter into consent orders assurances of voluntary compliance or other similar documents establishing an agreement with any user responsible for noncompliance such documents will include specific action to be taken by the user to correct the noncompliance within a time period specified by the document such documents shall have the same force and effect as the administrative orders issued in division 2 of this shall be judicially enforceable  112601 show cause hearing the director may order a user which has violated or continues to violate any provisions of sewers a wastewater discharge permit or order issued hereunder or any other pretreatment standard or requirement to appear before the director and show cause why the proposed enforcement action should not be taken notice shall be served on the user specifying the time and place for the meeting the proposed enforcement action the reasons for such action and a request that the user show cause why the proposed enforcement action should not be taken the notice of the meeting shall be served personally or by registered or certified mail return receipt requested at least five working days prior to the hearing such notice may be served on any authorized representative of the user a show cause hearing shall not be a bar against or prerequisite for taking any other action against the user  112601 compliance orders when the director finds that a user has violated or continues to violate any provision of sewers a wastewater discharge permit or order issued hereunder or any other pretreatment standard or requirement the director may issue an order to the user responsible for the discharge directing that the user come into compliance within a specified time if the user does not come into compliance within the time provided sewer service may be discontinued unless adequate treatment facilities devices or other related appurtenances are installed and properly operated compliance orders also may contain other requirements to address the noncompliance including additional selfmonitoring and management practices designed to minimize the amount of pollutants discharged to the sewer a compliance order may not extend the deadline for compliance established for a pretreatment standard or requirement nor does a compliance order relieve the user of liability for any violation including any continuing violation issuance of a compliance order shall not be a bar against or a prerequisite for taking any other action against the user  112601 affirmative defenses to discharge violations a upset 1 for the purposes of this upset means an exceptional incident in which there is unintentional and temporary noncompliance with categorical pretreatment standards because of factors beyond the reasonable control of the user an upset does not include noncompliance to the extent caused by operational error improperly designed treatment facilities inadequate treatment facilities lack of preventive maintenance or careless or improper operation 2 an upset shall constitute an affirmative defense to an action brought for noncompliance with categorical pretreatment standards if the requirements of paragraph 3 below are met 3 a user who wishes to establish the affirmative defense of upset shall demonstrate signed contemporaneous operating logs or other relevant evidence that a an upset occurred and the user can identify the causes of the upset  b the facility was at the time being operated in a prudent and workmanlike manner and in compliance with applicable operation and maintenance procedures  and c the user has submitted the following information to the director within 24 hours of becoming aware of the upset if this information is provided orally a written submission must be provided within five days 1 a description of the indirect discharge and cause of noncompliance  2 the period of noncompliance including exact dates and times or if not corrected the anticipated time the noncompliance is expected to continue  and 3 steps being taken andor planned to reduce eliminate and prevent recurrence of the noncompliance 4 in any enforcement proceeding the user seeking to establish the occurrence of an upset shall have the burden of proof 5 users will have the opportunity for a judicial determination on any claim of upset only in an enforcement action brought for noncompliance with categorical pretreatment standards 6 users shall control production of all discharges to the extent necessary to maintain compliance with categorical pretreatment standards upon reduction loss or failure of its treatment facility until the facility is restored or an alternative method of treatment is provided this requirement applies in the situation where among other things the primary source of power of the treatment facility is reduced lost or fails b prohibited discharge standards 1 a user shall have an affirmative defense to an enforcement action brought against it for noncompliance with the general and specific prohibitions in of this it can prove that it did not know or have reason to know that its discharge alone or in conjunction with discharges from other sources would cause pass interference and that either a a local limit exists for each pollutant discharged and the user was in compliance with each limit directly prior to and during the pass interference  or b no local limit exists but the discharge did not change substantially in nature or constituents from the users prior discharge when the city was regularly in compliance with its npdes permit and in the case of interference was in compliance with applicable sludge use or disposal requirements c bypass 1 a user may allow any bypass to occur which does not cause pretreatment standards or requirements to be violated but only if it also is for essential maintenance to assure efficient operation these bypasses are not subject to the provision of paragraphs 3 and 4 of this 2 if a user knows in advance of the need for a bypass it shall submit prior notice to the director at least ten days before the date of the bypass if possible 3 a user shall submit oral notice to the director of an unanticipated bypass that exceeds applicable pretreatment standards within 24 hours from the time it becomes aware of the bypass a written submission shall also be provided within five days of the time the user becomes aware of the bypass the written submission shall contain a description of the bypass and its cause  the duration of the bypass including exact dates and times and if the bypass has not been corrected the anticipated time it is expected to continue  and steps taken or planned to reduce eliminate and prevent reoccurrence of the bypass the director may waive the written report on a casebycase basis if the oral report has been received within 24 hours 4 bypass is prohibited and the director may take an enforcement action against a user for a bypass unless a bypass was unavoidable to prevent loss of life personal injury or severe property damage  b there was no feasible alternatives to the bypass such as the use of auxiliary treatment facilities retention of untreated wastes or maintenance during normal periods of equipment downtime this condition is not satisfied if adequate backup equipment should have been installed in the exercise of reasonable engineering judgment to prevent a bypass which occurred during normal periods of equipment downtime or preventive maintenance  and c the user submitted notices as required under 3 of this 5 the director may approve an anticipated bypass after considering its adverse effects if the director determines that it will meet the three conditions listed in paragraph 4 a b and c of this  112601 secs 86628665  reserved division 3  application for service  rates and charges service charges generally for the use of and the service rendered by the sewage system rates and charges shall be collected from the owners of each and every lot parcel of real estate or building that is connected with the citys sewer system or otherwise discharges sanitary sewage industrial wastes water or other liquids either directly or indirectly into the sewer system of the city the rates and charges shall be payable as provided in this division and shall be in the amount determinable as provided in this 10   81390 basis of service charges except as otherwise provided in this sewage rates and charges per month for sewage service shall consist of a fixed rate customer charge based on the equivalent customer unit as determined by the size of the customers water meter and a variable rate flow charge which shall be based on the quantity of water used on or in the property or premises subject to the rates and charges as measured by the water meter there in use the variable rate flow charge shall include local city system service charges as well as service charges from the south seminole and north orange county wastewater transmission authority and the orlando iron bridge plant 11   81390 _____ system development charge and tapping fee a sewer system development charge account and interest earned being apportioned to the separate general ledger account based on average daily balance per month e interest customer meter deposits shall accrue interest commencing on the first day following the month of initial deposit no interest shall be paid if a customer closes or finalizes his account at any time within six months from the date of interest accrual total accrued interest shall be credited to the account of the customer when a customer closes or finalizes his account at any time after the expiration of six months from the date of interest accrual all bills shall be finalized at the end of each month accrued interest shall be credited to the accounts of all eligible customers once each year during october and shall not exceed the undistributed accrued interest actually paid by the citys depository 24dh   81390  iv 121691  ii 7793  i 10801   att b 103017 changes to variable rate flow charge  optional unit charge for certain properties a in order to supply of water on the effective date of the ordinance from which this derived shall be required to install a metering device approved by the city and pay necessary installation fees and the appropriate user rates 14   81390 irrigation meter a customer who consumes significant amounts of potable water that is not returned to the sewer system ie used for irrigation may apply for a separate additional irrigation meter and pay necessary installation fees and rates and charges applicable thereto 15   81390 determination of flow for nonmetered water users a any owner or occupant of a lot parcel of land or building which discharges sanitary sewage industrial wastes water or liquid wastes into the city system directly or indirectly who is not a metered customer of water supplied by the city shall pay appropriate user rates for all wastes entering the city system b if the waste entering the system is not measured by a meter or is measured by a meter not acceptable to the city then the amount of water entering the system shall be determined or measured by the city so as to apply appropriate user rates or the owner or party in possession of the property at his expense may install and maintain meters weirs volumetric measuring devices or other adequate and approved measurement apparatus acceptable to the city for the determination of sewage discharge into the city system 16   81390 determination of flow for partially metered water users a any owner or occupant of a lot parcel of land or building which discharges sanitary sewage industrial wastes water or liquid wastes into the city system directly or indirectly who is a metered customer of water supplied by the city and in addition uses water from another source a part of which or all of which is discharged into the city system shall pay appropriate user rates for all wastes entering the city system b that portion of the waste entering the system that is not measured by a meter or is measured by a meter not acceptable to the city shall be determined or measured by the city so as to apply appropriate user rates or the owner or party in possession of the property at his expense may install and maintain meters weirs volumetric measuring devices or other adequate and approved measurement apparatus acceptable to the city for the determination of sewage discharge into the city system 17   81390 adjustment of flow charge when portion of water used does not enter sewer system a for any owner or occupant of a lot parcel of land or building which discharges sanitary sewage industrial wastes water or liquid wastes into the city system directly or indirectly using water in excess of 10000 gallons per month if it can be shown to the satisfaction of the city that a portion of the measured water after calculating the appropriate return factor utilized in establishing the variable rate flow charge set out in this does not enter the sanitary sewer system then the owner occupant or other interested party at his expense shall install and maintain meters weirs volumetric measuring devices or other adequate and approved measurement apparatus acceptable to the city for the determination of sewage discharge b deficiencies in amounts of waste entering the sanitary sewer system shall require the equitable adjustment by the city of the variable rate flow charge of the customer 18   81390 adjustment of flow charge for mass quantity water uses the city may in its discretion make equitable adjustments in the variable rate flow charge when the metered water supply is used for fire protection and other mass quantity uses 19   81390 charges for service rendered to city the city and its several departments and divisions shall pay rates and charges for sewer service rendered to the city in harmony with those rates and charges established in this 20   81390 sampling and analysis of high strength waste a in order that rates and charges may equitably reflect the services received the city shall base its sewer service charges not only on the parameters otherwise enumerated in this division but also on the strength and character of the sewage and waste transported or disposed of b when the city in its discretion determines that a user may be discharging a waste of higher strength than specified in or is otherwise discharging substances above limits specified in this it shall require the owner or other user to measure and determine the strength and content of all sewage and waste discharged either directly or indirectly into the citys sewer system in such manner and by such method as shall be deemed necessary and practical in light of all conditions and attending circumstances of each case in order to determine conformance with this the proper user charge c the owner or other user shall establish a central sampling point which shall be available to the city at all times all sampling shall be done by the city or its approved designee using approved methods all measurements and tests shall be paid for by the user if the results of the tests are questionable or challenged then two or more additional samples and tests shall be taken at intervals specified by the city or its approved designee d samples shall be analyzed in accordance with procedures set forth in 40 cfr 136 and fac as may be amended from time to time e if the test results confirm a sewage discharge other than domestic the user shall pay for all additional samplings and tests and shall pay that surcharge established by the city if the discharge is shown to be domestic in nature then the city shall pay for all samplings and tests from initial to final 21   81390   112601 surcharge for high strength waste a the city commission is authorized to prohibit the discharge of wastes into the citys sewer system which in its discretion are deemed harmful or otherwise undesirable the city of orlando owner of the iron bridge plant which provides sewage treatment service to the city has the authority to pass on a surcharge to the city for treating any sewage which exceeds the average domestic strength as described in this city will likewise pass on the surcharge to the contributing source b the admission into the public sewers of any waters or wastes having a fiveday biochemical oxygen demand or suspended solids greater than 300 parts per million respectively by weight or containing any quantity of substances having the characteristics described in sections 86111 and 86112 shall be subject to the review and approval of the city c where necessary the owner shall provide at his expense such preliminary treatment as may be necessary to reduce the biochemical oxygen demand and the suspended solids to the maximum limits provided for in sections 86111 and 86112 plans specifications and other pertinent information relating to proposed preliminary treatment facilities shall be submitted for the approval of the city and no construction of such facilities shall be commenced until such approval is obtained in writing _____ d extra charges based on the strength of the sewage and liquid wastes shall be made on the following basis 1 high strength bod the surcharge for high strength bod in dollars shall be computed by multiplying the total milligrams per liter of bod above 300 milligrams per liter times the metered water used during the billing period in millions of gallons times a treatment surcharge factor the surcharge factor shall be derived annually from the following formula bod surcharge factor   cost of treatment per million gallons  300 where cost of treatment per million gallons equals operational costs of the citys sewage treatment plant and the iron bridge treatment plant costs for the preceding fiscal year including pro rata administrative costs divided by the total sewage flow plants in millions of gallons and 300 equals the maximum normal bod content expressed in milligrams per liter 2 high strength tss the surcharge for high strength tss in dollars shall be computed by multiplying the total milligrams per liter of tss above 300 milligrams per liter times the metered water used during the billing period in millions of gallons times a treatment surcharge factor the surcharge factor shall be derived annually from the following formula tss surcharge factor   cost of treatment per million gallons  300 where cost of treatment per million gallons equals operational costs of the citys sewage treatment plant and the iron bridge treatment plant costs for the preceding fiscal year including pro rata administrative costs divided by the total sewage flow plants in millions of gallons and 300 equals the maximum normal tss content expressed in milligrams per liter _____ 4 excess nitrogen there shall be an additional charge of $002 per pound of nitrogen in excess of a concentration of three milligrams per liter in the liquid waste being discharged into the system 5 excess phosphorus there shall be an additional charge of $006 per pound of phosphorus in excess of a concentration of ten milligrams per liter in the liquid waste being discharged into the system 22   81390   112601 billing  payment of charges  termination of service a sewer bills shall be rendered monthly and shall be included with the water garbage and utility tax bill but each charge shall be shown as a separate item on the bill the sewer bill is due and payable when rendered if payment is not received by the city in full prior to the due date of the customers next monthly bill the unpaid amount is to be considered in arrears and delinquent if there is an arrearage amount due when the next monthly bill is printed a late fee will be assessed at the rate of 112 percent per month on the arrearage amount or $500 whichever amount is greater the words second notice will appear on the monthly bill along with the late fee charges when this occurs the arrearage late fee and current charges must be paid in full by the due date noted on the second notice bill or all utility services will be discontinued the day after the due date b if a consumer receives both water and sewer service nonpayment of either the water or sewer bill shall constitute a delinquency under this authorize abatement of service by the city c the director of public works shall impose a shutoff fee in the sum of $3000 on all sewer service accounts which have been shut off pursuant to subsections a and b of this service has been disconnected service will not resume until the amount due which includes the arrearage late fee current charges and the sum of $3000 representing a shutoff fee has been paid to the city d voluntary shutoff or termination and all deposits terms of deposits charges and conditions germane thereto can be arranged in advance with the director of public works or his or her staff 25   81390  v 121691  i 5592   6903   72505   32309 review of rates and charges in order that the rates and charges for sewer services may remain fair and equitable and be in proportion to the cost of providing services to the various users the city shall cause a study to be made every three to five years from the effective date of the ordinance from which this derived such study shall include but shall not be limited to an analysis of the costs associated with the treatment of excessive strength effluent from industrial users the volume and delivery flow rate characteristics attributed to the various users or user classes the financial position of the sewage systems and the adequacy of all revenues to provide reasonable funds for required retirement of debt and debt service operation and maintenance replacements and capital improvements to the sewer system the studies shall be conducted by a firm of certified public accountants or a firm of consulting engineers which firms shall have experience in conducting such studies 26   81390  vi 121691  iv 7793  res no 94845  i 62094   62402   72505   32309 accounting procedures and funds a separate accounting procedures and funds shall be established for the collection investment and disbursement of revenues generated and costs associated with the sewer service provided under this b a minimum amount of the sewer revenues as required by bond covenants shall be retained in the renewal replacement and betterment fund to be used as needed during the service life of the sewage system for renewal replacement and betterment of sewage system equipment and collection facilities as needed to provide and maintain a complete and operable system capable of maintaining the standards for which it was designed this amount shall be revised annually to reflect current renewal replacement and betterment requirements 27   81390 changes to renewal replacement and betterment allowance replacement shall be recalculated each year by reviewing the records maintained for equipment structures and other properties if the previous years replacement value is determined to be adequate based on the previous years operating records it shall remain the same if it is anticipated that the replacement item will cost more than anticipated at the end of its service life or if its service life will be shorter than previously estimated the renewal replacement and betterment allowance shall be increased if it is anticipated that the items replacement cost will be less than anticipated or if the service life is deemed longer the renewal replacement and betterment allowance shall be decreased 28   81390 right of city to prohibit discharge of harmful wastes or limit connections to system a the city is hereby authorized to prohibit dumping of wastes into the citys sewer system which in its discretion are harmful to the operation of the sewage works the city may require effective pretreatment methods of wastes to reduce the harmful characteristics of the waste in a fashion satisfactory to the city b the city reserves the right to limit connections to its system should insufficient capacity be available in the system 29   81390 secs 86878695  reserved division 4  building sewers and connections footnotes  3  cross reference roadway and utility construction ch 68 application for service  permit a application for service 1 written application for sanitary sewer service within the service area shall be made to the city at least ten working days before the service is desired 2 all costs charges fees and deposits incident thereto shall be paid with the application or as specified by agreement pursuant to the application shall be on forms furnished by the city and shall constitute an agreement by the applicant with the city to abide by the provisions of this such applicable rules of the city in regard to the use of its sewer system as may from time to time be operative and effective applications for service by firms partnerships associations and corporations shall be tendered only by heir duly authorized agents and the official title of those parties shall be affixed to the applications 3 if any person shall fail neglect or refuse to make application to connect to the sanitary sewer system as prescribed in this after 60 days notice by mail or publication that such sewer system is available the city shall charge the same rates as would be in effect as if the connection had been made and the city may in its discretion connect any such persons plumbing to the sanitary sewer system and charge the entire cost of the connection to the property so connected these costs shall include the stabilization fee which is applicable to that structure at the time of connection to the public sewer b permit required  cancellation of permits 1 no unauthorized person shall uncover make any connections with or to correct any defect in workmanship to the citys satisfaction following a tenday notice by the city to make such correction shall be notified of cancellation of all current permits 3 a permit for a building sewer and connection shall not be construed to be a permit or approval to do excavations in any public or private street parkway alley sidewalk terrace or curb approval of any such excavation
