authority 4 if an authorization under b3 of this no longer accurate because a different individual or position has responsibility for the overall operation of the facility or overall responsibility for environmental matters for the company a new authorization satisfying the requirements of b3 of this be submitted to the control authority prior to or together with any reports to be signed by an authorized representative a such certification shall read as follows i certify under penalty of law that this document and all attachments were prepared under my direction or supervision in accordance with a system designed to assure that qualified personnel properly gather and evaluate the information submitted based on my inquiry of the person or persons who manage the system or those persons directly responsible for gathering the information the information submitted is to the best of my knowledge and belief true accurate and complete i am aware that there are significant penalties for submitting false information including the possibility of fine and imprisonment for knowing violations c baseline monitoring reports 1 within either 180 days after the effective date of a categorical pretreatment standard or the final administrative decision on a category determination whichever is later existing categorical users currently discharging to or scheduled to discharge to the potw shall submit to the director a report which contains the information listed in paragraph 2 below at least 90 days prior to commencement of their discharge new sources and sources that become categorical users subsequent to the promulgation of an applicable categorical standard shall submit to the director a report which contains the information listed in paragraph 2 below a new source shall report the method of pretreatment it intends to use to meet applicable categorical standards a new source also shall give estimates of its anticipated flow and quantity of pollutants to be discharged 2 users described above shall submit the information set forth below a identifying information the name and address of the facility including the name of the operator and owner b environmental permits a list of any environmental control permits held by or for the facility c description of operations a brief description of the nature average rate of production and standard industrial classifications of the operations carried out by such user this description should include a schematic process diagram which indicates points of discharge to the potw from the regulated processes d flow measurement information showing the measured average daily and maximum daily flow in gallons per day to the potw from regulated process streams and other streams as necessary to allow use of the combined wastestream formula e measurement of pollutants 1 the categorical pretreatment standards applicable to each regulated process 2 the results of sampling and analysis identifying the nature and concentration andor mass where required by the standard or by the director of regulated pollutants in the discharge from each regulated process instantaneous daily maximum and longterm average concentrations or mass where required shall be reported the sample shall be representative of daily operations and shall be analyzed in accordance with procedures set out in this must be performed in accordance with procedures set out in this certification a statement reviewed by the users authorized representative and certified by a qualified professional indicating whether pretreatment standards are being met on a consistent basis and if not whether additional operation and maintenance o&m andor additional pretreatment is required to meet the pretreatment standards and requirements g compliance schedule if additional pretreatment andor o&m will be required to meet the pretreatment standards the shortest schedule by which the user will provide such additional pretreatment andor o&m the completion date in this schedule shall not be later than the compliance date established for the applicable pretreatment standard a compliance schedule pursuant to this meet the requirements set out in of this signature and certification all baselinemonitoring reports must be signed and certified in accordance with this all users not required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit shall provide appropriate reports to the director as the director may require d compliance schedule progress reports 1 the following conditions shall apply to the compliance schedule required by   2 the schedule shall contain progress increments in the form of dates for the commencement and completion of major events leading to the construction and operation of additional pretreatment required for the user to meet the applicable pretreatment standards such events include but are not limited to hiring an engineer completing preliminary and final plans executing contracts for major components commencing and completing construction and beginning and conducting routine operation  3 no increment referred to above shall exceed nine months  4 the user shall submit a progress report to the director no later than 14 days following each date in the schedule and the final date of compliance including as a minimum whether or not it complied with the increment of progress the reason for any delay and if appropriate the steps being taken by the user to return to the established schedule  and 5 in no event shall more than nine months elapse between such progress reports to the director e reports on compliance with categorical pretreatment standard deadline 1 within 90 days following the date for final compliance with applicable categorical pretreatment standards or in the case of a new source following commencement of the introduction of wastewater into the potw any user subject to such pretreatment standards and requirements shall submit to the director a report containing the information described in of this users subject to equivalent mass or concentration limits established in accordance with the procedures in 62 fac this report shall contain a reasonable measure of the users longterm production rate for all other users subject to categorical pretreatment standards expressed in terms of allowable pollutant discharge per unit of production or other measure of operation this report shall include the users actual production during the appropriate sampling period all compliance reports must be signed and certified in accordance with this f periodic compliance reports 1 all significant industrial users shall at a frequency determined by the director but in no case less than twice per year in june and december submit a report indicating the nature and concentration of pollutants in the discharge which are limited by pretreatment standards and the measured or estimated average and maximum daily flows for the reporting period all periodic compliance reports must be signed and certified in accordance with this 2 all wastewater samples must be representative of the users discharge wastewater monitoring and flow measurement facilities shall be properly operated kept clean and maintained in good working order at all times the failure of a user to keep its monitoring facility in good working order shall not be grounds for the user to claim that sample results are unrepresentative of its discharge 3 if a user subject to the reporting requirement in this any pollutant more frequently than required by the director using the procedures prescribed in the results of this monitoring shall be included in the report g reports of changed conditions 1 each user must notify the director of any planned significant changes to the users operations or system which might alter the nature quality or volume of its wastewater at least 30 days before the change 2 the director may require the user to submit such information as may be deemed necessary to evaluate the changed condition including the submission of a wastewater discharge permit application 3 the director may issue a wastewater discharge permit or modify an existing wastewater discharge permit in response to changed conditions or anticipated changed conditions 4 for purposes of this requirement significant changes include but are not limited to flow increases of 20 percent or greater and the discharge of any previously unreported pollutants h reports of potential problems 1 in the case of any discharge including but not limited to accidental discharges discharges of a nonroutine episodic nature a noncustomary batch discharge or a slug load that may cause potential problems for the potw the user shall immediately telephone and notify the director of the incident this notification shall include the location of the discharge type of waste concentration and volume if known and corrective actions taken by the user 2 within five days following such discharge the user shall unless waived by the director submit a detailed written report describing the causes of the discharge and the measures to be taken by the user to prevent similar future occurrences such notification shall not relieve the user of any expense loss damage or other liability which may be incurred as a result of damage to the potw natural resources or any other damage to person or property  nor shall such notification relieve the user of any fines penalties or other liability which may be imposed pursuant to this 3 a notice shall be permanently posted on the users bulletin board or other prominent placeadvising employees whom to call in the event of a discharge described in 1 above employers shall ensure that all employees who may cause such a discharge to occur are advised of the emergency notification procedure  112601 notice of violationrepeat sampling and reporting a if sampling performed by a user indicates a violation the user must notify the potw within 24 hours of becoming aware of the violation the user shall also repeat the sampling and analysis and submit the results of the repeat analysis to the director within 30 days after becoming aware of the violation  112601 notification of the discharge of hazardous waste a any user who commences the discharge of hazardous waste shall notify the director the epa regional waste management division director and state hazardous waste authorities in writing of any discharge into the potw of a substance which if otherwise disposed of would be a hazardous waste under 40 cfr such notification must include the name of the hazardous waste as set forth in 40 cfr the epa hazardous waste number and the type of discharge continuous batch or other if the user discharges more than 100 kilograms of such waste per calendar month to the potw the notification also shall contain the following information to the extent such information is known and readily available to the user an identification of the hazardous constituents contained in the wastes an estimation of the mass and concentration of such constituents in the waste stream discharged during that calendar month and an estimation of the mass of constituents in the waste stream expected to be discharged during the following 12 months all notifications must take place no later than 180 days after the discharge commences any notification under this paragraph need be submitted only once for each hazardous waste discharged however notifications of changed conditions must be submitted under the notification requirement in this not apply to pollutants already reported by users subject to categorical pretreatment standards under the selfmonitoring requirements of  b dischargers are exempt from the requirements of paragraph a above during a calendar month in which they discharge no more than 15 kilograms of hazardous wastes unless the wastes are acute hazardous wastes as specified in 40 cfr 26130d and 26133e discharge of more than 15 kilograms of nonacute hazardous wastes in a calendar month or of any quantity of acute hazardous wastes as specified in 40 cfr 26130d and 26133e requires a onetime notification subsequent months during which the user discharges more than such quantities of any hazardous waste do not require additional notification c in the case of any new regulations under of rcra identifying additional characteristics of hazardous waste or listing any additional substance as a hazardous waste the user must notify the director the epa regional waste management waste division director and state hazardous waste authorities of the discharge of such substance within 90 days of the effective date of such regulations d in the case of any notification made under this the user shall certify that it has a program in place to reduce the volume and toxicity of hazardous wastes generated to the degree it has determined to be economically practical e this provision does not create a right to discharge any substance not otherwise permitted to be discharged by this a permit issued thereunder or any applicable federal or state law i 112601 analytical requirements a all pollutant analyses including sampling techniques to be submitted as part of a wastewater discharge permit application or report shall be performed in accordance with the techniques prescribed in fac unless otherwise specified in an applicable categorical pretreatment standard if fac does not contain sampling or analytical techniques for the pollutant in question sampling and analyses must be performed in accordance with procedures approved by fdep standard operating procedure  112601 sample collection a except as indicated in b below the user must collect wastewater samples using flow proportional composite collection techniques in the event flow proportional sampling is infeasible the director may authorize the use of time proportional sampling or a minimum of four grab samples where the user demonstrates that this will provide a representative sample of the effluent being discharged in addition grab samples may be required to show compliance with instantaneous discharge limits b samples for oil and grease temperature ph cyanide phenols sulfides and volatile organic compounds must be obtained using grab collection techniques  112601 timing a written reports will be deemed to have been submitted on the date postmarked for reports which are not mailed postage prepaid into a mail facility serviced by the united states postal service the date of receipt of report shall govern data contained in the report must be from samples taken during the period covered by the report in accordance with 62625 6006c fac  112601 record keeping a users subject to the reporting requirements of this retain and make available for inspection and copying all records of information obtained pursuant to any monitoring activities required by this any additional records of information obtained pursuant to monitoring activities undertaken by the user independent of such requirements records shall include the date exact place method and time of sampling and the name of the persons taking the samples  the dates analyses were performed  who performed the analyses  the analytical techniques or methods used  and the results of such analyses these records shall remain available for a period of at least three years this period shall be automatically extended for the duration of any litigation concerning the user or the city or where the user has been specifically notified of a longer retention period by the director  112601 secs 8614586160  reserved article iii  water footnotes  4  cross reference drinking water to be provided at public places  502 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning commercial includes classical commercial properties and establishments served by the municipal water system equivalent residential unit and eru mean equal to the average daily flow of a singlefamily residence which is 250 gpd for water service multifamily means a multiple dwelling unit of two or more units served by one meter common to the complex served by the municipal water system residential includes the classical individually metered singlefamily residential dwelling but also includes any dwelling unit which is individually metered irrespective of the fact that it may be included within a multipleunit complex served by the municipal water system 01  ii 121691   att a 103017 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 connection with public system a required the owner of each lot parcel or piece of land located within the municipal limits of the city upon which any building structure or trailer is to be installed as a dwelling for human habitation or for residential commercial or other uses shall cause the premises to be connected to the public water distribution system of the city b time limit  exceptions the connection of structures for residential commercial or other uses shall be accomplished within 90 days after written notification from the director of public works however no connection shall be required where 1 the water distribution system or water lines of the city are more than 100 feet from a lot parcel or piece of land located within the city and the city does not elect to extend the service to within 100 feet of any portion of the parcel to be served 2 a person would be required to traverse the private property of another in order to make the connection to the city water distribution system c reimbursement of water benefit fees 1 the city agrees to contract to reimburse an applicant for extension lines for connection to the water distribution system at a rate of 40 percent of all water benefit fees paid to the city by intermediate applicants until the original applicant is reimbursed in that amount established by and in accordance with the contract executed prior to the installation of all intermediate lines the reimbursement shall be payable only during the 60month period following the installation 2 the city shall retain 60 percent of the water benefit fees collected and disburse to the original applicant 40 percent of the water benefit fees collected from intervening owners agents tenants or consumers 3 the city guarantees reimbursement only as intermediate properties are developed and water benefit fees are actually received by the city all agreements for reimbursement of original water benefit fees will run for a period not to exceed 60 months from the date of initial payment and such fees shall not bear interest 51   att b 103017 interruption of service a neither the city nor its public works department guarantees an uninterrupted water supply or water at any particular pressure for any purpose the city reserves and shall have the right to shut off water in its mains at any time for the purpose of making repairs or extensions or for other purposes incidental to a public water supply and will not be responsible for any damage resulting from a consumer leaving a faucet open or otherwise caused by low pressure b the public works department shall have the right to turn off water service for the protection of the city or the consumer in cases where a private water system has been installed or where a building has burned or been razed or where the consumer has been found to be using water illegally and to assess the applicable fees for restoration of service 52 use of water from private wells the use of water from privately owned wells for household domestic food processing food handling restaurant dairying or bottling purposes or activities is hereby prohibited and declared to be unlawful whenever and wherever water produced by the public works department of the city is available for use for these purposes the provisions of this not be construed as preventing or prohibiting the use of water from privately owned wells for sprinkling irrigation air conditioning and fire prevention purposes or activities 53 reserved use of curb stops  right of city to shut off water a the curb stop on any and all service connections within the city shall not be used or manipulated by the owner or the employee or agent of the owner for purposes connected with turning on or shutting off the water supply any turning on or shutting off procedure by the owner shall be accomplished with a separate stopcock located on the owners side of the service curb stop all turning on or shutting off procedures of the water supply at the curb stop shall be accomplished exclusively by representatives of the public works department and may result in a disconnection or connection charge of $2500 except when the shutoff is done at the request or for the convenience of the city b a violation of a of this the owner or any employee or agent of the owner or consumer shall subject the owner or consumer to a penalty of $1500 for the first offense and up to $2500 per offense for all subsequent offenses each day an offense occurs shall constitute a separate offense for repeated offenses the city may discontinue utility service and shut off the water supply to the premises if the public works department determines that the owner or consumer is in fact in violation of a of this a determination is promulgated by the public works department the department shall conduct a hearing on the alleged violations and give the owner or consumer ten days notice prior to the hearing if the public works department determines that the owner or consumer has violated a of this then the water service shall be discontinued until the owner or consumer is capable of providing the public works department with assurances that such violations will not be repeated c all requests of the owner or consumer for shutoff or turnon of the water supply shall be made directly to the customer services division and may result in a disconnection charge or reconnection charge of $2500 for requests during normal business hours mondaythursday excluding city recognized legal holidays  am pm or $4000 for requests after business hours d in case of accident breakdown or shortage of water supply or for any cause beyond its control or because of any act of commission or omission on the part of the city or its agents or in the case of repairs renewals or replacements of service the city reserves the right to shut off the water supply to any consumer served by the city without notice this interruption in service shall not cause the city to be responsible for any damages actions claims of actions or consequences resulting from such shutoff reasonable efforts shall be made to communicate with affected customers without unnecessary delay e the city reserves at all times the right to shut off water supply service wherever and whenever reasonably justifiable with or without notice so as to protect the entire utility supply system under its control or in case of emergencies to preserve necessary pressure or volume for fire flows nothing in this be construed to require the city to give notice of the shutoff procedure f the discontinuance of water service of the shutoff procedure to any premises served by the city system shall not entitle the owner or consumer to an abatement or deduction in water service charges nor shall it accelerate a refund of charges paid in advance during the shutoff period unless the shutoff period exceeds 20 consecutive days 46   att b 103017 prevention of waste and repair of leaks a it shall be the duty of every owner agent tenant or consumer using the city water system to exercise diligence to prevent the waste of water and to repair all leaks on his premises without unreasonable delay the willful waste of water or failure to repair leakage without unreasonable delay or the extravagant and wasteful use of city water by any owner agent tenant or consumer may be cause for the city to discontinue service after a 72hour notice if the notice is not adhered to b when the water supply to any premises has been shut off because of leakage neglect or waste as provided in this water service shall not be reinstated until all causes for termination have been remedied by the owner to the satisfaction of the public works department 47 use of water during fires all consumers using the city water system shall immediately abate sprinkling of their premises upon knowledge or notice of a fire in the vicinity of their premises so that maximum pressure may be available to fight the fire sprinkling may be used by an owner agent tenant or consumer for the protection of his premises against fire in close proximity to his property 48 public fire hydrants a installation all fire hydrants within the city water system shall be installed by the public works department in accordance with agreements entered into between the owner agent tenant or consumers and the city except when installed as part of an approved development project b use 1 all fire hydrants or fireplugs shall be exclusively used for fire protection fire hydrants or fireplugs shall not be used for sprinkling sewer flushing filling watering or other purposes except by city authorities without a written permit from the director of public works upon consultation with the fire department this permit shall be exhibited by authorized permittees when requested by city authorities 2 all permits issued by the director of public works for use of fire hydrants or fireplugs for purposes other than the extinguishment of fire or wetting down of surrounding properties during a fire to prevent damage to life and property shall be revocable at the pleasure or discretion of the director of public works at any time following a 24hour notice c request for additional hydrants an owner agent tenant or consumer may submit a written request for additional fire hydrants from the city system subject to the following conditions 1 the owner agent tenant or consumer shall pay for the installation of the fire hydrant or fireplug 2 the owner agent tenant or consumer shall pay the required annual fee to the city for rental of the fire hydrant or fireplug if the hydrant or fireplug is located on private property and is privately owned d charge to city and county the city shall pay to the public works department a minimum charge of $5000 per year for each fire hydrant located within the city rightofway or on other city property connected to the water system inside the city limits and in no event shall the minimum yearly charge be less than the actual cost of water consumed the county shall pay to the public works department a minimum charge of $7500 per year for each fire hydrant connected outside the city limits and located within a county rightofway or other public property and in no event shall the minimum yearly charge be less than the actual cost of water consumed 49   5916 extension of system outside city limits a all extensions of the water distribution system of the city which extend beyond the municipal limits of the city shall be subject to the following extension policy 1 the applicant for water distribution service outside the municipal limits of the city shall furnish and install at his expense an adequate water distribution system with necessary appurtenances thereto in accordance with a written utility commitment agreement to be executed by the city and the contractor when the city commission makes the determination that such a commitment is in the best interests of the city 2 the contractor shall furnish the city with plans and specifications prepared by a registered professional engineer outlining the proposed utility facilities and any other data that shall be required by the director of public works these plans and specifications shall be approved by the state board of health the city engineer and the director of public works b all contracts for the installation of extraterritorial distribution systems shall be approved by the city before the installation is commenced 50 emergency restrictions on water use a purpose  applicability 1 the purpose of this to control and restrict the use of water furnished by the city or any other supplier of water for irrigation lawn or plant sprinkling washing automobiles and filling swimming pools on monday of each week during the hours of  pm to  pm inclusive and to control and restrict the use of water during the continuous period from  am saturday until  pm of the following sunday the use of spray irrigation systems shall be prohibited between  am and  pm seven days each week 2 this not restrict the use of wells or irrigation systems owned and operated by citizens on their private premises but shall apply only to water furnished to citizens by the city or any other supplier of water commercial carwash establishments shall also be excluded from the intent of this 3 the provisions of this be implemented from time to time during periods of water crises and emergencies by the city manager as chief executive officer of the city and the police chief the director of public works shall issue timely notice during periods when consumption control is necessary b prohibited acts it shall be unlawful for any person to use or consume water for irrigation lawn or plant sprinkling washing automobiles or filling swimming pools at any time during the term of applicability of this monday during the hours from  pm to  pm inclusive and during the continuous period from  am saturday until  pm of the following sunday the use of spray irrigation systems shall be prohibited between  am and  pm seven days each week this control of water consumption shall apply to water furnished to persons within the definition declared by the city and shall be implemented from time to time pursuant to a3 of this 45 public notice of potential lead contamination a the citys public water system shall identify and provide notice to persons that may be affected by lead contamination of their drinking water where such contamination results from either or both of the following 1 the lead content in the construction materials of the public water distribution system 2 corrosivity of the water supply sufficient to cause leaching of the lead the notice shall be provided in such manner and form as may be reasonably required by the administrator of the environmental protection agency notice under this be provided notwithstanding the absence of a violation of any national drinking water standard b notice under this provide a clear and readily understandable explanation of 1 the potential sources of lead in the drinking water  2 the potential adverse health effects  3 reasonable available methods of mitigating known or potential lead content in drinking water  4 any steps the system is taking to mitigate lead content in the drinking water  and 5 the necessity for seeking alternative water supplies if any c other notices shall be provided by the city in such manner and form as may be reasonably required by federal or state environmental agencies 65 secs 8617386185  reserved _____ closes or finalizes his or her account at any time after the expiration of six months from the date of interest accrual all bills shall be finalized at the end of each month accrued interest shall be year 02  iii 121691  i 7793  iiv 6694  res no 991174  i 6799   62402   4 72202   12703   6903  >o 051168  1 72505   32309   111312  11413   att b 103017 _____ review of rates and charges in order that the rates and charges for utility services may remain fair and equitable and be in proportion to the cost of providing services to the various users the city shall cause a study to be made every three to five years from the effective date of the ordinance from which this derived such study shall include but shall not be limited to an analysis of the costs associated with the volume and delivery flow rate characteristics attributed to the various users or user classes the financial position of the water and reclaimed water systems and the adequacy of all revenues to provide reasonable funds for required retirement of debt and debt service operation and maintenance replacements and capital improvements to the water and reclaimed water systems the studies shall be conducted by a firm of certified public accountants or a firm of consulting engineers which firms shall have experience in conducting such studies 06  vi 121691  iv 7793   62402   72202   72505   32309 billing  payment of charges  termination of service a water bills shall be rendered monthly and shall be included with the sewer garbage and utility tax bill but each charge shall be shown as a separate item on the bill the water bill is due and payable when rendered if payment is not received by the city in full prior to the due date of the customers next monthly bill the unpaid amount is to be considered in arrears and delinquent if there is an arrearage amount due when the next monthly bill is printed a late fee will be assessed at the rate of 112 percent per month on the arrearage amount or $500 whichever amount is greater the words second notice will appear on the monthly bill along with the late fee charges when this occurs the arrearage late fee and current charges must be paid in full by the due date noted on the second notice bill or all utility services will be discontinued the day after the due date b the director of finance shall impose a shutoff fee in the sum of $3000 on all water or reclaimed water service accounts which have been shut off pursuant to a of this service has been disconnected service will not resume until the total amount due which includes the arrearage late fee current charges the sum of $3000 representing a shutoff fee and a reconnect fee of $4000 has been paid to the city c the director of finance is authorized to impose a delinquency charge of $3000 on all water service accounts delinquent for over 20 calendar days and is hereby authorized to discontinue utility service to such delinquent accounts after notice d voluntary shutoff or termination and all deposits refunds of deposits charges and conditions germane thereto can be arranged in advance with the director of finance or his or her staff e the director of finance is authorized to impose a service charge of $2500 for each trip to perform a field service requested by the customer other than a to initiate or relocate service covered by other charges b for a customerrequested reread covered pursuant to  and c to turn offturn on for leak repair courtesy of the city the customer will only be charged a fee if the reason for the call is related to the equipment located on the customers property from the meter to the customers home or building the customer must be notified in advance of this potential charge 07  vii 121691  ii 5592   6903   72505   32309   att b 103017 adjustment of bills a no abatements or deductions on water consumption charges based on meter readings will be allowed and refunded except for errors on the part of the city when charges are based on inaccuracy in meter registration or in the event of error by the city in making a charge abatement or deduction will be considered if the abatement or adjustment is presented in writing within 30 days after the date of rendition of the disputed bill b under no circumstances will abatements allowances deductions or refunds be made on water supply service accounts because of water used lost or wasted carelessness neglect or otherwise after the water has passed customers meter except for cases of excessive leakage where documentation is presented in writing within 30 days of the date of the bill verifying the correction of the excessive leakage documentation shall be in the form of a completed adjustment request form with plumber receipts providing the location of leak or statement by the owner regarding repairs completed by the owner with receipts for materials upon detection of excessive water usage the city will notify the owner of the excessive amount of water used and the city will allow the ownertenant 72 hours to correct the matter if the excessive water usage is not corrected within 72 hours service will be interrupted the water bill shall be decreased such that the charge for the excess gallons will equal the actual cost of production of the water actual cost of production as used herein is defined as the energy cost for the withdrawal from the well and the cost of chemical treatment adjustments to the water bill as provided herein shall be approved by the public works director 08   11303 delinquent accounts all water service accounts which are delinquent shall result in the discontinuance of water sewer and garbage service to the customer after a second notice bill has been sent to the customer as provided in sections 8682a and 86191 where service has been disconnected service will not resume until the total amount of the delinquent account the shutoff fee late fee and reconnect fee has been paid to the city 09  viii 121691  iii 5592   72505   32309 secs 8619486205  reserved division 3  service contract application for service a generally  fee all applications for utility service must be made in writing at the office of the public works department and shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable application fee of $3000 for initiation of utility services the owner or authorized occupant of the premises proposed for utility service must sign the application for utility service b application to constitute contract  withdrawal the application for utility service becomes a binding contract upon both the owner or occupant and the city prior to the installation of the service connections the owner or occupant may cancel or withdraw the application upon his written order subject to the restrictions contained in this c annexation agreement if application is made for city water service to property located outside the city limits that is contiguous to the existing city limits the owner of the property shall simultaneously annex the property into the city as a prerequisite to the provision of water service to the property if application is made for city water service to property located outside the city limits that is not contiguous to the existing city limits the owner of the property shall simultaneously execute an agreement to annex the property into the city when the property becomes contiguous to the city limits 15  x 121691   72505   32309 term  renewal all contracts for water supply service shall expire at the end of the next succeeding calendar month from the date of written application all contracts shall be automatically renewed without notice from either party from month to month unless five days notice is given in writing and all charges are paid in full payment of charges at any interval or period other than monthly shall not be construed as altering the period of the contract or its renewal under this 16 change in ownership of premises a notification of city in the event of any change in ownership or occupancy of any premises connected to the city water system thecity shall be immediately notified of the change notice shall include the name of the new owner or occupant if known in the absence of application for service by the new owner or occupant the use of the city service may at the option of the city be taken and construed as acceptance by the new owner or occupant of all contract obligations of the preceding owner or occupant with the city including payment for unpaid services b responsibility for payment of charges 1 if any owner fails to notify the city in writing of the change in ownership or occupancy of any premises for water supply service the owner shall continue to be liable to the city for all rates and charges accrued and accruing for the service until either the termination of the contract period at which time he may notify the city of his desire to cancel or until the city has of its own volition canceled the contract with the owner 2 this not preclude the city from also demanding from the new owner or occupant the payment for all or any charges which shall at the time of the demand be unpaid or unsecured without regard to whether the charges accrued prior or subsequent to the change in ownership or occupancy upon failure of the new owner to comply with this demand within 72 hours after written notice thereof the city shall have the right to shut off the water supply and discontinue the service 3 in no case of change of ownership shall the preceding owner be released from any contractual obligations with the city until the expiration of the contract except at the option of the city 17 commencement of service a when application for water supply service is made the service together with the charges and rates therefor shall begin on the date of the completion of the service connection by the city unless the owner states in writing in the application that the service connection shall be shut off immediately upon its installation in that event the connection shall then be shut off and shall thereafter be turned on by the city only upon written request of the owner  further the charges and rates for water supply service shall commence on the date of turnon in accordance with this though the turnon request had been an original application b where there has been a change in ownership prior to a turnon of the service connection the new owner shall sign the application for water supply upon the regular form before actual turnon and make the necessary deposits unless the previous owner has requested in writing that the service including deposit be transferred to the new owner 18 cancellation all contracts for city water service shall be subject to cancellation of service and discontinued by the city for any of the following reasons 1 if there has been any misrepresentation or concealment in the application as to the premises or fixtures to be furnished by the city water supply service or the use to be made of the service 2 if there has been any waste or excessive use of water or defective pipes and fixtures or appliances or in any other manner 3 if the customer has refused or neglected to make any advance payment if such payment is required by the city or refused or neglected to comply with any requirement of the city as to meter or service connection maintenance alteration or renewal 4 if the water supply service has been used in connection with or for the benefit of any premises or purpose other than that stated in the application 5 if there has been any interference or tampering whether by act of commission or omission with the meter measuring the water supply the seals of any meter any meter box or vault service pipes valves or any seals thereon the curb stop any appliance of the city or any appliance of the owner which was or is required by the city for controlling or regulating the water supply service for the purpose of this an interference or tampering with any appliance used in connection with or for controlling or regulating the water supply service to any premises shall be construed and taken to be the act of the owners or consumers using the water service at the premises 6 if written notification is provided to the customer service division indicating that the consumer will not temporarily need the water supply system and desires the service to be reconnected at a future date 7 if there has been a violation of any ordinance of the city related to use of the water supply service 8 if there has been a change in ownership or occupancy of the premises but no application from the new owners or occupants has been made and approved by the city 9 if the contract has been in any way terminated by actions of the owner or occupant 10 if any owner or consumer refuses or neglects the payment of a bill account or charge at a previous or current address within the city 19 secs 8621186220  reserved division 4  meters metered service required a all city water customers shall be required to have metered service and such fire protection service as shall be required in this to pay for the amount of water consumed in accordance with rates established in division 2 of this two or more consumers in separate buildings or dwellings shall be permitted to use the same meter and no free water shall be furnished to any consumer b where the owner of a building containing more than one store dwelling or unit desires that separate meters be installed for each separate store dwelling or unit the additional meters shall be installed upon the payment in advance by the owner of the charge for additional meters plus an additional water use or sewer use system development charge if required 25   att a 103017 temporary service a contractors and other persons will be supplied with water for temporary use according to the regular service charge provided for water supply they will be required to deposit $6000 for each temporary service plus the meter charge if a meter has not been previously installed the deposit shall be held by the city as a guarantee for payment for service and the return of all equipment in satisfactory condition to the city public works department a minimum charge of $3000 will be made for connecting the meter and a minimum charge of $3000 will be made for disconnecting the meter as requested upon payment of all charges for water used the city duly authorized agent is authorized to refund the amount of deposit made by the applicant for the service b contractors or any other consumers desiring water for temporary use will not be allowed to use water from unmetered fire hydrants except upon direct written approval from the director of public works 26   72505   32309   att b 103017 use of water from fire hydrants  traveling meters contractors desiring to take water from fire hydrants shall deposit a $120000 hydrant meter deposit this meter shall be placed on a hydrant or the owners vehicle for the exclusive use of the party making application a backflow prevention device is included and will be issued with the hydrant meter the meter shall be read monthly andor at the time of job completion and the party billed for water consumed costs for any damages loss or theft of the equipment will be withheld from the deposit to repair or replace the rented hydrant meter and backflow prevention device 27   att b 103017 installation and repair a all meters shall be furnished and installed by the city upon the application of any owner or responsible party paying the water benefit charge plus the required meter deposit and charge where applicable all meters so furnished and installed shall remain the property of the city and subject to the absolute and exclusive control of the city b the owner shall provide and maintain a location for the meter which is acceptable to the city when any meter has been placed its position shall not be changed except by the city if any owner makes or wishes to have made any alteration to his premises which in the discretion of the public works department requires a change in the location or position of the meter or meter box the change in location or position shall be made by the public works department at the expense of the owner c repairs renewals and replacements of all water meters and meter boxes shall be made by the city at its expense where the repairs renewals and replacements are due to ordinary wear and tear 28 meter reading a water meters are to be read at regular intervals if the meter is in good working order since the last reading bills are rendered in accordance with that reading the city reserves the right for any reason deemed by it to be sufficient to read any meter and render any bills therefor quarterly bimonthly monthly or at more frequent intervals all readings of meters shall be taken as near as practicable on the same calendar day of the month b customer service for seven days or less prior to a regularly scheduled consumption reading will be billed for with the next regular billing cycle at which time the customer shall pay for total volume consumed but not less than one monthly minimum charge c the quantity of water recorded by the meter shall be conclusive as to consumption on both the owner and the city except when the meter is found to be inaccurate or inoperative if it is determined that the meter has become inoperative the city shall bill the user in an amount equal to the average consumption billed for in the three previous months 29 testing a all water meters shall be carefully tested before they are installed and after their installation they shall be tested as frequently as circumstances warrant but normally not less than once every six years the city reserves the right to remove and test any meter at any time if at any time a meter is found to be more than two percent inaccurate the city shall substitute another meter of the same size in its place either permanently or temporarily or repair the inaccurate meter in the event of such a test result the city further reserves the right to make an adjustment to the last bill rendered based on the last reading of the meter in accordance with the results of the test b should the owner at any time question the accuracy of the meter on his service the city shall upon his written application accompanied by the payment of a fee of $5000 for each meter in question remove the meter and test it in the presence of the owner or his authorized agent if the test is desired by the owner if the test shows the meter has been overregistering by more than two percent the $5000 paid shall be returned to the owner and a corrected bill based on an average reading shall be rendered to the customer for the billing period in question the adjustment shall be reflected and become due and owing when the city submits its next regular bill to the customer if the test shows the meter is not overregistering by more than two percent the $5000 paid by the owner shall be retained by the city in addition if the test shows that the meter has been underregistering by more than two percent the $5000 paid by the owner shall be retained by the city and the next bill rendered shall be based on the next current reading 30   72505   32309   att b 103017 meter tampering broken seal and illegal tapconnection a the owner or consumer or his agent at every location shall pay to the city the sum of $25000 the first time the seal on any water meter is found broken or removed the city reserves the right to affix the seal at any time and upon the second occurrence the owner or consumer or his agent at every location shall pay to the city the sum of $50000 the city may shut off the water supply and discontinue its service the owner or consumer shall be given one weeks written notice prior to the shut off b if the director of finance determines that the breakage or removal was a direct result of the intentional or negligent acts of the owner or consumer the city shall shut off the water supply and discontinue its service until the owner or consumer is capable of providing the director of finance with adequate assurances that the breakage or removal will not be repeated the city may charge an additional deposit prior to turning on the water if the director of finance determines that the deposit is necessary in order to ensure that breakage or removal will not be repeated 31   72505   32309   att b 103017 secs 8622886240  reserved division 5  installation of service equipment laying of service pipes the city shall lay the utility service pipe for water service to the property line of the contracting owner provided the property lines correspond with lines dedicated and recorded in the subdivision plat the city will not service lots or portions of lots that have not been subdivided in accordance with city requirements 35 size of service installation a if water service supplying improvements on property within the city is found to be insufficient because of additions to buildings or increases in the number of fixtures the city will install the larger tap and service upon payment by the owner of the required connection charge for the increased size in service no credit will be allowed for service in a place which is found to be insufficient in size the owner will be required to install a gate valve on the service installation between the building and the meter box so that the utility supply may be interrupted by the owner or the city in case of a break or needed repair within the building or structure b the city reserves at all times the option to designate and prescribe the required size of the service connection either upon the original connection installation or upon any renewal or replacement of the existing connection where the size required for existing service is other than that applied for by the owner or is other than the installation in existence the city shall designate and prescribe the required size of service and the owner shall be bound by that designation c for premises other than singlefamily residential units the owner is responsible for informing the public works department of the total number of gallons per minute at peak flow required to service his structure or development 36 replacement of defective or obsolete equipment the city may from time to time determine that certain water service apparatus or equipment previously approved by the city is defective or obsolete if the city determines that the apparatus or equipment has become obsolete or defective the owner shall install on his service connection a tank checkvalve cock or gate valve pressure regulator or other appliances apparatus or equipment of a design approved by the city following the required installation the owner may not change alter substitute or make an addition to that installation if the owner fails to comply with the requirements of the city upon 30 days written notice to the owner the city may cancel its utility contract and discontinue service 37 secs 8624486255  reserved division 6  private fire protection service footnotes  5  cross reference fire prevention and protection ch 42 installation charge  annual charge the cost of installation of private fire protection service shall be paid by the owner at the actual cost of material and labor when installed by the city this charge shall be payable prior to installation in addition there shall be an annual charge as stated in 40 conditions of service contract the city shall install fire line water connections up to the property line upon the signing by the owners of a contract containing the following conditions 1 this connection is to be used for fire protection only and because of the danger of pollution shall have no connection with any other source of supply 2 the owner shall not draw any water connection for any purpose except for the extinguishment of fires or for the periodic test of the fire system which shall be made in the presence of the director of public works or his representatives or by members of the fire department who shall immediately notify the director of public works all valves or hose connections shall be sealed by the public works department 3 any authorized representative of the city shall have free access to the buildings from  am to  pm monday for the purpose of inspecting all equipment of the city 4 upon violation by the owner of any of the provisions of this the city may discontinue water supply service if the public works department determines that a violation of this in fact occurred prior to making such a determination the public works department shall conduct a hearing in order to make an accurate determination the owner shall be given three days notice prior to the hearing 5 the city reserves the right to shut off the supply in case of accident alterations extensions connections or repairs of the system the city agrees to give notice when feasible 6 the city does not guarantee specific pressures in the pipe or in the mains supplying water and the city shall not be held liable for loss or damage to an owner or occupant for the inefficiency or failure of the supply of water for any cause whatever 7 when fire line valves or connections are used the owner shall immediately notify the city and the city shall forthwith program for the city and in connection therewith there is hereby adopted a cross connection control manual one copy of the manual is on file in the office of the city clerk for public use inspection and examination compliance with the manual and the cross connection program contained therein is hereby required b the manual shall be periodically reviewed by the public works department of the city to ensure compliance with applicable statutes rules and regulations of the state and the united states 1 21593 property access for cross connection control duly authorized employees of the city bearing proper credentials and identification with the consent of the owneroccupant shall be permitted to enter any building structure or property served by a connection to the public potable water supply system of the city for the purpose of inspecting the piping system or systems on such property consent to such access shall be obtained from a person 15 years of age or older in control thereof if such consent is refused the city may obtain an inspection warrant pursuant to fs  93321 2 21593 discontinued service no water service connection shall be installed or maintained by the city unless the consumer is in compliance with the requirements of the cross connection control manual service of water to any premises shall be disconnected if a backflow prevention device is not installed tested and maintained or if an unprotected cross connection exists on the premises notice shall be given to the consumer prior to discontinuing service except where in the judgment of the director of public works or his or her designee the threat to public health is such that action must be taken immediately 3 21593 protection of public potable water supply labeling the potable water supply made available on the properties served by the public potable water supply shall be protected from present or future possible contamination as specified by the cross connection control manual and by federal state and city building plumbing and water regulations or codes any water outlet which could be used for potable or domestic purposes and which is not supplied by the potable system must be labeled water unsafe for drinking or nonpotable water in a conspicuous manner 4 21593 expenses and records the consumer shall bear all expenses of installing testing and maintaining the protection devices required by the cross connection control manual to ensure proper operation on a continuing basis installation testing and maintenance of protective devices shall be conducted by certified personnel approved by the citys public works department the consumer shall notify the citys public works department at least 48 hours in advance in writing when the tests are to be undertaken so that a representative is present as a witness if the city so desires the consumer shall keep records on his testing maintenance and repair activities related to cross connection control and shall make these records available upon request copies of all testing maintenance and repair records shall be sent to the citys public works department immediately after the work is performed 5 21593 supplemental codes and rules the cross connection control manual does not supersede the plumbing code of the city the building code of the city the state safe drinking water act the federal safe drinking water acts and amendments state drinking water regulations or any other city state or federal statute ordinance rule or regulation applicable to public water supply systems but is supplementary to them when conflicts exist between the manual and such other codes and rules the more restrictive provisions shall apply 6 21593 public employees no provisions of this division designating the duties of any city officer or employee shall be so construed as to make such officer or employee liable for any fine or penalty for failure to perform such duty 8 21593 areas embraced all territory within the city and the counties of seminole and orange served by the city potable water system shall be governed by this division to the extent permitted by law 9 21593 violation all costs and expenses involved in the case each day upon which a violation of the provisions of this division shall occur shall be deemed separate and additional violations any person customer or consumer in violation of any of the provisions of this division shall become liable to the city for any expense loss or damage incurred by the city by reason of such violation including attorneys fees and court costs in addition to any penalty provided by law for the violation of any of the provisions of this division the city may bring suit in the appropriate court to enjoin restrain or otherwise development or artificial recharge of groundwater  22194 routing and construction a the city will establish a route and install a reclaimed water system based on the most cost effective method utilizing facilities in existence at the present time all expansion will be based on asneeded basis cost factors and on the number of applications received from residents wishing to connect to the reclaimed water system b developers of properties which contain or abut such routes planned or installed shall install reclaimed water systems in an approved easement to be dedicated to the city upon completion all reclaimed water systems shall be designed by a stateregistered engineer and in accordance with the regulations of the city and the dep c the city will exclusively operate and maintain the reclaimed water distribution system a developer shall design and install reclaimed water irrigation systems to maintain common areas model homes or lots all such reclaimed water irrigation systems shall be operated and maintained by the developer property owner or homeowners association no new potable water irrigation meters will be installed within an area serviced by a reclaimed water system except those used for irrigating vegetable gardens each potable water irrigation system shall be equipped with an approved crossconnection control device d all irrigation systems that are connected to reclaimed water lines shall be either inground systems or by the use of a special hose coupling as approved by the department without overspray to adjacent properties sidewalks and streets standard style and hose bib connections to the reclaimed water system are prohibited the use of reclaimed water is for irrigation purposes only it is unlawful to make connections from the reclaimed water system to any building or other conflicting source of water supply inspections of all irrigation systems installed will be made by department personnel prior to connection to the reclaimed water system e no property shall be served by both a reclaimed water irrigation meter and another irrigation source ie a potable water irrigation meter irrigation well either potable or nonpotable lake source except for commercial properties with approved backflow preventers where preapproved by the public works director  22194  i 5817 promulgation and enforcement of reclaimed water service procedures and regulations a the city manager shall have the power to promulgate procedures and regulations with respect to the following matters which procedures and regulations shall become effective upon adoption of a resolution by the city commission approving same 1 application procedures forms requirements and allowable uses other than irrigation all uses must be in accordance with applicable dep regulations 2 installation requirements including specification of acceptable materials devices and regulations to prevent backflow or crossconnections with other systems 3 procedures for enforcement of the ordinances and regulations pertaining to reclaimed water including procedures for inspection of the customers system 4 procedures for the orderly expansion of the reclaimed water system 5 procedures and regulations for the efficient operation of the reclaimed water system b notwithstanding the foregoing the director may when necessary for the efficient operation of the reclaimed water system or for the health or safety of the general public or the customer establish regulations regarding the following matters which regulations shall become effective at the time of promulgation without the need for city commission approval and regarding 1 the times of day or night during which the reclaimed water may be used by customers 2 the times or days of the week during which the reclaimed water may be used by customers 3 the maximum rate of use of the reclaimed water c no persons shall construct operate maintain or allow to remain present on property owned or controlled by him any device or system which is connected to or which controls a device or system connected to the citys reclaimed water system which is not in compliance with all provisions of dep regulation and this water shall not be directed conveyed or piped into any residence or building used as a dwelling unit the person who owns or controls the property upon which such a noncomplying device or system is found shall be liable to the city for all costs associated with the securing andor removal of the noncomplying device d any customer whose reclaimed water system is in violation of any city ordinance regulation or procedure shall be subject to immediate discontinuance of reclaimed water service the city shall disconnect reclaimed water service to any user because of tampering with any service plumbing crossconnections with another water source nonpayment of bills or for any other reason which is deemed by the department to be detrimental to the system the city shall disconnect service until the condition is corrected and all related costs are paid to the city costs payable shall include delinquent billings disconnection and reconnection charges and payment for all damages to the system should service be turned on without authorization the department shall terminate the service and the violator shall be subject to the citys general penalty provision for code violations such termination of service shall not relieve any person of liability for civil actions or from prosecution for criminal or municipal ordinance violation  22194 reclaimed water system charges and fees a charges and fees reclaimed water system development charges and fees shall be established by the commission in accordance with b as an incentive to customers within an area of planned reuse expansion and to allow the city to make as many taps as possible during construction all taps for threequarterinch or oneinch service will be made without charge a reclaimed water meter will be furnished and installed without charge and a backflow prevention device for the potable service will be installed at the cost of the device to those customers applying for service during the design period all existing potable irrigation meter systems may be transferred to the reclaimed water system without any charges during the design period upon request of the homeowner after construction has started all normal fees will be charged c a customer whose service has been terminated may resume reclaimed water service after paying any past due amounts and a reconnection fee d where service has been terminated for a violation of an ordinance or regulation regarding reclaimed water such service shall not be reconnected until the director receives adequate assurance and guarantees that such a violation will not recur e fees for reclaimed water service shall be applied to the customers monthly water bill payment shall be made in accordance with this  22194   92214 service the city shall have the right at all times to refuse to extend service should the use be detrimental to the system inadequate supply of reclaimed water lack of payment of required service charge or for any other reason which in the judgment of the director will cause a decrement to the system  22194   service interruption the city reserves the right to temporarily discontinue service unauthorized work on reclaimed water system a no person unless expressly authorized by the director or his designee shall tamper with work on or in any way alter or damage any city reclaimed water facility tampering or work shall include but is not limited to opening or closing of valves or causing of any water to flow from the system no unauthorized person shall cut into or make any connection with the system the offending person shall be liable for the cost of all charges attributable to the correction of such tampering including legal expenses but payment of or correction of such damage shall not relieve the offending person from civil or criminal penalties the city or a court of law may impose for a violation of city ordinance b the service valve located between the reclaimed water customers irrigation system and the citys distribution system may be operated by the customer only when his or her private valve required on the customers premises requires repair  22194   unauthorized use no person shall allow any reclaimed water to be consumed by any human being or animal additionally no person shall use reclaimed water for any purpose which would knowingly endanger the health of any person animal or plant  22194   inspection a to insure that all provisions of the city ordinances regulations and procedures are being observed the city reserves the right and privilege of inspecting removing andor securing any or all devices installed by the customer which connect to or control the reclaimed water 1 inspections without cause to believe that an ordinance or regulation is being violated shall be at reasonable times and shall not exceed a reasonable frequency 2 inspections where there is reasonable cause to believe that an ordinance or regulation is being violated shall be at such times and shall occur with such frequency as is necessary to establish that an ordinance or regulation is or is not being violated b each customer of reclaimed water shall by application give written consent to entry upon his or her premises and thereby waives any other written notice for such inspection failure of the city to obtain such a written waiver shall not affect the right of the city to proceed pursuant to a of this c refusing to permit an authorized city agent or employee to enter onto the premises for the purpose of inspecting the customers reclaimed water system pursuant to this constitute a violation of this shall be grounds for immediate discontinuance of the reclaimed water service by the city to the subject premises  22194   adoption of fac the
